Title: Data Insights and Optimization Analyst Intern
Description:
Company Description

Would you like to join an internship at a Coffee & Tea company that

values your future success and prioritizes your passion for positive change?

Check out this internship starting September 2024 and Unleash Your Possibility at JDE Peet's!




Company Details

At JDE Peet's (before: JACOBS DOUWE EGBERTS), we're not just about Coffee or Tea; we're all about the moments and connections they spark. With a history spanning 270 years, we've been shaping the daily rituals of people worldwide, driven by our dedication to quality products and sustainability.




We are action-driven and deliver our commitments. This means the freedom to challenge the status quo and to look for different perspectives. Our teams work by four fundamental values: We are progressive in outlook, ambitious in nature, resourceful in action and decisive in approach. These values paint the best picture of the kind of fast-moving culture you'll join at JDE Peet's.




Job Description

Join us as Data Insights and Optimization Analyst Intern at our international headquarters in Utrecht, starting in September 2024. In this internship, you'll delve into our organization's dynamic Ecosystem to extract valuable insights. You will learn how to identify and emphasize high-impact data attributes, contributing to informed business decision-making.




Your Key Activities Will Be

Conduct a comprehensive inventory of data within our Ecosystem
Analyze the usage patterns of different data attributes, identifying high-impact data fields and underutilized areas, and providing recommendations for strategic enhancements.
Quantify the volume and significance of data points associated with each field, offering a comprehensive view of our data landscape
Analyze the relation of data usage with the user profile (optional)
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather additional insights and context about data usage and dependencies
Document findings in clear and concise reports, presentations, and visualizations




Supported by a commendable 4.5 Glassdoor rating and 94% intern recommendation score, we pledge to provide you with a unique learning experience in our Data Management team. During your internship, you'll gain valuable insights into strategic data analysis and decision-making. You will collaborate with various teams, analyse different data points, and identify key areas for business improvement.




What's in it for you?

A monthly internship allowance of €525 (full-time)
Travel compensation if you don't have a free public transport card
Paid holidays for each internship term
Two weeks of remote working anywhere in Europe (EEA)
The chance to learn from the best Data Management professionals out there!




Qualifications

Are you bursting with fresh ideas and a hunger for learning? We want you!




Here's What We're Looking For

Academic Program: You are enrolled in a BSc or MSc program for the entirety of the internship, preferably in Data Analytics, Business, or a related field.
Skillset: You possess strong MS Office skills and fluent proficiency in speaking and written English – Having some similar hands-on experience with food research activities is always a benefit.
Personal traits: You have a structured approach, a driven and energetic personality, excellent communication and people skills, and the ability to work both in a team and independently.
Commitment: You are ready to dedicate at least 5 months to this internship, preferably from the 2nd of September to January.
Availability: You can join the internship for 3 - 4 days per week, including three days in-office and one or two days remotely, ensuring an ideal balance between collaboration and independence.




As we hope to have piqued your interest, please ensure you also meet the eligibility criteria and academic requirements:

Your internship should be included in your study curriculum and directly contribute to your academic results.
Your educational institution is willing to sign a collaboration agreement with JDE Peet's and when joining our Research departments, also sign an NDA agreement for internships.
You are either an EU(EEA) student residing in the Netherlands during the internship or a Non-EU(EEA) student enrolled and living in the Netherlands during the internship.




Additional Information

Are you ready to Unleash Your Possibility within JDE Peet's?




Here's How To Apply

Upload your resume (in English) using our LinkedIn or career site application form.
After applying, we'll reach out within three weeks to let you know what's next.
During the application process, you'll be asked to do an online assessment and at least one interview at our Utrecht office.




If you have questions, don't hesitate to contact our Campus team at IHQinternships@jdecoffee.com -- We're here to help!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My logistics client in Rotterdam are looking for a data analyst to join their growing team. They specialise in the transport of chemicals and are growing out their analytics capability, so are looking for an experienced profile who can help them make data-driven decisions




Responsibilities:

- Collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, both internal and external.

- Cleaning and validating data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability.

- Analyzing complex datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools.

- Developing and maintaining databases, data systems, and dashboards for reporting purposes.

- Identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in data sets to support business objectives.

- Creating comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Requirements:

• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (data science, computer science, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

• Strong SQL skills

• Knowledge of PowerBI is ideal but not required

• Fluent Dutch-speaking

• Experience with stakeholder management is a plus but not required




Salary Package:

• Up to €75,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• Hybrid working and flexible working hours

• Annual bonus. (depending on the company performance)




Make sure to apply or reach me on the following:




Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

Number: +31203997864

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Analist bij Tremoot

Bij Tremoot zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Data Analist met uitgebreide ervaring in Power BI. Als je gepassioneerd bent over data visualisatie en graag werkt in een dynamische omgeving waar kwaliteit en privacy/security hoog in het vaandel staan, dan is deze rol perfect voor jou.




Waarom Tremoot?

Platte Organisatie: Geniet van directe en duidelijke communicatie.
Cultuur: Maak deel uit van een nieuwsgierig, betrokken en persoonlijk team. Voel je thuis!
Ontwikkeling: We benadrukken groei en ondersteunen voortdurende certificering en kennisdeling.
Plezier: Doe mee aan leuke teamuitjes en regelmatige bijeenkomsten die de teamgeest versterken!
Diversiteit en Inclusie: Ervaar een levendige mix van culturen met ons team van expats en externe medewerkers.
Gemeenschap: Bij Tremoot ben je meer dan alleen een medewerker - je bent een essentieel onderdeel van onze levendige gemeenschap.




Wat bieden wij?

Contract: Een vaste rol binnen een vooruitstrevend team.
Salaris: Competitief salaris dat past bij je ervaring en vaardigheden.
Reiskostenvergoeding: NS-businesskaart voor je reisbehoeften.
Vakantiedagen: 25 vakantiedagen om te ontspannen en op te laden.
Technologie: Je ontvangt een bedrijfslaptop voor professioneel gebruik.
Leren: Profiteer van een jaarlijks budget van €1000 voor professionele ontwikkeling.




Jouw Rol als Data Analist:

Ontwikkelen en onderhouden van datavisualisaties en rapportages met Power BI en Power BI Report Builder.
Samenwerken in Agile/Scrum teams om projecten te realiseren die voldoen aan de hoogste normen van kwaliteit en privacy/security.
Analyseren van data om inzichten te verschaffen die strategische besluitvorming ondersteunen.




Wat heb je nodig?

Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring.
Ervaring met data analyse en visualistie met PowerBI en PowerBI Report Builder.
Bekend met Agile en Scrum en kunt dit in de praktijk toepassen.
Nauwkeurig werkend, met oog voor kwaliteit en privacy/security aspecten.
Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.
HBO werk- en denkniveau.




Geïnteresseerd?

Ben je klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging en wil je deel uitmaken van een vooruitstrevend team? Solliciteer nu bij Tremoot! We kijken ernaar uit om je aan boord te verwelkomen en zien uit naar jouw bijdrage aan onze gemeenschap!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description: In this role, you will be the key link between Commercial and Finance teams. You will be the Subject Matter Expert responsible for Sales Force Metrics and Performance & KPI tracking. You will also coordinate contract management in collaboration with Sales, Legal, and the EMEA contract management team. Your role involves providing sales, volume, and financial analysis to evaluate business opportunities and generate market intelligence presentations for internal and external use. Occasionally, you may join customer meetings as a consultant. You should possess strong business acumen, combined with analytical and local thinking, to translate data into actionable commercial strategies and reports.




Responsibilities:

Act as the local admin and champion for Salesforce (SFDC).
Gather and share market data and insights (GFK) to detect and share market opportunities.
Conduct commercial customer analysis on category, channel, distribution, and product.
Provide in-depth analysis for Strategic Partner Accounts.
Coordinate and follow up on contract management.
Process third-party sell-out data and update the Customer Performance Dashboard (Excel).
Collaborate closely with National Sales Managers (NSMs) to support SFDC KPI metrics and performance reporting.
Provide volume and financial analysis to evaluate financial results.
Create toolkits for field sales representatives to enhance business opportunities.
Analyze the market for new products and trends, identifying opportunities and potential threats.
Support and implement regional and local strategies with the Benelux commercial team.
Work with Marketing on campaign processes, registration, and tracking.
Handle customer contract administration with local Key Account Management and regional headquarters to ensure a smooth contract process.
Manage and maintain the CRM system as the admin for Salesforce (territory management, user setup, data validation, managing sales reps, reporting, and dashboards).
Handle customer segmentation from a finance perspective, in consultation with the regional manager.
Consult with the EMEA team about data quality and make necessary changes (Cognos, SFDC, Oracle).
Produce ad-hoc reports as needed.




Candidate Profile:

Start as soon as possible, with a one-year contract and potential for permanent hire.
36-40 hours per week.
1-3 years of experience;
Strong knowledge and experience with Excel are a must.
Experience with Salesforce, SQL, and/or Tableau is a plus.
Reports to the Business Controller.
Salary between €45,000 and €65,000 depending on experience, with an annual performance bonus of approximately 10%.
30 vacation days.
Background in economics/finance.
Team player who enjoys being in the office, proactive, good at data interpretation and presentation, and enjoys interacting with colleagues and stakeholders.
Fluent in Dutch.
Hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, 2 days at home.
Affinity with medical devices is considered a plus.




Qualifications:

Hard Skills:

Experience with Business and financial analysis
Superior Excel skills (pivot tables, macros, lookups, sum if, complex link files)
Database management (Cognos and preferably Tableau)
Project management
Computer skills (word processing, spreadsheet, database tools, design tools, and presentation/chart applications)
Salesforce
Forecasting and statistical modeling
Advanced database and Excel skills
Cognos reporting and Hyperion (training can be provided)
Relevant degree (business/management/economics/finance)

Soft Skills:

Effective communication across all levels
High accuracy and attention to detail
Fluent in Dutch and English
Commercial mindset
Excellent analytical skills
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Teamwork and collaboration
Proactive and self-motivated
Adaptability and flexibility




Desired Skills and Experience

Excel (pivot tables, macros, lookups)

Salesforce (SFDC)

SQL

Tableau

Cognos

Oracle

Hyperion

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Consultant: werken als Data Engineer, Data Analyst, Bi Consultant of Data Scientist?




Ben jij op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging met afwisseling én een goede werk-privébalans? Dan zou Datamo wel eens de plek voor jou kunnen zijn! Bij Datamo haal je het beste uit jezelf door veel kennis en ervaring op te doen bij toonaangevende organisaties. Samen met jou stellen we een persoonlijk ontwikkelplan op, zodat je specifieke expertise kunt opdoen en de gewenste opleidingen kunt volgen.




Ontvang bij Datamo een compleet pakket, zoals een salaris tot € 7.000 bruto per maand, jaarlijks 35 vrij op te nemen dagen, en bepaal zelf hoe je naar je opdrachtgevers reist met behulp van een mobiliteitsbudget, vrij te besteden voor eigen vervoer of een leaseauto (zoals een Tesla Model 3).




De functie

Als Data Consultant bij Datamo krijg je de kans om jouw talenten te benutten en waardevolle ervaring op te doen bij diverse spraakmakende opdrachtgevers als financiële instellingen zoals de ING of overheidsorganisaties zoals ministeries of overige organisaties zoals KLM, NS en nog veel meer. Bij Datamo werk je op projectbasis, van 3 maanden tot 1 jaar, of indien gewenst zelfs langer. Je werkt in diverse rollen, zoals Data Engineer, Data Analyst of Data Scientist, afhankelijk van jouw voorkeur, ervaring en expertise. Voor wat jouw specifieke opdracht betreft zullen wij verschillende keuzes aan je voorleggen. Jij bepaalt uiteindelijk helemaal zelf welke opdracht je gaat uitvoeren, want wij willen niets liever dan dat jij op een plek zit die helemaal bij je past




Jouw taken

Het exacte takenpakket hangt volledig af van de opdracht die je gaat vervullen en natuurlijk ook van de organisatie waarvoor je aan de slag gaat.




Onderstaande taken kun je onder andere verwachten bij verschillende rollen als Data Consultant:

• Data analyseren om belangrijke patronen en trends te ontdekken

• Data Clustering, Data Mining en Data Visualisatie.

• Gesprekspartner zijn voor eindgebruikers om visualisaties optimaal te maken

• Data integreren voor het optimaliseren van analyses.

• Advies verstrekken over het effectief gebruiken van data voor besluitvorming.

• Rapporten opstellen om complexe data inzichtelijk te maken voor collega’s.

• Het ontwikkelen van producten en innovatieve modellen goed laten samengaan met software-oplossingen.




Wie zoeken wij?

Wij zoeken een enthousiaste en leergierige collega die het leuk vindt projectmatig ervaring op te doen in diverse branches, organisaties en functies. Daarnaast:

Heb je minimaal 2 jaar relevante werkervaring.
Ben je in het bezit van een hbo-/wo-diploma.
Ben je in staat goede relaties op te bouwen en te onderhouden met onze opdrachtgevers.
Weet jij wel raad met Python, R, VBA, JavaScript, Power BI (Tableau, Qlik), SQL, Excel en Azure/AWS.
Beschik je over sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.
Heb je een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal (schrijven en spreken).




Wat kun je verwachten van Datamo?

Datamo is onderdeel van de grotere ‘Thuis van’-formule, wat betekent dat je onderdeel bent van een grotere organisatie bestaande uit 75 collega’s, die werkzaam zijn bij Datamo (Data Specialisten), Entrador (Business Analisten), Specktor (Product Owners) en Strates (Roostersoftware Specialisten). Onderling delen we kennis en netwerk met elkaar. Allen met dezelfde normen en waarden: het creëren van een thuisgevoel, het beste uit iedereen halen door jou zo goed mogelijk te faciliteren.




Datamo is een platte organisatie, je vindt bij ons geen onnodige directie of managementlagen, maar wel korte communicatielijnen. Jouw potentieel en geluk staan centraal, en wij willen jou daar graag in ondersteunen. Je bent bij ons zeker geen nummer, maar wel een hele belangrijke collega!

En laten we eerlijk zijn, bij Datamo wordt “data crunchen” ineens een stuk gezelliger. We combineren vakinhoudelijke ontwikkeling met sociale activiteiten, zodat je niet alleen groeit in je vakgebied, maar ook in je connecties binnen het team. We organiseren regelmatig groepsactiviteiten waarbij geldt dat je niet moet, maar mag deelnemen!

Last but not least… Bij Datamo is de balans tussen werk en privé erg belangrijk. Niet voor niets geven we je 35 vrij op te nemen dagen per jaar en overwerken staat niet in ons vocabulaire.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Een uitstekend salaris tussen de € 4.500 en € 7.000 bruto per maand bestaande uit een vast en een variabel component;
35 vrij op te nemen dagen per jaar;
Een meer dan goede pensioenregeling;
Mobiliteitsbudget, vrij te besteden voor flexibel zakelijk vervoer: NS, fiets, taxi, Uber, deelauto, je eigen auto etc. en/of te besteden voor een eigen leaseauto.
Een MacBook Air;
Een maandelijkse telefoonvergoeding;
Gezellige uitjes, georganiseerd door en voor Datamo collega’s!
Waardevolle (in-house) trainings- en kennissessies;
Goede opleidingsmogelijkheden, ‘’the sky is the limit’’;
Meerdere interessante bonusregelingen voor bijvoorbeeld het aandragen van nieuwe collega’s.
Een fijne werkplek in ons monumentale pand in het centrum van het mooie Amersfoort.




Enthousiast geworden?

Klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging? Solliciteer nu en haal alles uit jouw carrière met interessante projecten en kansen om je vaardigheden te ontwikkelen!

Wil je eerst vrijblijvend met een van je toekomstige collega’s praten over waarom je bij Datamo zou willen werken en wat zij doen qua opdrachten? Dat kan natuurlijk ook! We brengen je graag in contact!.

Show more
HTML:
Data Consultant: werken als Data Engineer, Data Analyst, Bi Consultant of Data Scientist?


Ben jij op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging met afwisseling én een goede werk-privébalans? Dan zou Datamo wel eens de plek voor jou kunnen zijn! Bij Datamo haal je het beste uit jezelf door veel kennis en ervaring op te doen bij toonaangevende organisaties. Samen met jou stellen we een persoonlijk ontwikkelplan op, zodat je specifieke expertise kunt opdoen en de gewenste opleidingen kunt volgen.


Ontvang bij Datamo een compleet pakket, zoals een salaris tot € 7.000 bruto per maand, jaarlijks 35 vrij op te nemen dagen, en bepaal zelf hoe je naar je opdrachtgevers reist met behulp van een mobiliteitsbudget, vrij te besteden voor eigen vervoer of een leaseauto (zoals een Tesla Model 3).


De functie

Als Data Consultant bij Datamo krijg je de kans om jouw talenten te benutten en waardevolle ervaring op te doen bij diverse spraakmakende opdrachtgevers als financiële instellingen zoals de ING of overheidsorganisaties zoals ministeries of overige organisaties zoals KLM, NS en nog veel meer. Bij Datamo werk je op projectbasis, van 3 maanden tot 1 jaar, of indien gewenst zelfs langer. Je werkt in diverse rollen, zoals Data Engineer, Data Analyst of Data Scientist, afhankelijk van jouw voorkeur, ervaring en expertise. Voor wat jouw specifieke opdracht betreft zullen wij verschillende keuzes aan je voorleggen. Jij bepaalt uiteindelijk helemaal zelf welke opdracht je gaat uitvoeren, want wij willen niets liever dan dat jij op een plek zit die helemaal bij je past


Jouw taken

Het exacte takenpakket hangt volledig af van de opdracht die je gaat vervullen en natuurlijk ook van de organisatie waarvoor je aan de slag gaat.


Onderstaande taken kun je onder andere verwachten bij verschillende rollen als Data Consultant:

• Data analyseren om belangrijke patronen en trends te ontdekken

• Data Clustering, Data Mining en Data Visualisatie.

• Gesprekspartner zijn voor eindgebruikers om visualisaties optimaal te maken

• Data integreren voor het optimaliseren van analyses.

• Advies verstrekken over het effectief gebruiken van data voor besluitvorming.

• Rapporten opstellen om complexe data inzichtelijk te maken voor collega’s.

• Het ontwikkelen van producten en innovatieve modellen goed laten samengaan met software-oplossingen.


Wie zoeken wij?

Wij zoeken een enthousiaste en leergierige collega die het leuk vindt projectmatig ervaring op te doen in diverse branches, organisaties en functies. Daarnaast:

  • Heb je minimaal 2 jaar relevante werkervaring.
  • Ben je in het bezit van een hbo-/wo-diploma.
  • Ben je in staat goede relaties op te bouwen en te onderhouden met onze opdrachtgevers.
  • Weet jij wel raad met Python, R, VBA, JavaScript, Power BI (Tableau, Qlik), SQL, Excel en Azure/AWS.
  • Beschik je over sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.
  • Heb je een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal (schrijven en spreken).


Wat kun je verwachten van Datamo?

Datamo is onderdeel van de grotere ‘Thuis van’-formule, wat betekent dat je onderdeel bent van een grotere organisatie bestaande uit 75 collega’s, die werkzaam zijn bij Datamo (Data Specialisten), Entrador (Business Analisten), Specktor (Product Owners) en Strates (Roostersoftware Specialisten). Onderling delen we kennis en netwerk met elkaar. Allen met dezelfde normen en waarden: het creëren van een thuisgevoel, het beste uit iedereen halen door jou zo goed mogelijk te faciliteren.


Datamo is een platte organisatie, je vindt bij ons geen onnodige directie of managementlagen, maar wel korte communicatielijnen. Jouw potentieel en geluk staan centraal, en wij willen jou daar graag in ondersteunen. Je bent bij ons zeker geen nummer, maar wel een hele belangrijke collega!

En laten we eerlijk zijn, bij Datamo wordt “data crunchen” ineens een stuk gezelliger. We combineren vakinhoudelijke ontwikkeling met sociale activiteiten, zodat je niet alleen groeit in je vakgebied, maar ook in je connecties binnen het team. We organiseren regelmatig groepsactiviteiten waarbij geldt dat je niet moet, maar mag deelnemen!

Last but not least… Bij Datamo is de balans tussen werk en privé erg belangrijk. Niet voor niets geven we je 35 vrij op te nemen dagen per jaar en overwerken staat niet in ons vocabulaire.


Wat bieden wij jou?

  • Een uitstekend salaris tussen de € 4.500 en € 7.000 bruto per maand bestaande uit een vast en een variabel component;
  • 35 vrij op te nemen dagen per jaar;
  • Een meer dan goede pensioenregeling;
  • Mobiliteitsbudget, vrij te besteden voor flexibel zakelijk vervoer: NS, fiets, taxi, Uber, deelauto, je eigen auto etc. en/of te besteden voor een eigen leaseauto.
  • Een MacBook Air;
  • Een maandelijkse telefoonvergoeding;
  • Gezellige uitjes, georganiseerd door en voor Datamo collega’s!
  • Waardevolle (in-house) trainings- en kennissessies;
  • Goede opleidingsmogelijkheden, ‘’the sky is the limit’’;
  • Meerdere interessante bonusregelingen voor bijvoorbeeld het aandragen van nieuwe collega’s.
  • Een fijne werkplek in ons monumentale pand in het centrum van het mooie Amersfoort.


Enthousiast geworden?

Klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging? Solliciteer nu en haal alles uit jouw carrière met interessante projecten en kansen om je vaardigheden te ontwikkelen!

Wil je eerst vrijblijvend met een van je toekomstige collega’s praten over waarom je bij Datamo zou willen werken en wat zij doen qua opdrachten? Dat kan natuurlijk ook! We brengen je graag in contact!.

Title: Data analist, Nieuw-Vennep
Description:
Wil jij als data analist je skills inzetten voor een groeiend bedrijf? Bij onze klant krijg je de kans om strategieën te ontwikkelen en te werken aan groei!

Over de functie

Wat ga je doen?


Optimaliseren van bestelalgoritmen en voorraadbeheer.
Verzamelen en analyseren van productdata en marges.
Creëren van meetbare tools in Excel en Channable.
Proactief retouren verminderen en levertijden verbeteren met behulp van data.
Uitvoeren van waardevolle analyses.


Over het bedrijf

Het bedrijf is een snelgroeiende webshop in telefoonhoesjes en accessoires, gevestigd in een ruim en gezellig pand. Je wordt onderdeel van een team van 25 enthousiaste medewerkers die samen streven naar efficiëntie en kwaliteit.

Wat is jouw achtergrond en ervaring?


Ervaring met Excel en data-analyse.
Gestructureerd en oog voor detail.
Resultaatgericht en verbeteringsgericht.
Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal.
If you don't speak Dutch, there's no point in applying.


Ben jij klaar voor deze uitdaging? Solliciteer nu en wie weet word jij de nieuwe data analist!

Let op: een online assessment maakt deel uit van de procedure.

Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?

Je Komt Te Werken Binnen Een Gezellige Organisatie Met Een Enthousiast Team! Heb Jij Ideeën Of Oplossingen, Dat Is Helemaal Top! Want Meedenken Wordt Erg Gewaardeerd Binnen Dit Bedrijf. Als Je Aan De Slag Gaat Als Data Analist Kun Je Rekenen Op Het Volgende


Parttime/fulltime positie met een marktconform salaris van ca. € 3000,- bruto per maand.
Dynamische werkomgeving met veel verantwoordelijkheid.
Gezellige teamuitjes en borrels met tafeltennis of Mario Kart.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join a dynamic consultancy at the forefront of leveraging data to drive impactful insights and innovations across various sectors. As a Data Analyst at our client’s company, you will play a major role in transforming raw data into actionable strategies for some of the most influential organizations in banking, government, and non-profit sectors in the Netherlands. Their work spans from enhancing financial security to streamlining governmental processes and empowering non-profits to maximize their outreach.




Your Role




As a Data Analyst, you will harness your expertise in data analysis and visualization to uncover critical insights from customer data. Your responsibilities will include




Developing clear and insightful visualizations to facilitate decision-making.
Collaborating closely with clients to understand their needs and deliver tailored solutions.
Proposing enhancements to data quality and infrastructure to sustainably maximize data value.
Engaging with both business stakeholders and IT teams to ensure alignment and effectiveness of data initiatives.




Ideal Candidate




A minimum of 2 years in complex data environments.
Proficiency in tools like Tableau, Power BI, Oracle BI, Python, and/or R.
Strong familiarity with SQL and data-related concepts such as ETL, data modeling, and data visualization.
A degree in a relevant field and a passion for turning data into actionable insights.
Dutch speaker




The good part




A competitive salary starting from €3500 gross per month, depending on experience
Monthly & Annual performance bonuses
Pension plan.
Mobility allowance or company car
Up to 27 days of vacation annually
A lovely work environment where your ideas directly impact success of the company
Opportunities for career advancement and personal development in a flat organizational structure




Do you see yourself in the job description?




Apply directly or send your CV at g.apostolou@jeffersonfrank.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Haarlem/Hybrid




As a Data Analyst/Engineer, you work with customer data to uncover valuable insights. Your goal is to visualize and present these insights in the most comprehensible way, ensuring that even those unfamiliar with data can understand. Your contributions drive the success of strategies and aid companies in their growth and innovation.




You propose improvements to the data landscape and data quality, aiming to create sustainable value in both the short and long term. You foster connections within the client's organization, engaging with both business and IT sectors. You swiftly identify which data analyses will be valuable, producing realistic and actionable insights.




If you thrive in a data-rich environment and enjoy extracting value from vast datasets, this role will suit you perfectly.




You have:

At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst in complex data environments.
A keen eye for detail and a passion for accuracy.
Strong communication skills and the ability to understand customer needs.
Experience with data analytics and visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, Oracle BI, Python, and R.
Familiarity with ETL, data modeling, data quality, and data visualization.
Proficiency in SQL.
Fluency in Dutch.




We offer a career with growth prospects within a vibrant community of enthusiasts. Your work directly impacts both our organization and our clients, giving you significant responsibility in a challenging role where passion and the opportunity to enhance the 'Customer Experience' through data analysis are key. We are a flat organization where everyone knows each other and fun is a priority.




We offer:

24 vacation days per year (increasing to 27).
A monthly performance bonus.
Eligibility for an annual bonus.
A solid pension plan.
A company car or mobility scheme.
An annual trip abroad!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
You and your job

The work you do will impact your team and your internal and external stakeholders, and ultimately also the client servicing process and therefore the bank’s core business. Our Data Chapter colleagues have been able to incorporate sophisticated data sources into the latest projects. The projects vary from the credit risk to the reporting domain. This directly impacts the way Rabobank actively serves its clients. Also it directly contributes to the bank’s financial stability and allows the regulators to see we’re in control.

Practical Examples


Source Data for Credit Risk Models
Historical Datasets of 20 years.
Analysing Databases.


Facts & Figures


36 or 40 hours per week
43,000 Rabobank colleagues around the world


Top 4 Responsibilities


Analysis and determination of the scope of data to be archived to Modeldata-HiSDA (Highly Secured Data Archive) of a decomissioned system.
Analysis and determination of the scope of sources from GDP to Modeldata- HiSDA. Due to GDPR retention.
Reasoning from the mandate for HiSDA and data products in these analyses.
Guiding the team on how to store data so it can be used for Credit Modelling.


As a Data Analyst you will be working in the Chapter Data. You will be working on projects mainly focused on Credit Modelling and will collaborate a lot with different colleagues in the Tribe Data Factory and Tribe Credit Analytics.

Together we achieve more than alone

We believe in the power of diversity. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our Chapter Data Modelling & Insights.

“As member in the Area Model Data you are working together in a very motivated hybride team of 14 people who are focused on data archiving and sourcing for Credit Risk Modelling”

Arjan Schoutens, Product Manager Modeldata

Around 240 professionals in Chapter Data, are teaming up in several area’s and squads to support the tribes within our finance and risk domain of the bank. Working together is the way we work; as one creative problem solving team of experts at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,500,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

You and your talent


You have a Master degree in a quantitative field or IT, or Finance/Economics.
You have at least 3-5 years relevant banking experience within the financial industries sector.
You have strong analytical and conceptual skills and you have gained experience in working with large volumes of data in complex data structures (un-transparent, low quality). MS SQL code is a must have, some Python is helpful too.
Banking knowledge is preferred, especially of credit risk, financial markets and corporate banking products and processes, and how this is translated into data flows.
Strong communication skills in English, both spoken and written


This Is What We Offer You


A gross annual salary between € 4.292,- and € 6.130,- per month based on 36 hours per week. Scale 9 (depending on your experience and seniority).
thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance.
an extra budget of 11% (depending on scale) of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.
a pension scheme to which you contribute 3.5% or 5.5%.


This is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Analyst based on a 36 hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.

You and the job application process


Any questions about the job content? Contact: Ryan Bartlett, Chapter Lead, ryan.bartlett@rabobank.nl.
Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Lex Verwayen, Corporate Recruiter via lex.verwayen@rabobank.nl.
We will hold the interviews through a video call.
You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.


#dataanalyst #rabobank #creditrisk

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🔵 Capitole is still growing and we want to do it with you! 🚀




We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst responsible to create reports and provide insights into our portfolio. You will analyze how much capacity is being utilized and make clear the phases in which projects are. Additionally, your tasks will include delivering an overview of data processes and contributing to uniformity for the Portfolio Managers.







🤖 Responsabilities and requirements:




Analyze capacity utilization, Clarify project phases, Deliver data process overviews, standardize for Portfolio Managers, Align supply and demand using S&OP.
Ensure correct data in the Business Project unit, perform independent data analyses, resolve issues by liaising with the business.
Communicate across organizational layers, collaborate with the Analysis and Reporting Team, foster support for high-quality data delivery and use.
Transform ad-hoc data issues into structural solutions, standardize data processes for Portfolio Management, propose improvements from analyses, clarify the data landscape for Portfolio Management.
Link systems based on data models, automate portfolio consolidation, build mechanisms to ensure data quality.







🛠️ Technical Requirements:

Completed education at a university level or higher professional education with conceptual thinking ability.
At least 3-5 years in projects requiring collaboration with various organizational units and management levels.
Preferably, experience in an organization with many stakeholders and a complex data landscape.
Familiarity with PowerBI and PowerQuery, ability to quickly master a data landscape, experience with a grid operator (preferred), experience with SAP (preferred).
Strong analytical insight, good with numbers, ability to distinguish between main and side issues, convert data into information for process proposals at operational and tactical levels.







🎉 Why Capitole?

🤝 Our employees come first. We believe in a different, more human model, placing people at the center of our company.

📜 Permanent contract
💵 Competitive salary range: 4000-6000 €
🌴 Holiday allowance
🚗 Mobility allowance (depending on seniority)
🎁 Bonus: 10% on top of the year salary
📚 Training budget: 1200 € per year
💼 Pension scheme contribution
💻 IT supplies
🏠💼 Hybrid working (1 time per week on Wednesday)
💼 Work 4 days per week




Don't know us yet? Discover us!!

https://capitole-consulting.com/




Don't hesitate to send us your profile, we are looking forward to meeting you! ☎📩

  • Communicate across organizational layers, collaborate with the Analysis and Reporting Team, foster support for high-quality data delivery and use.
  • Transform ad-hoc data issues into structural solutions, standardize data processes for Portfolio Management, propose improvements from analyses, clarify the data landscape for Portfolio Management.
  • Link systems based on data models, automate portfolio consolidation, build mechanisms to ensure data quality.



🛠️ Technical Requirements:

  • Completed education at a university level or higher professional education with conceptual thinking ability.
  • At least 3-5 years in projects requiring collaboration with various organizational units and management levels.
  • Preferably, experience in an organization with many stakeholders and a complex data landscape.
  • Familiarity with PowerBI and PowerQuery, ability to quickly master a data landscape, experience with a grid operator (preferred), experience with SAP (preferred).
  • Strong analytical insight, good with numbers, ability to distinguish between main and side issues, convert data into information for process proposals at operational and tactical levels.



🎉 Why Capitole?

🤝 Our employees come first. We believe in a different, more human model, placing people at the center of our company.

  • 📜 Permanent contract
  • 💵 Competitive salary range: 4000-6000 €
  • 🌴 Holiday allowance
  • 🚗 Mobility allowance (depending on seniority)
  • 🎁 Bonus: 10% on top of the year salary
  • 📚 Training budget: 1200 € per year
  • 💼 Pension scheme contribution
  • 💻 IT supplies
  • 🏠💼 Hybrid working (1 time per week on Wednesday)
  • 💼 Work 4 days per week


Don't know us yet? Discover us!!

https://capitole-consulting.com/


Don't hesitate to send us your profile, we are looking forward to meeting you! ☎📩

Title: Data Analyst Fraude
Description:
Ben jij een expert in data-analyse en gemotiveerd om fraude binnen de logistiek aan te pakken? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou! Wij zoeken een enthousiaste Data Analyst die helpt bij het ontdekken en voorkomen van fraude binnen ons snelgroeiende Logistieke tech bedrijf.

Dit ga je doen


Je analyseert alle data (denk hierbij aan gereden routes, uitgevoerde scans, en Lost in Mail data) om fraude binnen onze logistieke processen te identificeren én voorkomen
Je neemt de regie in het uitvoeren van steekproeven en overlegt met stakeholders zoals bol., verkooppartners, Depot Managers en Bezorgers
Je werkt nauw samen met andere Data Analysten om processen op het gebied van fraudepreventie en rapportages te verbeteren. Je stelt zelf rapportages op en identificeert verbetermogelijkheden
Je werkt daarnaast ook intensief samen met onze Asset Protection Consultant voor het uitvoeren van recherchewerkzaamheden bij vermoeden van fraude.



Dit ben jij


Je hebt minimaal een jaar werkervaring in een soortgelijke data-analyse rol
Je hebt kennis en ervaring in dashboarding, BigQuery, en SQL
Je hebt affiniteit met data en Excel kent voor jou geen geheimen!
Je kunt zelfstandig werken en weet processen naar data te vertalen
Je hebt oog voor detail en een analytische geest
Ervaring binnen de logistieke sector is een pre



Dit krijg je van ons


Een toffe job in een snelgroeiende scale-up omgeving
Ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling en groei binnen het bedrijf.Bruto jaarinkomen vanaf € 40.000, - tot € 55.000, - (op fulltime basis, inclusief vakantiegeld) afhankelijk van je ervaring
Als wij onze bedrijfsdoelen behalen kom je in aanmerking voor een aantrekkelijke bonus van maximaal 10%
Je gaat aan de slag bij een gecertificeerde “World Class Workplace” 😊
We vinden het leuk om naast werk dingen te ondernemen, zoals gave rally's, een American picknick, een sportief middagje wielrennen en uiteraard ons populaire Padel toernooi
29 vakantiedagen op basis van een fulltime contract, reiskostenvergoeding en een fijne pensioenregeling



Dit zijn wij

Wij zorgen ervoor dat de pakketjes van onze grote broer bol binnen 24 uur op hun bestemming zijn. Dat doen we door ons vooral te concentreren op de verzender van het pakketje, in plaats van op de ontvanger. Dankzij onze kennis van en passie voor hypermoderne tech halen we superefficiënt de pakketjes bij ondernemers op en zorgen dat ze vliegensvlug bij de klant zijn: vaak nog dezelfde dag. Klimaatneutraal en met eerlijke voorwaarden voor onze bezorgers.

Dit vinden wij belangrijkBij Ampère kan iedereen zichzelf zijn. Ongeacht afkomst, geaardheid of interesses. We moedigen een zo divers mogelijke groep collega’s juist aan. Want al die verschillen, maken van ons een leukere en sterkere onderneming.

Title: Data-analist
HTML:
Zin om impact te maken? Bij ons krijg je de mogelijkheid om projecten zelf te gaan leiden. Hiervoor zoeken we een sociale analist die conclusies kan trekken uit data maar deze conclusies ook kan vertalen naar acties. We zijn een snelgroeiende tech scale-up met grote ambities en we kunnen jouw hulp goed gebruiken.


Wat ga je doen?

YoungOnes is een ambitieus tech-platform dat jong talent verbindt met opdrachtgevers binnen Nederland, Engeland en Frankrijk. Vanuit de rol als data analist ben jij verantwoordelijk om te zoeken naar nieuwe inzichten, kansen of risico’s. Als je deze hebt gevonden, stopt jouw werk niet. Je gaat actief aan de slag om projecten te initiëren en te leiden zodat jouw analyses impact maken. Wij geloven dat projecten moeten starten en eindigen met data als we de juiste richting op willen, wie beter kan hier de drijvende kracht achter zijn dan jij?

Je komt te werken binnen een vijfkoppige business intelligence afdeling waarvan jij de zesde aanwinst gaat zijn. Vanuit jouw rol sta je echter in nauw contact met de rest van de organisatie. Het formaat van onze afdeling maakt dat we snel en effectief zijn. Door de snelle groei van het bedrijf is het onze taak om iedereen scherp te houden op wat, waar gebeurt en hoe het beter kan. We analyseren voortdurend data om verbeterpunten te identificeren en communiceren deze bevindingen helder aan alle stakeholders. Dit doen we met data vanuit de Azure stack met daarbovenop Databricks en Power BI.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een salaris tussen de €3.000 en €5.000 bruto per maand (afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring);
  • 32,5 vakantiedagen;
  • Kwartaalbonus afhankelijk van het bedrijfsresultaat;
  • Een laptop, telefoon, toetsenbord en muis van de zaak;
  • Sportbudget van €150 per jaar;
  • Meebouwen aan, en groeien met, onze internationale scale-up;
  • Een fantastische werksfeer (al zegt iedereen dat natuurlijk, het is het waard om te benoemen);
  • Veel ruimte (en de middelen) voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling en de vrijheid om je dag binnen de sprint zelf in te richten zoals je wilt;
  • Fijne extra’s zoals: Dagelijks heerlijke verse lunches, een jaarlijks groot festival, padeltoernooien en incentive reizen zoals een wintersport.


Wie ben jij?

  • HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau;
  • Minimaal 2 jaar relevante werkervaring;
  • Communicatief en sociaal;
  • Ervaring met analyses vanuit Python en SQL;
  • Ervaring met Power BI is een pré;
  • Ervaring als projectmanager is een pré;
  • Je hebt zin om vanuit data YoungOnes te veranderen;
  • Je bent niet bang voor verantwoordelijkheid.

Title: Senior Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Senior Analyst

NielsenIQ


Retail Analytics for Jumbo supermarkets - Amstelveen, Netherlands


About The Job

Senior Analyst will work in Retail Analytics Team to support the implementation of client solutions and deliver analytical projects to build customer-centric strategies for NIQ’s Client (Jumbo supermarket) based in the Netherlands.

The person will be accessing, analyzing and interpreting customer and transactional data to facilitate the implementation of NIQ’s CRM Marketing, Insights and solutions in collaboration with Jumbo.

Responsibilities


Work cross-functionally to deliver and present actionable customer insights to senior stakeholders at Jumbo (the 2nd largest retailer in the Netherlands) with ability to convey complex analytical subjects to less-analytical audiences
Deliver projects and reports analyzing the shopping behavior of over 3 mil Loyalty program members to drive customer strategy
Collaborate with Central (R&D) teams to configure and implement advanced models that deliver over 1 billion personal offers each year to Jumbo’s customers
Lead projects that forecast, measure and quantify the results of marketing campaigns and programs
Own the delivery of multiple and concurrent analytical projects
Find efficiencies by identifying faster and simpler ways to deliver ongoing customer reports
Always look out and experiment with different techniques/methods to improve existing solutions
Managing initiatives with a ‘get things done’ mentality and strong sense of ownership
Ability to work under stress, sometimes due to tight deadlines
Strong presentation skills including the ability to convey often complex analytical subjects to less-analytical audiences


About Retail Analytics Team

The unit specializes in delivering bespoke analytical projects to improve Jumbo’s Customer program and Supplier interaction programs. By applying a ‘can do’ attitude, translate NielsenIQ’s solutions and recommendations into tangible benefits for our client and support their strategies.

Requirements


Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, Economics, Econometrics, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science or similar
2+ years of directly related work experience in Retailer / Marketing / CRM analytics
Proficiency in working with statistical and econometric models in marketing to support clients in preferably Retail and CPG areas
Background from working in other data-rich B2C industries can be considered
Proficiency in using SQL
Python knowledge is advantage
A consultant mindset in problem diagnosis and actionable solution proposes based on data and data analysis
Ability to communicate insights from data using narratives and visualizations
Good team spirit
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint


What We Can Offer


Direct impact to the client business with his/her recommendations and deliveries
Possibility to learn CRM and Jumbo’s edge cutting personalized loyalty program
Work with in the international environment


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🔵 Capitole is still growing and we want to do it with you! 🚀




We are seeking a Data Information Analyst with 4 years of experience to join our client working in the transportation sector. You will be part of Data analyst eam that values autonomy and open feedback. Your role will directly impact millions of daily train travelers by enhancing our travel information application to ensure timely communication of schedule changes.




🤖 Responsabilities and requirements:

Develop and improve data warehouse and BI reports for the commercial department.
Conduct data analyses to support strategic decisions.
Engage with stakeholders to understand and translate business needs into user stories.
Collaborate with the scrum team to refine approaches and assess impacts.
Ensure product quality and stability, providing and implementing improvements.




🛠️ Technical Requirements:

Minimum higher professional education (HBO) level.
At least 4 years of recent experience as a data information analyst in a DWH/BI environment.
Experience working in an Agile environment with Scrum.
Proficiency in logical, 3NF, and dimensional data models, especially Data Vault 2.0.
SQL proficiency and experience in data analysis.
Knowledge of Sparx Enterprise Architect or similar tools.
Understanding of DWH/BI development processes.
Strong communication skills in both business and technical contexts.
Good command of Dutch, both spoken and written.
Basic knowledge of GDPR (Data Compliance) is a plus.
Knowledge of tools like Snowflake and Power BI is a plus.




🎉 Why Capitole?

🤝 Our employees come first. We believe in a different, more human model, placing people at the center of our company.

📜 Permanent contract
💵 Competitive salary range
🌴 Holiday allowance
🚗 Mobility allowance (depending on seniority)
🎁 Bonus (10% Annual gross salary)
📚 Training budget (1200 Euro)
💼 Pension scheme contribution
💻 IT supplies
🏠💼 Hybrid/remote working - 2 days/week in the Utrecht office.

Don't know us yet? Discover us!!




Home - Capitole Consulting




Don't hesitate to send us your profile, we are looking forward to meeting you! ☎📩

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
🪐 Discover our galaxy

Malt is Europe's leading freelancing platform with one clear mission: to give people the freedom to choose who they work with. Co-founded in 2013 by Vincent Huguet, with Alexandre Fretti as co-CEO since 2022, Malt is a tech company with a human approach that helps companies and freelancers make the perfect match.

Malt is a marketplace that embraces a community of over 700,000 freelancers and over 70,000 clients, ranging from small and medium-sized enterprises to large corporations. More than just a connector, our marketplace streamlines freelancer-client communications, simplifies administrative and legal tasks, expedites invoicing and payments, and so much more.

We are all about giving both freelancers and companies choice and added peace of mind, so that every experience on Malt is nothing less than (inter)stellar. The launch of Malt Strategy in 2023 enabled Malt to broaden its scope by offering the expertise of a network of top independent consultants and transition managers, to better support companies from the strategy to the implementation of ambitious projects.

✨ Malt is also…


a tech company with a human approach
a company with a strong culture fueled by 700 Malters from 40+ nationalities, working from 9 countries all around Europe - Germany, Belgium, United Arab Emirates, Spain, France, Netherlands, Nordic countries, United Kingdom, and Switzerland
committed to creating a safe and inclusive space where every employee can thrive both personally and professionally
committed to equality and diversity (50% of People managers are women)
a company with strong career path policies allowing all Malters to develop and grow equally
backed by renowned investors including ISAI, Serena, Eurazeo Growth, Goldman Sachs and BPI France




Join us on Planet Malt, we need you to help us write this next chapter! 🪐

At Malt we believe that Ambition is the Way, so all lists of missions and responsibilities are non-exhaustive.

Explore your future career 🔭

You would be part of Malt’s data team, an international team of about 30 people, with various profiles, including 7 data analysts, analytics engineers, data engineers, data scientists, and economists... The team is led by Claire Lebarz, Chief Data & AI Officer @ Malt, and former Head of Data @ Airbnb.

Join us and become part of the #FutureOfwork!

Key Responsibilities ✨


Develop a deep understanding of our freelancers and clients and how they interact with each other and with our product
Be a partner to product and business teams across the marketplace, helping them to better understand their performance through strategic analytics and structured thinking
Support our most strategic topics with deep-dive analytics, insights, recommendations
Empower the teams across Malt to answer data questions quickly and easily by building high-quality ground truth data sets, metrics and dashboards.
Contribute to the modelization of our databases and semantic layer along with analytics engineers
Be a key member of the data team, helping spread the data and AI culture within Malt




About You 🧑‍🚀


You have a Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Operations Research) or in Business
You have +5 years of experience as a data analyst in a fast-paced and quantitative environment (start-up, scale-up, consulting…)
You consider yourself a full-stack data analyst: You write SQL perfectly, you know how to work with ETLs, you’ve been using data modelization tools such as dbt, you can write simple Python scripts… You are also very comfortable in using data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Metabase, Tableau…)
You have strong communication (written and oral), presentation-building and storytelling skills
You are fluent in English
You are curious and eager to learn new things and grow




What makes you different from others? 🫵


You have good business acumen, but you also have a “hacker” mindset, you enjoy leveraging technology to find solutions to problems
You have a growth mindset: you are comfortable in navigating and excelling in fast-paced environments with no playbook for success
You have an ability to influence people, but you are also a strong team player




How to join the mission? 🚀


Screening with Alex, our Tech Talent Acquisition Manager, to better understand your background, aspirations and answer your questions (45 minutes)
Take home technical assessment with the Data Director (Gautier Chenard), one Data Analyst and another member of the data team (60mn)
Past Presentation project and restitution to the Data Director, one member of Ops team and one Product Manager (1h)
Interview with Claire, our Chief Data Officer (30mn)




Malt is the perfect space to thrive personally and professionally 💫


Onboarding: Before easing into your new role, you’ll spend your first week learning about our culture, products, and services with other onboardees at our office in Paris
Equity: Every Malter is entitled to stock options
Lunch vouchers (legal benefit): €9/day on your Swile card
Transportation (legal benefit): 50% reimbursement (any type of transport)
Healthcare insurance (legal benefit)
RTT: From 8 to 12 days off per year
Sports: Company participation to a Gymlib membership
Malt sabbatical: Every three years, all Malters are entitled to a one month fully paid sabbatical leave
Free books: If you’re interested in learning more about any topic relevant to Malt’s business, just tell us the books you’d like to read, and we’ll order them for you—without any questions asked or approval processes to follow
Remote work: Hybrid policy balancing on-site and home office
Team building events organized every year




Ready? Get your ticket to Malt 🪐
Show more
HTML:
🪐 Discover our galaxy

Malt is Europe's leading freelancing platform with one clear mission: to give people the freedom to choose who they work with. Co-founded in 2013 by Vincent Huguet, with Alexandre Fretti as co-CEO since 2022, Malt is a tech company with a human approach that helps companies and freelancers make the perfect match.

Malt is a marketplace that embraces a community of over 700,000 freelancers and over 70,000 clients, ranging from small and medium-sized enterprises to large corporations. More than just a connector, our marketplace streamlines freelancer-client communications, simplifies administrative and legal tasks, expedites invoicing and payments, and so much more.

We are all about giving both freelancers and companies choice and added peace of mind, so that every experience on Malt is nothing less than (inter)stellar. The launch of Malt Strategy in 2023 enabled Malt to broaden its scope by offering the expertise of a network of top independent consultants and transition managers, to better support companies from the strategy to the implementation of ambitious projects.

✨ Malt is also…

  • a tech company with a human approach
  • a company with a strong culture fueled by 700 Malters from 40+ nationalities, working from 9 countries all around Europe - Germany, Belgium, United Arab Emirates, Spain, France, Netherlands, Nordic countries, United Kingdom, and Switzerland
  • committed to creating a safe and inclusive space where every employee can thrive both personally and professionally
  • committed to equality and diversity (50% of People managers are women)
  • a company with strong career path policies allowing all Malters to develop and grow equally
  • backed by renowned investors including ISAI, Serena, Eurazeo Growth, Goldman Sachs and BPI France



Join us on Planet Malt, we need you to help us write this next chapter! 🪐

At Malt we believe that Ambition is the Way, so all lists of missions and responsibilities are non-exhaustive.

Explore your future career 🔭

You would be part of Malt’s data team, an international team of about 30 people, with various profiles, including 7 data analysts, analytics engineers, data engineers, data scientists, and economists... The team is led by Claire Lebarz, Chief Data & AI Officer @ Malt, and former Head of Data @ Airbnb.

Join us and become part of the #FutureOfwork!

Key Responsibilities ✨

  • Develop a deep understanding of our freelancers and clients and how they interact with each other and with our product
  • Be a partner to product and business teams across the marketplace, helping them to better understand their performance through strategic analytics and structured thinking
  • Support our most strategic topics with deep-dive analytics, insights, recommendations
  • Empower the teams across Malt to answer data questions quickly and easily by building high-quality ground truth data sets, metrics and dashboards.
  • Contribute to the modelization of our databases and semantic layer along with analytics engineers
  • Be a key member of the data team, helping spread the data and AI culture within Malt



About You 🧑‍🚀

  • You have a Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Operations Research) or in Business
  • You have +5 years of experience as a data analyst in a fast-paced and quantitative environment (start-up, scale-up, consulting…)
  • You consider yourself a full-stack data analyst: You write SQL perfectly, you know how to work with ETLs, you’ve been using data modelization tools such as dbt, you can write simple Python scripts… You are also very comfortable in using data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Metabase, Tableau…)
  • You have strong communication (written and oral), presentation-building and storytelling skills
  • You are fluent in English
  • You are curious and eager to learn new things and grow



What makes you different from others? 🫵

  • You have good business acumen, but you also have a “hacker” mindset, you enjoy leveraging technology to find solutions to problems
  • You have a growth mindset: you are comfortable in navigating and excelling in fast-paced environments with no playbook for success
  • You have an ability to influence people, but you are also a strong team player



How to join the mission? 🚀

  • Screening with Alex, our Tech Talent Acquisition Manager, to better understand your background, aspirations and answer your questions (45 minutes)
  • Take home technical assessment with the Data Director (Gautier Chenard), one Data Analyst and another member of the data team (60mn)
  • Past Presentation project and restitution to the Data Director, one member of Ops team and one Product Manager (1h)
  • Interview with Claire, our Chief Data Officer (30mn)



Malt is the perfect space to thrive personally and professionally 💫

  • Onboarding: Before easing into your new role, you’ll spend your first week learning about our culture, products, and services with other onboardees at our office in Paris
  • Equity: Every Malter is entitled to stock options
  • Lunch vouchers (legal benefit): €9/day on your Swile card
  • Transportation (legal benefit): 50% reimbursement (any type of transport)
  • Healthcare insurance (legal benefit)
  • RTT: From 8 to 12 days off per year
  • Sports: Company participation to a Gymlib membership
  • Malt sabbatical: Every three years, all Malters are entitled to a one month fully paid sabbatical leave
  • Free books: If you’re interested in learning more about any topic relevant to Malt’s business, just tell us the books you’d like to read, and we’ll order them for you—without any questions asked or approval processes to follow
  • Remote work: Hybrid policy balancing on-site and home office
  • Team building events organized every year



Ready? Get your ticket to Malt 🪐

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Eindhoven (Hybrid) - Freelance: 9 month contract + extensions




Orbis have been retained by a global cybersecurity business in Eindhoven who require a Senior Data Analyst to join them on a freelance basis.




This is an initial 9-month extendable freelance opportunity (with strong likelihood of extension and/or the opportunity to join them permanently). The focus here is on finding a data analyst with networking knowledge (no hands-on experience needed) and strong technical skills in SQL and Python. You should be able to:




Write fully functional scripts in Python and be proficient in SQL.
Posses strong Python skills, algorithmic thinking, ml knowledge and data science can substitute for networking knowledge.
Strong networking knowledge to understand specific networking behaviours and their outcomes. Practical experience is not required.
Experience with IoT, OT or IoMT/Medical Device software and technologies is a plus.




Rates are negotiable depending upon experience.

You would be required to be onsite twice/week in Eindhoven.

Title: Data Analyst - AI
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst for an AI team for one of the biggest banks in the Netherlands. They are looking for someone with strong technical skills, an innovative mindset, feel for business and entrepreneurial drive. You'll work directly with entrepreneurs and business counterparts to bring data solutions from idea to production. They are looking for creative and passionate people with a "go get it" mentality. Their Data Analysts are multi-skilled and have strong coding, system design and visualisation skills combined with an understanding of the business that they put to use within the context of data analytics.

Ideal Profile

You have a Master degree or higher in a quantitative field
You have 2-5 years of relevant work experience
You are up to date on the latest developments within data and dashboarding and can guide others in finding optimal solutions
You are familiar with the 'tools of the trade', e.g. SQL, Python, Databricks, PowerBI, Git…
You have an entrepreneurial mindset and are a self-starter.

About Levy Professionals

Since 2000, we have been delivering professional solutions to organizations ranging from tech start-ups to global players. From our offices in Amsterdam and London, we have built an international and local network of experienced salaried professionals, driven by our passion for connecting skills with projects. Over the years we have filled over 1,700 applications and today we have consistently recruited and seconded 250+ professionals from 14 countries who have been deployed on a variety of projects. Our strength is the way we see and treat people. This will always be an important factor in our strategy for the coming years.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Tiqets is one of the fastest-growing tech scale-ups in the Netherlands. To keep it moving fast and making culture more accessible, we’re hiring a Data Analyst to join us!




Who are we?

We are revolutionizing the way people buy tickets to unforgettable experiences at the best destinations all over the world. Our technology makes planning easy for thousands of travelers to find all the experiences they don't want to miss during their trip (museums, zoos, theme parks, and more), so they can book all their tickets in one place.




We are an international company committed to making culture accessible to our customers and our employees. We embed diversity, equity, and inclusion into our company fiber organically.

These values are promoted from the inside out and we strive to represent and honor differences in gender, race, religion, and sexual orientation in our company culture, our content, and our product.




Our values

We are remarkable: Have fun, be creative and celebrate great moments!
We are accessible: Communicate honestly and support each other
We are adaptable: Learn, adapt, and pivot. That's who we are!




What you will do




The Data Team is responsible for supporting the data needs of many teams at Tiqets by helping them become more data-driven in how they operate. As a Data Analyst on the Data team, you will have the opportunity to work on various interesting problems related to Supply Acquisition, Supplier Portal User Analysis, A/B Testing, Reporting, Marketing Campaign Optimization, and much more.




You will work closely with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to uncover insights about the business, build new hypotheses, and help Tiqets improve through an iterative process of testing and learning.

If you are passionate about Data, enjoy working on challenging business problems in a fast-moving environment, and believe in the importance of teamwork, this is the right opening for you.




Responsibilities




Deep dive into large business datasets to uncover valuable insights that can be turned into actionable hypotheses
Design and implement data models with SQL in DBT
Build explores and dashboards in Looker to allow others at the company to be able to ask the right data questions
Work with Product Owners, Developers, Marketeers, and Merchandising Specialists to determine and measure the right metrics in their respective domains
Keep a close eye on the ever-changing data challenges at Tiqets, and collaborate closely with Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and other Data Analysts on the team to solve them
Educate and empower others at the company to be more self-reliant for their data needs
Mentor others in the team with technical guidance
Collaborate on the architectural evolution of the Tiqets data model and reporting framework




Qualifications




Technical or mathematical education at a Bachelor's or Master's level
3+ years of experience in Data Analyst roles
Experience with DBT.
Strong SQL skills; Experience working with a modern Data Warehouse like Redshift, Snowflake, or Databricks
Experience building reports on BI tools like Looker or Tableau.
Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to clearly explain concepts and actionable insights
Capacity to thrive in a startup/scale-up environment, adapt quickly, work independently, and take ownership of your work
Nice to have: prior experience in e-commerce with a background in hypothesis-driven A/B Testing




Perks & Benefits at Tiqets




Vibrant, dynamic, international working environment
Bright, welcoming office located in Amsterdam, 5 minutes by foot from Amstel station
Opportunity to make an impact in an award-winning tech scale-up company
20% personal Tiqets discount code for all of our products
Biweekly pizza & beer sessions to expand our knowledge with useful presentations from various team members
Friday drinks and parties to celebrate our accomplishments, our well-known annual ski trip
Pension scheme and travel compensation
Daily fresh lunch buffet provided by Join Program
Hybrid working model
Sport activities: free gym, running sessions, boot-camp, football, climbing, yoga, paddle and more
Reimbursement home workspace necessities




Get in touch!

Please send your application via the form on this vacancy. We can’t wait to hear from you!

Are you representing an agency? Thank you for your interest in our job offer. However, we are handling the recruitment process internally and do not require external assistance at this time.
