Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Business Data Analyst

Location: Stockholm, Sweden (Sweden primary, alternatively Finland, Denmark)

Duration: 12+ Months (Possibility of Extension)

We are looking for a Finance Remediation Specialist (Business Data Analyst) for our client in the financial sector.

As a senior Business Data Analyst, you’ll play a valuable role in ensuring the team provides relevant and timeline insights and identify opportunities to take the sanctions analytics capabilities to the next level.

What you’ll be doing:

Translating business needs into tangible analyses by understanding the business context, leveraging data to proactively provide relevant insights
Analyzing large sets of data using tools such as Hadoop and PowerBI to support projects, risk management and operational decision making.
Driving ideation and development of new analytics capabilities in collaboration with the team and other relevant stakeholders.
Driving and participating in data-related change work to improve how it is used by systems or end users.
Providing expertise and sparring for team members and as part of projects, acting as a subject matter expert for sanctions data and analytics.
Interact closely with colleagues and stakeholders across the bank to share best practices and align on common ways of working across value chains.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Have strong analytical skills and a curious mindset to proactively identify important details in data and turn it into actionable insight.
Thrive in a dynamic environment where the only constant is change, learning and adapting to a complex data and IT landscape that connects across most parts of the company.
Are structured, result-oriented and set a good example for others. You enjoy and have experience of building strong stakeholder relationships to support your work.

Your experience and background:

Experience in the Financial or IT/Technology industries and familiarity with common banking industry concepts and processes. Knowledge of sanctions compliance/financial crime prevention is a strong advantage.
Experience of project or change work, capturing and understanding stakeholder requirements.
Experience of visualising and communicating complex information in a digestible format for a range of stakeholders.
Skilled user of MS Excel and PowerPoint.
Knowledge of SQL, Python and R considered a strong advantage.
Experience using Hadoop and PowerBI considered a strong advantage.
Advanced English oral and written communication in a very international and diverse team environment.
A subject-relevant degree or equivalent work experience.

Show more
HTML:
Title: Business Data Analyst

Location: Stockholm, Sweden (Sweden primary, alternatively Finland, Denmark)

Duration: 12+ Months (Possibility of Extension)

We are looking for a Finance Remediation Specialist (Business Data Analyst) for our client in the financial sector.

As a senior Business Data Analyst, you’ll play a valuable role in ensuring the team provides relevant and timeline insights and identify opportunities to take the sanctions analytics capabilities to the next level.

What you’ll be doing:

  • Translating business needs into tangible analyses by understanding the business context, leveraging data to proactively provide relevant insights
  • Analyzing large sets of data using tools such as Hadoop and PowerBI to support projects, risk management and operational decision making.
  • Driving ideation and development of new analytics capabilities in collaboration with the team and other relevant stakeholders.
  • Driving and participating in data-related change work to improve how it is used by systems or end users.
  • Providing expertise and sparring for team members and as part of projects, acting as a subject matter expert for sanctions data and analytics.
  • Interact closely with colleagues and stakeholders across the bank to share best practices and align on common ways of working across value chains.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

  • Have strong analytical skills and a curious mindset to proactively identify important details in data and turn it into actionable insight.
  • Thrive in a dynamic environment where the only constant is change, learning and adapting to a complex data and IT landscape that connects across most parts of the company.
  • Are structured, result-oriented and set a good example for others. You enjoy and have experience of building strong stakeholder relationships to support your work.

Your experience and background:

  • Experience in the Financial or IT/Technology industries and familiarity with common banking industry concepts and processes. Knowledge of sanctions compliance/financial crime prevention is a strong advantage.
  • Experience of project or change work, capturing and understanding stakeholder requirements.
  • Experience of visualising and communicating complex information in a digestible format for a range of stakeholders.
  • Skilled user of MS Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Knowledge of SQL, Python and R considered a strong advantage.
  • Experience using Hadoop and PowerBI considered a strong advantage.
  • Advanced English oral and written communication in a very international and diverse team environment.
  • A subject-relevant degree or equivalent work experience.

Title: Product Data Analyst To Retail Bi & Analytics – Decide & Go Value Stream
Description:
Company Description

Sales is a global function within the H&M brand with the mission of growing and engaging our customer base, as well as growing and developing our sales channels. By holding the responsibility for our regions and bringing together expertise from both business and digital & tech perspectives, Sales plays a key role in delivering on our brand plan - to elevate H&M through product, experience, and brand providing aspirational fashion at an unbeatable price.

The mission of the Retail Unit at Sales is to grow and transform the portfolio by building exceptional store experiences – securing high productivity, financial resilience and a strong brand. This is done through holistic retail strategies, fueled by tech innovation and enabled through our global network of teams and partners.

Job Description

The Retail BI & Analytics team is a team gathering data competencies within the newly formed Retail unit including Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Product Data Analysts and Business Intelligence Analysts. The Product Data Analyst works closely together with the product teams, structured as Value Streams, within the Retail Tech department. The role includes supporting the Value Stream in setting KPIs and creating business cases for the products in that product area, as well as conducting data analysis, A/B testing and creating the BI reports needed to evaluate the product performance and guide the Value Stream’s work forward.

As a Product Data Analyst working towards the Decide & Go Value Stream, you will be a key enabler to explore and support data driven product development for the checkout products in store: physical and self-checkout, as well as mobile checkout solutions. You will build BI dashboards and reports to monitor KPIs, perform A/B tests, provide analysis and insights to support your colleagues with data and insight-driven decision making on strategic directions.

In the role you will:


Be a crucial person for your colleagues to understand how our product development impacts the business
Proactively support product development with analytical insights and recommendations which helps to drive innovations and achieve strategic advantage
Perform analysis on large sets of data to extract impactful insights that will inform and guide development efforts within the Value Stream as well as supporting in creating and following up on business cases related to the products within he Value Stream
Support the product teams within the Value Stream with setting KPIs and following up on performance through reporting and A/B testing
Translate business requirements into analytical requirements and design analytics and reporting solutions together with global business stakeholders as well as regions to maximize their impact
Interact and influence the analytical community within H&M to explore and enable new data areas to realize even more business potential



Qualifications

As a person we believe that you are a true role model of H&M values and that you are an ambitious, flexible and communicative team player. Your positive drive and curiosity sees the potential and opportunities in our way of working and wants to understand, test, scale and learn. By having a business and customer-oriented mindset with the motivation to constantly improve, achieve targets and drive agenda forward you are key player in the team. You like taking responsibility, prioritize and enjoy working in a changing environment

Additionally, we see that:


You have an academic degree in a quantitative field, such as engineering, business, economics, finance or math/statistics
You have developed strong analytical skills through relevant work experience with at least three years of experience working as Data Analyst, Product Data Analyst, Data Scientist or similar roles
You are experienced in using programming languages like R or Python for data analysis
You have deep knowledge in how to use tools such as Power BI and SQL and are confident in working with large data sets and extracting data by writing complex queries.
You have experience in A/B testing
You are a clear communicator who can easily translate complex analytical methods to business stakeholders and are comfortable in presenting results of your analyses to different stakeholders
You are a team player and enjoy sharing your knowledge with colleagues



Additional Information

This is a permanent role, based in Stockholm and reporting to Tobias Klingberg, Head of Retail BI & Analytics. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with your CV through this job posting. If you have any questions about the role and/or the process, please contact Sarah Assem.

H&M Group is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.

At H&M Group we strive to have a fair and inclusive recruitment process. Why kindly ask you to not attach cover letter in your application as they often contain information that can easily trigger unintentional biases.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role:


Liaise with business to understand their use cases related to responsible wage practices, solution it and implement it.
The role is expected to be in conjunction with another FTC working out of Europe.


Essential requirements:


Reporting using Power BI
Building solutions with Power Apps
Indepth knowledge of the above tools.
Basic GCP knowledge, must be capable of creating microservices (java or python) that can be hosted in GCP and integrated with Power BI and assess limitations or advantages around this.


Please explain how you meet all the requirements when applying.

Utilization: 100%

Location: Sweden

Period: 29-07-2024-31-12-2024

Last day to apply: 06-08-2024

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

Title: Data Analyst – Stockholm heltid
Description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se

För en av våra kunders räkning söker vi nu en Data Analyst. Vår kund är ett stabilt och tryggt konsultbolag med stark ekonomi. Företaget erbjuder intressanta uppdrag inom offentlig sektor, med fokus på samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar, och en trygg anställning med kollektivavtal. Företaget har funnits sedan 2003 och består idag av ett 100-tal medarbetare.

Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Du kommer även ha möjligheten att arbeta hemifrån.

I din roll kommer du att bidra till att skapa nya insikter och främja datadrivet beslutsfattande hos företagets kunder. Företagets kunder står inför utmaningar där de behöver dra nytta av digitaliseringens möjligheter för att effektivisera och automatisera sina verksamheter. Det finns ett ökat behov av kompetens kring avancerad statistisk analys och automation. Du kommer att tillhöra företagets beslutsstödsteam. Teamet jobbar Microsoftorienterat.

Vi söker dig som:


har en relevant akademisk utbildning inom dataanalys eller statistik
har minst 3 års erfarenhet i rollen som dataanalytiker
erfarenhet av prediktionsanalys
erfarenhet av Power BI
har en vana av att arbeta med komplexa miljöer med fokus på att skapa rätt handlingar från data
har erfarenhet av agil utvecklingspraxis som ex. SCRUM, Kanban, DevOps
har goda SQL-kunskaper
behärskar svenska i tal och skrift.


Meriterande:


erfarenhet av SSIS/SSAS, kunskap i R eller Python, samt erfarenhet av att arbeta i molnmiljöer ex. Azure eller AWS.
kunskaper inom informationssäkerhet, GDPR och säker implementering av analysverktyg.


Du får:


Uppdrag med samhällsnyttiga tillämpningar
En anställning på ett företag med stabila kundrelationer och samarbeten
Balans i livet där det finns plats för både familj och fritid
En kompetensresa som är unik för dig och din karriärresa
En trygg anställning med kollektivavtal och bra förmåner
En lönemodell som kombinerar anställningstrygghet med rörlig del och vinstdelning
En platt organisation med närhet till ledning och stor delaktighet


Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.

Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Data Analyst – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.

Title: Data Analyst, Finance & Strategy
Description:
About Gelato

Gelato has built the world's largest and most global network for on-demand production of customized items e.g. t-shirts, wall art, mugs, books, hoodies, and cards. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs to sell their creativity globally, with a more local and sustainable production. With local production and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste, and carbon emissions are reduced.

We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities all across the world. We have more than 130 production partners in 32 countries. In 72 hours we can reach more than 5 billion people with customized products in a smarter, faster, and greener way.

Gelato is changing the way that customized products can be produced on-demand. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses. With local production, and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste and carbon emissions are reduced.

Gelato consists of three different business units:

Optimalprint - our B2C e-commerce business, offering beautiful high-quality personalized products to consumers all over the world. The products are produced on-demand by Gelato’s local production network.

GelatoCreate - giving creators across the world instant access to a global market of customers. Simple integrations to webshops such as Shopify, Etsy and TikTok allow creators to connect and personalize their designs for a wide range of quality products, and Gelato takes care of the production and fulfillment through our local production.

GelatoConnect - the backbone of Gelato is enterprise software that powers the world's most advanced production on demand facilities, providing unmatched production workflow, logistics and procurement efficiency, quality management and cost savings.




What we are looking for

We are seeking analytics professionals with a passion for business impact to join our world class Finance & Strategy team. As a Data Analyst, you will help build strategic reports for investor and leadership teams and carry out analysis that will inform important financial and strategic decisions for Gelato. You will guide the finance team using data and insights by not simply presenting data, but telling data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your finance and strategy team members using clear insights and recommendations.

The position is based in Gelato’s offices in London (UK), Oslo (Norway), Stockholm (Sweden), and Madrid (Spain)

What you will be doing

Own the design, development, and maintenance of metrics, reports and dashboards to drive key business performance visibility for finance and strategy teams.
Identify trends & patterns using internal and external data sources powered with analytic models to provide actionable insights to business decision-makers.
Generate forecasts, recommendations, and strategic/tactical plans necessary to drive and influence business decision-making.
Share your knowledge and build creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices.

Who you are

4 years+ of data analytics experience.
Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and integrity in all your analyses
Good time management. You can handle multiple tasks, meeting deadlines without compromising quality.
Collaborative. You work well in a team environment, collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong project and stakeholder management skills. You keep all stakeholders informed and manage expectations effectively.
Extensive hands-on experience in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and BI tools like Looker/Tableau/PowerBI.
Good knowledge of statistical analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with finance data or in finance related roles.
Advanced experience with Looker.
Experience in management consulting would be a plus.

What we offer

We offer you a chance to be part of a truly amazing journey in a company that sets very high targets and works hard to achieve them. You will be able to work with smart, motivated, and engaged co-workers from all over the world, in an intense and very energetic environment. This leads to you having a tangible impact on the way that we operate and expand our business.

Some of the highlights of the package include:

Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvement
Chance to become a shareholder of Gelato!
Flexible festive holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Work at one of our hub city offices or even remotely
And much much more!

What it’s like to work at Gelato

We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.

At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.

Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in English, regardless of which country you are applying from.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
At Sandvik Group IT, we’re looking for a Data Engineer with strong technical skills to join us on an exciting transformation journey and build a new modern Azure data platform.

You’ll be part of a diverse and collaborative team with a focus on building scalable and secured middle layer serving data to the front services.

Some Words About Us

At Sandvik, we're going through a major digital shift with the objective of becoming an industry leader within digital solutions and to enable operational excellence through digitalization. We welcome you to an open and supportive work environment where you get to grow and develop – read more about our culture on our career site! We look forward to hearing from you!

Your mission

Your main focus is leading the exciting mission of building data pipelines to onboard data from various sources, such as relational databases, mainframe systems, APIs, and message queues. With Azure Cloud Platform as your targeted working environment, you develop scalable and secure services that harvest integrated data.

You have a strong voice in decision-making and our technical road map, and your work highly contributes to meeting data compliance and governance standards. You shape our work culture by sharing your knowledge, coaching junior developers, and partnering with the business, as you deploy data pipelines that deliver value and insights from data.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden and allows for a hybrid work schedule.

Your profile

We’re looking for a seasoned data engineer who can handle complex data challenges in an agile environment. You have:


A strong grasp of SQL and Python, and you can use Spark and Azure data bricks to build and manage scalable data solutions.
Familiarity with various data architectures, such as Data Lake, Data Mesh, and Data Fabric, and you can design and implement data pipelines that integrate data from multiple sources, such as databases, flat files, API’s, and event-driven data feeds.
Proficiency in software development practices, such as Git version control, CI/CD, and Docker, and you can troubleshoot and optimize data pipelines for enhanced performance and reliability.
Fluency in English.


Although your hard skills are important, we highly value your personality – characterized by your forward-thinking mindset, helping you to drive change and continuous improvement across teams, tools, and processes. You’re comfortable communicating and building relationships with stakeholders at all over our organization and have the ability to easily “grasp the gist”. With your analytical mindset, you’re able to approach complex challenges and proactively tackle them with your team's help. You have a positive and open mind, and as a true team player, you’re intrigued by collaborating and motivating other team members in a multicultural environment.

Our culture

At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.

Contact information

For further information about this position, please contact:

Swati Falak, recruiting manager, swati.falak@sandvik.com

We have already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.

Union contacts – Sweden

Anders Rönnqvist, Unionen, +46 (0)70 616 41 21

Göran Norell, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70 616 43 78

Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55

Recruitment Specialist

Gustaf Sjögren

How To Apply

Send your application no later than August 15, 2024. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0066184.

As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.

To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

Sandvik is a global, high-tech engineering group providing solutions that enhance productivity, profitability and sustainability for the manufacturing, mining and infrastructure industries. We are at the forefront of digitalization and focus on optimizing our customers’ processes. Our world-leading offering includes equipment, tools, services and digital solutions for machining, mining, rock excavation and rock processing. In 2023 the Group had approximately 41 ,000 employees and revenues of about 127 billion SEK in about 150 countries within continuing operations.
Show more
HTML:
At Sandvik Group IT, we’re looking for a Data Engineer with strong technical skills to join us on an exciting transformation journey and build a new modern Azure data platform.

You’ll be part of a diverse and collaborative team with a focus on building scalable and secured middle layer serving data to the front services.

Some Words About Us

At Sandvik, we're going through a major digital shift with the objective of becoming an industry leader within digital solutions and to enable operational excellence through digitalization. We welcome you to an open and supportive work environment where you get to grow and develop – read more about our culture on our career site! We look forward to hearing from you!

Your mission

Your main focus is leading the exciting mission of building data pipelines to onboard data from various sources, such as relational databases, mainframe systems, APIs, and message queues. With Azure Cloud Platform as your targeted working environment, you develop scalable and secure services that harvest integrated data.

You have a strong voice in decision-making and our technical road map, and your work highly contributes to meeting data compliance and governance standards. You shape our work culture by sharing your knowledge, coaching junior developers, and partnering with the business, as you deploy data pipelines that deliver value and insights from data.

This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden and allows for a hybrid work schedule.

Your profile

We’re looking for a seasoned data engineer who can handle complex data challenges in an agile environment. You have:

  • A strong grasp of SQL and Python, and you can use Spark and Azure data bricks to build and manage scalable data solutions.
  • Familiarity with various data architectures, such as Data Lake, Data Mesh, and Data Fabric, and you can design and implement data pipelines that integrate data from multiple sources, such as databases, flat files, API’s, and event-driven data feeds.
  • Proficiency in software development practices, such as Git version control, CI/CD, and Docker, and you can troubleshoot and optimize data pipelines for enhanced performance and reliability.
  • Fluency in English.

Although your hard skills are important, we highly value your personality – characterized by your forward-thinking mindset, helping you to drive change and continuous improvement across teams, tools, and processes. You’re comfortable communicating and building relationships with stakeholders at all over our organization and have the ability to easily “grasp the gist”. With your analytical mindset, you’re able to approach complex challenges and proactively tackle them with your team's help. You have a positive and open mind, and as a true team player, you’re intrigued by collaborating and motivating other team members in a multicultural environment.

Our culture

At Sandvik, we’re tech driven, innovative and entrepreneurial. We believe that success is a team effort so we value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive culture where people can be themselves and reach their full potential. So, we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our differences. Visit our stories hub, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us further.

Contact information

For further information about this position, please contact:

Swati Falak, recruiting manager, swati.falak@sandvik.com

We have already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.

Union contacts – Sweden

Anders Rönnqvist, Unionen, +46 (0)70 616 41 21

Göran Norell, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70 616 43 78

Peter Olsson-Andrée, Ledarna, +46 (0)70 222 48 55

Recruitment Specialist

Gustaf Sjögren

How To Apply

Send your application no later than August 15, 2024. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0066184.

As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.

To learn more about our recruitment process, please visit our career site or contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

Sandvik is a global, high-tech engineering group providing solutions that enhance productivity, profitability and sustainability for the manufacturing, mining and infrastructure industries. We are at the forefront of digitalization and focus on optimizing our customers’ processes. Our world-leading offering includes equipment, tools, services and digital solutions for machining, mining, rock excavation and rock processing. In 2023 the Group had approximately 41 ,000 employees and revenues of about 127 billion SEK in about 150 countries within continuing operations.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Om tjänsten

How do we best source energy for fossil-free electricity sales?

Providing our customers with fossil-free electricity at competitive prices means we need to understand their needs and the market and be able to handle the attached risks. The Commodities Intelligence department is currently looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join us on our journey.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will belong to the Commodities Intelligence department which is responsible for the Financial Risk Management, Power Pricing and development of our BI-tools for our Sales segments. The team work with all customers and segments in the Nordic countries and you will have colleagues in both Sweden and Finland. Besides your team colleagues, you will work closely with Portfolio managers, Business control, Vattenfall IT and lots of other people.

Your main responsibility as a Business Intelligence Analyst is to develop and take responsibility for the teams data tables and BI tools, which are crucial for our financial risk management, business analysis and reporting.

The main focus of this position is to build, develop and secure quality in new or existing Power BI reports. You will work with the reports from start to finish, from ordering raw data from the Source systems to publishing a user-friendly power BI report that meets the stakeholder's demand for follow-up, risk management, analysis and decision-making.

To be able to apply the correct business logic in the data transformation, it is important to have or gain a deep understanding of the electricity market and electricity Sales business. It is also important to be able to work in a cross-functional environment where stakeholders has different requirements and needs.

Our ambition is that your work will form the basis for improved risk management and increased quality in our analysis and reports.

Din bakgrund

To be successful in this role, we believe that you have the following:


University degree in engineering, finance, mathematics or other similar field of education
Experience of SQL- programming, preferably Azure / Databricks
Experience of data modelling and data management
Good command of written and spoken English


It´ll be beneficial if you also have:


Experience working in the electricity market
Experience working in sales and marketing settings
Experience from Power BI
Additional programming knowledge, preferably Python.
API management
Experience in financial derivatives
Experience working in a scrum team and have related skill set
Good command of written and spoken Swedish


As a person you have an analytical mindset and the ability to quickly assess and understand relations between involved systems and tools. You´re customer-focused and business-minded, as well as a good team player with good communication skills.

Mer information

We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues as ‘Ask and Share’ concept is essential for the way we work. We offer attractive employment conditions (smart working, flexible working hours and a good-work-life balance) and opportunities for personal and professional development. Click here for further information.

Location: Solna.

We welcome your application including cover letter and CV in English via the link below. Last day to apply is August 13th 2024. The advertising period has been extended due to summer holidays and we´ll review all applications when the application has closed.

We´re using tests in this recruitment process and an online test will be sent to all applicants as a first step in the recruitment process when the application has closed.

For more information about the position you are welcome to contact hiring manager André Hellström, andre.hellstrom@vattenfall.com. If you have questions regarding the recruitment process you are welcome to contact recruiter Jennifer Wikström, jennifer.wikstroem@vattenfall.com.

Trade Union Representatives, to be reached through Vattenfall’s switchboard, +46 (8) 739 50 00, are Rolf Olsson (Akademikerna), Simon Salomonsson (Unionen), Mikael Mukka (SEKO) and Cecilia Bodin (Ledarna).

At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.

Om oss

Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.
Show more

Title: Analytics-konsult inom Power BI
Description:
Implema växer och söker dig som vill hjälpa svenska och internationella företag att utvecklas och bli mer hållbara. Hos oss arbetar du med de ledande affärssystemen från SAP och Microsoft, utvalda best-of-breed lösningar, och det senaste inom intelligent digitalisering, analytics och cloud. Implema ligger i framkant av digitaliseringsvågen, vilket kräver att vi vågar tänka nytt och tänja på gränser. Vi är prestigelösa, öppna och hjälpsamma – både internt och med våra kunder. Idag är vi drygt 200 anställda och finns på 10 orter runtom i landet.

Om rollen

Implema söker nu efter fler konsulter med spetskompetens inom Power BI. Hos oss kommer du få jobba med spännande kunder i korta projekt, alltid i team, och bidra till ett svenskt näringsliv i världsklass! Som analytics-konsult kommer du primärt att ansvara för att samla in, strukturera och visualisera data från olika källor. På Implema använder vi den senaste tekniken inom planering, simulering och affärsanalys, vilket är helt avgörande för att mäta och styra verksamheter till framgång. 

Exempel på arbetsuppgifter kommer vara:

Jobba med utveckling, implementering och underhåll av analyticslösningar baserat på Microsoft analytics
Tillgängliggöra data och skapa rapporter
Workshopfacilitering för kunder och kollegor
Support och rådgivning till befintliga kunder vid frågor, fel och vidareutveckling

Du kommer att ingå i ett mindre team och därav få möjlighet att växla mellan operativt, taktiskt och strategiskt arbete. Allt i en delikat blandning! Eftersom såväl kompetens som erbjudande ska fortsätta att utvecklas inom området kommer du få vara med och skapa det klimat och de implementationer som Implema beger sig in på.  

Är du vår nya kollega?

För att lyckas i rollen som analytics-konsult inom Power BI ser vi att du har:

Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom analysverktyget Power BI (DAX-kod, data modellering, rapport- och dashboarddesign)
Erfarenhet av projektarbete, konsultation och teknisk problemlösning. Kanske har du tidigare jobbat som konsult eller på verksamhets-/kundsidan där du skaffat dig praktiskt erfarenhet av någon av dom större affärssystemen (Microsoft Dynamics 365, SAP, IFS, M3, NetSuite, Monitor, Jeeves eller liknande)
Goda kunskaper inom SQL
Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska 

Meriterande om du har kunskap om andra BI-verktyg som Qlik eller Tableau samt om du har erfarenhet om Azure-plattformen och Microsoft Fabric. Vidare tror vi du har ett stort intresse för analytics/business intelligence och hur detta kan bidra till att stärka våra kunders konkurrenskraft. Du uppskattar att jobba nära beslutsfattare och har förmåga att få saker att hända. Du är också en dedikerad lagspelare som värnar om högkvalitativa leveranser. 


Vad vi erbjuder dig

Välkommen in i en dynamisk organisation med en kultur och ett engagemang som kännetecknas av en stolthet och stark vilja att alltid driva arbetet framåt. Vi lovar dig en utmanande och varierande roll där du har möjlighet att både växa och vara med och påverka. Om du, precis som vi, är nyfiken på ny teknik och uppskattar att arbeta med tekniska lösningar som ligger i absolut framkant så kommer du att trivas hos oss!


Arbetsglädje, kreativitet och personlig utveckling börjar med god hälsa och att du mår bra. Därför eftersträvar vi att tillsammans med dig säkerställa en hållbar balans mellan arbete och fritid i din tillvaro. För oss är det minst lika viktigt som att erbjuda alla våra anställda jobb i en god, hållbar arbetsmiljö med marknadsmässiga löner och förmåner.
 

 

Show more

Om du, precis som vi, är nyfiken på ny teknik och uppskattar att arbeta med tekniska lösningar som ligger i absolut framkant så kommer du att trivas hos oss!

Arbetsglädje, kreativitet och personlig utveckling börjar med god hälsa och att du mår bra. För oss är det minst lika viktigt som att erbjuda alla våra anställda jobb i en god, hållbar arbetsmiljö med marknadsmässiga löner och förmåner.

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
På B3 Business Transformation brinner vi för att hjälpa företag och organisationer att använda sin information i sina datakällor för att göra smartare beslut. Vi har idag ett gäng grymma business intelligence-stjärnor med stor passion och intresse för utveckling och arkitektur inom Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence,- front och back end. Vi har bland annat ett nära samarbete med Microsoft och är Managed Partner och Gold Partner inom områden såsom till exempel Data Platform och Application Development. Vi samarbetar även med andra partners såklart som SAS, Qlik, Oracle, Informatica med flera.

Vi erbjuder dig...


Ett utvecklande arbete i nära samarbete med Microsoft eller någon av våra andra partners
Från den första dagen har du möjligheter att påverka både uppdragsinriktning och din egen kompetensutveckling tillsammans med oss
Goda möjligheter att påverka din egen arbetssituation och inriktning genom en flexibel lönemodell som andas frihet under ansvar
En arbetsplats där vi tycker att balans i livet är viktigt och där vi satsar på gemenskap och Wellness


Vi tror att du idag…


Är en fullfjädrad BI-utvecklare troligtvis inom någon av följande tekniker - Microsoft (SQL, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power BI), Qlik View och Qlik Sense, SAS, Tableau. Även andra tekniker kan var av intresse
Har genomfört ett antal kundnära systemutvecklingsprojekt
Är social, kreativ och gillar att jobba i team och hantera kundrelationer
Vill utvecklas och känner ödmjukhet inför kundernas utmaningar
Har relevant universitets-/högskoleexamen eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
Ser möjligheterna / har erfarenhet av Azure i någon mån


Vem söker vi?

Vi värdesätter personlighet och driv hos individen. Du ska helst vara lagspelare och en nyfiken person som har arbetat inom BI-området tidigare. Det är av betydelse för våra kunder att du behärskar det svenska språket i tal och skrift (it is important for our customers that you master the Swedish language in speech and writing).

Känns detta spännande och du vill veta mer? - Tveka i så fall inte att ansöka! Eller kontakta Mats Erkers på mats.erkers@b3.se eller 0705394705
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Ready for a new adventure building the next-generation retail experience?




At Bambuser, our customers’ business is our passion. We genuinely believe in the individuals’ potential and work together as a team to pursue our vision — to reimagine the future of retail.

We offer you an open, honest, friendly workplace where everyone’s opinion counts. Since our days are busy, we think it’s important to have fun at work. The discussions can be intense, but we always have each other’s backs.




What you will do

Join us at Bambuser as a Data Engineer and play a pivotal role in creating and scaling our future-ready data platform. As part of our dynamic team, you'll leverage your skills to craft innovative data-driven features and solutions that help our organization make better, data-backed decisions.




With a focus on GCP technologies like BigQuery, Dataflow, Airflow and Appengine, you'll use SQL, python and Node.js to transform data and build pipelines that are reliable, efficient, and secure. As a key player in our architecture and ELT systems, you'll proactively seek out opportunities to improve our processes and solutions, taking our data capabilities to the next level.




Collaborating with stakeholders across the company, including analysts and product teams, you'll help ensure that our data infrastructure and tracking meet the needs of our growing organization.




If you're passionate about data engineering and excited about creating transformative solutions that will shape our future, we want to hear from you. Come join our team at Bambuser and take your career to new heights.




We value

Skills and background
Master degree in computer science or engineering
3+ years experience in data engineering
Solid knowledge in building high-quality solutions for analysts
Experience in building data pipelines processing large data sets
Experience using cloud platforms: GCP, AWS, Azure
Knowledge in the concept of Data Warehouse Automation and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) tools e.g. Dataform, DBT, Airflow, Matillion,...
Passionate about building data processing applications
An agile mindset, a willingness to try new things and collaborate with the team
Interest in building and maintaining CI/CD




Nice to have

Working knowledge of Git (or similar), Docker, Terraform, Python
Experience with transformation tools, Dataform or DBT
Experience with client logging
Experience working with streaming data
Above all, we assume that you are curious and not afraid to ask when in doubt.




Tools we use

GCP, BigQuery, Dataform, Dataflow, Airflow, Terraform, Python, Matillion, Thoughtspot




This is Bambuser

Bambuser’s Live Video Shopping technology drives customer engagement and sales for some of the world’s largest brands and retailers. At the forefront of live streaming technology since 2007, Bambuser launched interactive eCommerce solutions in 2019 and quickly became the platform of choice for companies worldwide. We have been used by thousands worldwide for everything from sporting events, real-time news, drone shots, product launches, immersive virtual-reality shows, shoppable catwalks, and many more. Our team has established long-term partnerships and supported campaign activations for brands and retailers including Adidas, Hugo Boss, Dior, FENDI, Clarins, Shiseido, John Lewis, Tommy Hilfiger, Selfridges, QVC, and many others.




Bambuser values diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, welcoming individuals from all backgrounds, regardless of your race, gender, religion, age, ability, or other characteristics.

Show more
HTML:
Ready for a new adventure building the next-generation retail experience?


At Bambuser, our customers’ business is our passion. We genuinely believe in the individuals’ potential and work together as a team to pursue our vision — to reimagine the future of retail.

We offer you an open, honest, friendly workplace where everyone’s opinion counts. Since our days are busy, we think it’s important to have fun at work. The discussions can be intense, but we always have each other’s backs.


What you will do

Join us at Bambuser as a Data Engineer and play a pivotal role in creating and scaling our future-ready data platform. As part of our dynamic team, you'll leverage your skills to craft innovative data-driven features and solutions that help our organization make better, data-backed decisions.


With a focus on GCP technologies like BigQuery, Dataflow, Airflow and Appengine, you'll use SQL, python and Node.js to transform data and build pipelines that are reliable, efficient, and secure. As a key player in our architecture and ELT systems, you'll proactively seek out opportunities to improve our processes and solutions, taking our data capabilities to the next level.


Collaborating with stakeholders across the company, including analysts and product teams, you'll help ensure that our data infrastructure and tracking meet the needs of our growing organization.


If you're passionate about data engineering and excited about creating transformative solutions that will shape our future, we want to hear from you. Come join our team at Bambuser and take your career to new heights.


We value

  • Skills and background
  • Master degree in computer science or engineering
  • 3+ years experience in data engineering
  • Solid knowledge in building high-quality solutions for analysts
  • Experience in building data pipelines processing large data sets
  • Experience using cloud platforms: GCP, AWS, Azure
  • Knowledge in the concept of Data Warehouse Automation and Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) tools e.g. Dataform, DBT, Airflow, Matillion,...
  • Passionate about building data processing applications
  • An agile mindset, a willingness to try new things and collaborate with the team
  • Interest in building and maintaining CI/CD


Nice to have

  • Working knowledge of Git (or similar), Docker, Terraform, Python
  • Experience with transformation tools, Dataform or DBT
  • Experience with client logging
  • Experience working with streaming data
  • Above all, we assume that you are curious and not afraid to ask when in doubt.


Tools we use

GCP, BigQuery, Dataform, Dataflow, Airflow, Terraform, Python, Matillion, Thoughtspot


This is Bambuser

Bambuser’s Live Video Shopping technology drives customer engagement and sales for some of the world’s largest brands and retailers. At the forefront of live streaming technology since 2007, Bambuser launched interactive eCommerce solutions in 2019 and quickly became the platform of choice for companies worldwide. We have been used by thousands worldwide for everything from sporting events, real-time news, drone shots, product launches, immersive virtual-reality shows, shoppable catwalks, and many more. Our team has established long-term partnerships and supported campaign activations for brands and retailers including Adidas, Hugo Boss, Dior, FENDI, Clarins, Shiseido, John Lewis, Tommy Hilfiger, Selfridges, QVC, and many others.


Bambuser values diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, welcoming individuals from all backgrounds, regardless of your race, gender, religion, age, ability, or other characteristics.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Rovio is part of the SEGA family and world famous for our flagship IP Angry Birds - want to know more about Rovio as an employer? Click here.

Data is at the heart of everything we do at Rovio. It enables us to continually improve our games and provide incredible experiences for the millions of users who play our games every day. All of this data is only valuable if it can be used to guide our day to day operations and the mission of the Data and Analytics craft is to turn that raw data into actionable insights.

We are now looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our flagship Angry Birds 2 game in the Stockholm studio. Coming into this role, you will build an understanding of the game and different business levers and use that knowledge to build new game features, optimising existing ones, structure vague problem statements in collaboration with stakeholders such as the Game lead, product managers, designers and producers.

The team is located in our studio in the centre of Stockholm and works in a hybrid mode (2-3 days per week onsite). Currently not based in Sweden? No problem at all, we will help you with the relocation and work permit if needed!

You will have impact and fun at work by:


Bringing an objective perspective and recommendations to all phases of decision making, leveraging your technical skills to mine raw data for valuable information
Constantly designing and running in-game A/B test experiments, helping the team to find options leading to better game monetization performance and our audience satisfaction
Creating dashboards and reports to help the game team understand your findings
Proactively working with data exploration and looking for opportunities to improve gameplay experience
Working closely with peer Data Analysts, Product Managers and Project Leads to continuously improve how we are interpreting game metrics and making decisions
Coaching and sharing best practices between colleagues in the data craft and whole game teams


Experience and skills we are looking for:


High proficiency in SQL
Proficiency in scripting languages such as Python or R
Solid understanding of statistics
Experience in product analysis and experiments design including A/B testing
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Presentation and collaboration skills with proven ability to present data and provide actionable recommendations to senior stakeholders
Prior experience in mobile games or apps with large audiences will help you to hit the ground running but not a must


Please apply with your CV in English. We look forward to meeting you!





We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name.

At Rovio, we are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. If you have any questions before applying, please write to us at recruitment@rovio.com.

What to expect when you join us

Meet the Rovians

About Rovio

Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Rovio

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Kambi

Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.

Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.

About Tzeract:

Tzeract is a pioneering sports betting AI pricing company, operating as an agile startup within the larger ecosystem of Kambi Group ( https://kambi.com/ ). Our mission is to revolutionize the sports betting industry by leveraging cutting-edge technology and advanced analytics to enable the next generation of sports betting experiences. With a focus on both historical and real-time sports data, we're building systems that outperform the market and deliver value to our users.

To know more about us - https://tzeract.com/

Role Overview:

We're seeking a skilled Data Engineer with a passion for sports and a keen eye for statistics to join our dynamic team. This role is pivotal in designing, building, and maintaining our data infrastructure, ensuring the seamless flow and integrity of large-scale sports data sets. You will work closely with our data scientists and developers, turning complex data into actionable insights that drive our AI algorithms.

Responsibilities:



Develop and maintain scalable and robust data pipelines for real-time and historical sports data ingestion, processing, and analysis using Python and AWS services.
Implement and manage AWS cloud-based solutions to ensure high availability, performance, and security of our data infrastructure.
Collaborate with data scientists to understand data requirements for AI model development and provide the necessary data engineering support.
Apply your expertise in statistics and data analysis to enhance data quality and the effectiveness of our AI algorithms.
Monitor data pipelines and systems performance, troubleshoot data issues, and implement optimizations.
Stay updated with the latest technologies and methodologies in data engineering and sports analytics to continuously improve our data systems.



Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong proficiency in Python.
Extensive experience with AWS services (e.g., S3, EC2, RDS, Lambda, Redshift) and managing cloud-based data infrastructure.
Solid understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing principles.
Experience with real-time data processing and streaming technologies is highly desirable.
A good eye for statistics and experience in statistical modeling or analysis.
Passion for sports and sports data analysis is a big plus.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment.



Why Join Us:



Be part of a cutting-edge project that's shaping the future of sports betting.
Work in an environment that values innovation, collaboration, and a data-driven approach.
Enjoy a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and flexible working arrangements.
Engage in continuous learning and growth opportunities within an ambitious tech startup.



How to Apply:

Send your resume, a brief cover letter explaining why you're a good fit for this role, and any relevant portfolio links or GitHub repository to us. Please include "Data Engineer Application" in the subject line.

We're excited to hear from you and explore how you can contribute to our team!

#wearekambi

Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace

If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.

Creating an inclusive environment

We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.

#wearekambi

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer - Helsinki, Finland or Stockholm, Sweden




Are you passionate about creating robust data solutions which empower data-driven decision-making? Do you want to be part of influencing the well-being of employees with the help of data and analytics for millions of Epassi users? Do you want to be part of a rapidly growing company?

If yes, you might be a great fit for us. Read more below and apply to join Epassi!




As a Data Engineer:




You will be developing and maintaining a hybrid data platform (on-prem & cloud)
You will be building data integrations for internal and external stakeholders
You will be implementing high-quality data solutions in compliance with privacy
regulations and security standards
You will be working in co-operation with other teams, such as IT, security, software development, business, and finance
You will be part of an agile team of data & analytics professionals and will be contributing to continuous improvement of our way-of-working




You will be a great fit if you have:




3+ years as a data engineer building, developing and maintaining end-to-end data pipelines
Hands-on experience of formal DataOps/DevOps practices and Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) tools like Terraform and Ansible
Solid foundation in AWS, particularly in data storage solutions
Experience of Airflow and Databricks/Spark
Proficiency in SQL and Python programming
Good communication and social skills
Working proficiency in English




Why you should join Epassi:




We are a fast-growing tech company; you will have a chance to impact on many meaningful things and grow together with us as a professional
We have an inspiring & supportive culture, and we take care of the wellbeing of our employees
We provide a flexible hybrid work model and care about your work-life balance
We take care of the professional development of Epassians by creating a personal development plan individually and supporting development by providing a yearly budget
We have a unique team environment - international, motivated, supportive colleagues with a great sense of humor
Epassi has a great benefit package, for example wellbeing and lunch benefit, healthy snacks & refreshments at the office, investment in employee growth and development, and private health care




The location of the position is either in Helsinki, Finland or in Stockholm, Sweden.

The hiring manager for this position is Head of Data & Analytics Laura Mantere.

If you want to ask more information about this opportunity, please

contact careers@epassi.com.

Title: Data & Analytics
Description:
Ansök nu


Flera platser
Hybrid


Arbetsuppgifter

Det Här Är Forefront

Sedan 2008 har vi vuxit till över 550 kollegor med en mångfald av erfarenheter och kompetens inom management consulting, design och mjukvaruutveckling. Vi finns på 11 kontor i Sverige och sedan årsskiftet, även i USA.

Vi strävar efter att bli Sveriges bästa arbetsplats genom att uppskatta våra olikheter, ständigt blicka framåt och skapa en organisation som är lika modig som klok. Vår övertygelse är att tekniken ger oss oanade möjligheter – för att utveckla människor, skapa bättre affärer och bygga hållbara samhällen.

Vi drivs av att förena människa och teknik och med gemensamma visioner och större ambitioner, stödjer vi en bred kundkrets på deras digitaliseringsresor. Genom våra partnerskap med Google och Microsoft ligger vi i teknisk framkant och erbjuder utmärkta förutsättningar för att hjälpa våra kunder med deras digitaliseringsprojekt.

Vill du vara med och forma framtidens datahantering tillsammans med oss?

Vi strävar efter att sätta avtryck och skapa verklig förändring tillsammans med våra kunder. Det gör vi genom att bygga oslagbara team av drivna konsulter och genom att förstå kundens affärsproblem på djupet. Vår vision är att bli den ledande aktören inom Data & Analytics på den nordiska marknaden och vara det självklara valet för företag som står inför affärskritiska utmaningar kopplade till data. Vi är extra stolta över vårt partnerskap med Google Cloud, där vi blev utsedda till partner of the year tidigare i år. Vi är den enda svensktägda aktören på en Specialized Partner-nivå. Och vi är också stolta över våra starka samarbeten med Microsoft och Snowflake.

Vi Söker Just Nu Flera Tillskott Till Vårt Team Och Letar Efter Er Som Har Haft Dessa Roller/titlar/ansvarsområden Eller Liknande


Data Analyst
Data Engineer
Data Scientist


I Konsultrollen Inom Data & Analytics Kommer Du


Bli en del av Forefronts snabbast växande affärsområde och spela en viktig roll på vår fortsätta resa
Samarbeta med andra kollegor från Forefront, ofta i teamleveranser
Skapa och implementera framtidens plattformar och arbetssätt för datahantering
Hjälpa våra kunder att på ett hållbart sätt lyckas med sin data- och molntransformation
Arbeta i ett av Nordens största partnerskap med Google
Vidareutveckla vår affär och vår organisation


För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du har:


Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom Data & Analytics (t.ex. Data Analyst, Data Engineer, Data Scientist) på någon av de stora publika molnplattformarna
Ingenjörsutbildning från högskola eller universitet
Programmeringsbakgrund med erfarenhet av SQL och Python eller likvärdigt
Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska (både i tal och skrift)


Vi tror också att du är kommunikativ, nyfiken och framåtlutad. Och har du ett intresse för att kombinera de senaste teknikerna med affärsnytta.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.

Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.

As a Data Engineer at Sambla Group you will be part of the responsibility over the orchestration, security work and integrations of all things data. You will get to work with all departments at Sambla Group, and work with modern cloud based technologies in GCP such as BigQuery, Pubsub, Cloud run, Cloud Functions, Cloud Build and artifact registry as well as other tools like dbt, prefect and Terraform. You will be part of the Data Engineering team and report to the Head of Data Engineering.

Amongst Other Things, You Will Work With


Design, build and administer data integrations and data pipelines that feed our data products (streaming, batch, api endpoints).
Ensure data security and GDPR compliance.
Ensure data quality, data governance and product uptime.
Develop and maintain Data Platform and Data Warehouse (BigQuery)
Architect cloud solutions and data models.



Must Have


1-3 years of work experience within data engineering or similar roles.
Working experience in Python, eg. pyspark/polars, flask/fastapi.
Working experience with SQL, e.g. joins, group by, CTEs, Window/Analytic Functions.
Working experience in cloud technologies, (GCP/AWS), preferably in GCP
Working experience with version control e.g. Git.
Working experience in stakeholder management, both technical/non-technical.
Project management experience, eg. screening/scoping/planning.



Nice To Have


Experience with CI/CD (CircleCI, Jenkins, Github Actions).
Experience with logging, monitoring and observability.
Experience from the Fintech industry.
Understanding of Data Modelling & Data Warehousing, e.g. dimensional modelling, data vault, SCD etc.
Understanding of the marketing data space and the platforms used (SEM, Social, Affiliate, Marketing Automation etc.).
Programming skills in Scala, Java, Rust or similar.
Experience with coaching coworkers.



What We Offer


Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.



Please note!

As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.
Show more
HTML:
Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.

Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.

As a Data Engineer at Sambla Group you will be part of the responsibility over the orchestration, security work and integrations of all things data. You will get to work with all departments at Sambla Group, and work with modern cloud based technologies in GCP such as BigQuery, Pubsub, Cloud run, Cloud Functions, Cloud Build and artifact registry as well as other tools like dbt, prefect and Terraform. You will be part of the Data Engineering team and report to the Head of Data Engineering.

Amongst Other Things, You Will Work With

  • Design, build and administer data integrations and data pipelines that feed our data products (streaming, batch, api endpoints).
  • Ensure data security and GDPR compliance.
  • Ensure data quality, data governance and product uptime.
  • Develop and maintain Data Platform and Data Warehouse (BigQuery)
  • Architect cloud solutions and data models.


Must Have

  • 1-3 years of work experience within data engineering or similar roles.
  • Working experience in Python, eg. pyspark/polars, flask/fastapi.
  • Working experience with SQL, e.g. joins, group by, CTEs, Window/Analytic Functions.
  • Working experience in cloud technologies, (GCP/AWS), preferably in GCP
  • Working experience with version control e.g. Git.
  • Working experience in stakeholder management, both technical/non-technical.
  • Project management experience, eg. screening/scoping/planning.


Nice To Have

  • Experience with CI/CD (CircleCI, Jenkins, Github Actions).
  • Experience with logging, monitoring and observability.
  • Experience from the Fintech industry.
  • Understanding of Data Modelling & Data Warehousing, e.g. dimensional modelling, data vault, SCD etc.
  • Understanding of the marketing data space and the platforms used (SEM, Social, Affiliate, Marketing Automation etc.).
  • Programming skills in Scala, Java, Rust or similar.
  • Experience with coaching coworkers.


What We Offer

  • Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
  • A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
  • We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
  • A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.


Please note!

As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

Sambla Group is the new generation of brokers. Our ambition has always been the same - to challenge the banks’ offers so that our customers, regardless of the conditions, should always have the same opportunity to obtain the best possible loan solution. Sambla Group has grown to over 350 employees, established itself in Sweden, Norway, Finland and Denmark with offices in Sweden, Finland and Denmark.

Title: Junior Quantitative Developer
Description:
We are seeking a talented and passionate Junior Quantitative Developer to join our Forecasting Team. You will be part of a small but growing team of data scientists and analytics engineers that specialize in predicting the outlook of the Spotify business. This is a highly impactful role where you will be supporting the development and direction of the in-house user and content forecasting system, using large scale data from across the organization to deliver accurate impact estimates on a global scale for senior business partners

Please include a cover letter with your resume/application submission.

What You'll Do


Actively support and enhance the backend of our forecasting system, contributing to its robustness and scalability. This involves collaborating closely with data scientists and engineers on a quantitatively complex codebase to enhance system architecture and performance, as well as to integrate new features.
You will support the development of a comprehensive web portal that facilitates access to our forecasting tools, ensuring our internal teams can make data-driven decisions with ease. Additionally, you will manage our cloud-based compute resources, focusing on performance and scalability to efficiently leverage cloud technologies for optimal data processing capabilities.


Who You Are


Educational Background: A degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Technical Proficiency: Strong proficiency in Python is essential. Experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) is highly desirable, as it is our primary cloud service provider. Additionally, prior experience with SQL is advantageous.
Analytical Skills: Strong quantitative skills and familiarity with statistical concepts and numerical analysis are crucial due to the complexity of our systems.
Experience: At least 2+ years of experience working with Python on a daily basis.
Mindset: Possesses excellent communication skills and a collaborative spirit, coupled with a passion for innovative problem-solving and a drive to think outside the box in a team-driven environment


Where You'll Be


For this role, there will be some in-person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home. We ask that you come into the Stockholm office 2-3 times per week.


#JobSite-Featured

#JobSite-Main-DataResearchAndInsights

Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

Title: LIA - Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Carla

We believe that more people should be able to drive electric. Therefore, we have set out to build the safest, most convenient and transparent way to sell, buy, or lease an electric car. Carla was founded in 2020 in Stockholm, with strong VC backing. We have since then sold and delivered thousands of cars all over Sweden, and can boast over having the happiest customers in the car industry!

Who are we looking for?

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst Intern who is passionate about data and eager to dive into a variety of tasks. The ideal candidate is driven, digitally savvy, and possesses excellent written communication skills. A “doer” mentality is essential, as you’ll be handling diverse responsibilities ranging from data analysis to visualization.

We believe that the ideal candidate have:

Strong written communication skills (in Swedish and English)
Basic knowledge of SQL, BigQuery and Analytics
Experience using Excel and Google Sheets
Ability to analyze and interpret data to support marketing decisions
Create basic visualizations in tools such as Looker

What can we offer?

We promise a steep learning curve within digital marketing and e-commerce with a particular focus on data analysis. As a Data Analyst Intern at Carla, you will be given a great opportunity to learn, explore and gain experience within the field of data analysis to create real impact for a fast-growing start-up company.
