Title: Senior Data Analyst, Commercial & Marketing
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re a leading online reviews platform, free and open to all. Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead of us. Do you want to join us at the heart of trust?

Trustpilot’s growth has been exponential - from a successful IPO to building out new teams, we never stop working hard to fulfill our mission to create better experiences for everyone through our platform. But to do that, we need data! That’s where Analytics comes in - you’ll enable us measure, uncover insights, and predict, to get data everywhere in Trustpilot. We’ve built a innovative analytics team that spans two continents and four cities - are you ready to join a fun, diverse global team?

As a Data Analyst at Trustpilot, you will collaborate with Trusties in our Commercial and Marketing or Trust teams and spend your time digging through our data to provide them with data-driven insights, as well as analytics and dashboards/reporting. You’re keen to ensure them use data to answer their toughest questions, and you can proactively identify areas that need a little data support. You’ll be an internal data consultant, with loads of amazing data in our data warehouse at your fingertips, working with analytical tools including BigQuery and Looker.

Commercial/Marketing

As a B2B company, understanding our customers’ journey from prospect to paid customer is key. In this role, you get to join a growing team of data analysts and work closely with our Marketing, Sales, Customer Success and Operations teams. The team is responsible for all types of analyses to support our marketing and commercial efforts and strategy, from understanding which marketing campaigns work well, to mapping our customers’ journey through data and analysing the impact of our pricing initiatives.

Trust

A huge part of what we do at Trustpilot is Trust (it’s in the name!). We need to ensure that the content on our platform is real content from real people. That means eliminating scam and spam, and identifying fraudulent behavior. We have several cross functional teams devoted to Trust. You’ll be tightly aligned to their goals, assisting teams such as Content Integrity to discover fraudulent activity, and helping data scientists assess their spam models.

What You’ll Be Doing


Delivering expert analytics and insights to different parts of the business, through both workstream-focused initiatives and ad-hoc inquiries
Picking the right solution for the problem you’ve got, from your arsenal of analytical tools and methods
Working closely with the Commercial/Marketing or Trust teams to understand their data and their goals to deliver awesome solutions
Presenting and promoting your work to the wider business, to enable data-inform choices
Mentoring and transferring knowledge to more junior team members


Who You Are


Deep knowledge of key analytical and statistical methodologies, such as model-based analyses (regression, clustering etc.), cohort analysis and A/B testing. as well as reporting best practices, leveraging BI tools (such as Looker, Tableau etc.)
Knowledge of reporting best practices and experience delivering actionable insights leveraging BI tools (such as Looker, Tableau etc.)
Experience in stakeholder and project management, with the knowledge to deliver results back to the business
Proficiency in R or Python, and awesome SQL skills
Familiarity with Airflow, DBT or similar tools used for building data pipelines
Advanced written and verbal communication skills


What's in it for you?


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Newly renovated central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops
Tax-Free Travel (DSB)


Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Trustpilot

At Trustpilot, we’re passionate about our mission to offer a free and open to all review platform, built on collaboration. For consumers, we’re a place to connect with and influence businesses. For companies, we’re a platform for progress; a way to improve and innovate by engaging and collaborating with consumers.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be a tangible symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations all around the world and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense.

A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.


Show more
HTML:
We’re a leading online reviews platform, free and open to all. Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust. We are well on our way — but there’s still an exciting journey ahead of us. Do you want to join us at the heart of trust?

Trustpilot’s growth has been exponential - from a successful IPO to building out new teams, we never stop working hard to fulfill our mission to create better experiences for everyone through our platform. But to do that, we need data! That’s where Analytics comes in - you’ll enable us measure, uncover insights, and predict, to get data everywhere in Trustpilot. We’ve built a innovative analytics team that spans two continents and four cities - are you ready to join a fun, diverse global team?

As a Data Analyst at Trustpilot, you will collaborate with Trusties in our Commercial and Marketing or Trust teams and spend your time digging through our data to provide them with data-driven insights, as well as analytics and dashboards/reporting. You’re keen to ensure them use data to answer their toughest questions, and you can proactively identify areas that need a little data support. You’ll be an internal data consultant, with loads of amazing data in our data warehouse at your fingertips, working with analytical tools including BigQuery and Looker.

Commercial/Marketing

As a B2B company, understanding our customers’ journey from prospect to paid customer is key. In this role, you get to join a growing team of data analysts and work closely with our Marketing, Sales, Customer Success and Operations teams. The team is responsible for all types of analyses to support our marketing and commercial efforts and strategy, from understanding which marketing campaigns work well, to mapping our customers’ journey through data and analysing the impact of our pricing initiatives.

Trust

A huge part of what we do at Trustpilot is Trust (it’s in the name!). We need to ensure that the content on our platform is real content from real people. That means eliminating scam and spam, and identifying fraudulent behavior. We have several cross functional teams devoted to Trust. You’ll be tightly aligned to their goals, assisting teams such as Content Integrity to discover fraudulent activity, and helping data scientists assess their spam models.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Delivering expert analytics and insights to different parts of the business, through both workstream-focused initiatives and ad-hoc inquiries
  • Picking the right solution for the problem you’ve got, from your arsenal of analytical tools and methods
  • Working closely with the Commercial/Marketing or Trust teams to understand their data and their goals to deliver awesome solutions
  • Presenting and promoting your work to the wider business, to enable data-inform choices
  • Mentoring and transferring knowledge to more junior team members

Who You Are

  • Deep knowledge of key analytical and statistical methodologies, such as model-based analyses (regression, clustering etc.), cohort analysis and A/B testing. as well as reporting best practices, leveraging BI tools (such as Looker, Tableau etc.)
  • Knowledge of reporting best practices and experience delivering actionable insights leveraging BI tools (such as Looker, Tableau etc.)
  • Experience in stakeholder and project management, with the knowledge to deliver results back to the business
  • Proficiency in R or Python, and awesome SQL skills
  • Familiarity with Airflow, DBT or similar tools used for building data pipelines
  • Advanced written and verbal communication skills

What's in it for you?

  • A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
  • Competitive compensation package + bonus
  • 25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
  • Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
  • Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
  • Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
  • Paid parental leave
  • Newly renovated central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
  • Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
  • Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
  • Employee discounts to restaurants and shops
  • Tax-Free Travel (DSB)

Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Trustpilot

At Trustpilot, we’re passionate about our mission to offer a free and open to all review platform, built on collaboration. For consumers, we’re a place to connect with and influence businesses. For companies, we’re a platform for progress; a way to improve and innovate by engaging and collaborating with consumers.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be a tangible symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations all around the world and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense.

A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Brænder du for at skabe værdi med data, og har du lyst til at bidrage til en transformation i vores BI-team? Vil du være med til at formulere og drive vores datawarehouse-strategi i fællesskab med et stærkt team, og sikre at vi kan tage databaserede beslutninger på tværs af organisationen?







Data & Insights

Hej, jeg hedder Henri, og jeg er leder for afdelingen Data & Insights, hvor vi arbejder med data, for at skabe indsigt og drive strategiske beslutninger på tværs af Magasin. Vi er i en spændende transformation og søger en medarbejder, der sammen med resten af vores team vil tage ansvar for at definere og kommunikere tekniske krav for vores nye datawarehouse, og sikre at vi kan levere på vores globale strategi og de enkelte afdelingers behov.




Vi søger en ny kollega, der kan tage del i ejerskabet over vores datawarehouse-projekt, og drive udviklingen af vores BI-strategi sammen med teamet. Du vil arbejde sammen med et team bestående af BI Specialists, BI Developers, Web Analytics Specialists, Insights Specialists og AI Specialists. Målet er at skabe et team, der er fuldt fokuseret på at levere værdifuld indsigt og strategisk rådgivning ved hjælp af data.







Opgaver og ansvarsområder

Som Business Intelligence Specialist hos os vil du arbejde i spændingsfeltet mellem data og forretning.




Dine opgaver vil primært være:

Definere og kommunikere tekniske krav til udvikling og vedligeholdelse af vores nye datawarehouse i Microsoft SQL Server i samarbejde med teamet
Sikre dataeksponering til slutbrugere via QlikView og QlikSense
Forståelse og implementering af global strategi samt afdelingsspecifikke strategier
Udarbejdelse af KPI-rapporter og dashboards til forskellige forretningsenheder
Bidrage til data governance og kvalitetssikring af vores data
Samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af afdelinger for at identificere og løse datarelaterede udfordringer







Skal du være en del af teamet?

Vi søger en ny kollega med stærk erfaring inden for Business Intelligence, som ønsker at være med til at drive vores datawarehouse-projekt og skabe værdi gennem data. Jobbet kræver gode kompetencer inden for SQL og data modellering samt en stærk interesse for at forstå og støtte forretningsstrategier. Teknisk erfaring er et plus, men det vigtigste er evnen til at formulere og specificere tekniske krav for implementering af andre BI-specialister. Vores datawarehouse-udvikling er en teamopgave, og vi søger derfor en kollega, der trives med samarbejde og fælles ansvar. Vi ønsker hele tiden at forbedre os, og søger derfor også en kollega, som gerne vil udvikle sig og tage del i interne sparringssessioner.




Vi søger en BI Specialist med følgende egenskaber:

Erfaring med forskellige SQL-dialekter (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, Snowflake SQL)
Kendskab til QlikView og QlikSense
Stærk forståelse af dimensionel modellering
Erfaring med data warehouse-udvikling er en fordel, men ikke et krav
Gode kommunikationsevner og interesse for at formidle analyser og indsigter
Evnen til at arbejde i en organisation med et stærkt kommercielt fokus
Interesse for at forstå både den overordnede strategi og de specifikke udfordringer i de forskellige afdelinger







Mig som leder

Jeg har en forventning om, at du vil sætte din faglighed i spil, og at du er bevidst om, at vi løfter i flok. Jeg vil altid være tilgængelig som sparringspartner, men jeg stoler på mine medarbejderes faglige kunnen, og i dagligdagen er det dit ansvar at sikre, at dine kolleger får maksimalt udbytte af de data og indsigter, du leverer.




Med Magasin som arbejdsplads får du en hverdag med højt til loftet, faglig sparring, gode udviklingsmuligheder og masser af energi. Jeg glæder mig til at få én mere med på holdet.




De bedste hilsner,

Henri Legentil-Borup,

Head of Data & Insights







Vil du søge jobbet?

Vi indkalder løbende til samtaler, og går du videre i processen, skal du igennem flere steps, hvor både du og vi vurderer, om denne stilling er det rigtige match for dig og Magasin. Hos os kan du blive inviteret til samtaler med både HR, leder og ansættende direktør i et forløb på 1-2 måneder. Som en del af processen bruger vi personprofiler, problemløsningstest og faglige cases, alt sammen for at sikre det optimale match for begge parter. Vi ser frem til i sidste ende at byde den helt rette kandidat velkommen i magiske Magasin.

Show more

  • Erfaring med data warehouse-udvikling er en fordel, men ikke et krav

Title: Data Analyst - Vejle
Place: Vejle, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Data Analyst - Vejle:

Do you thrive in a technology forward environment where everyone contributes towards the evolution of the team and business?

Then this could be your next role.

This business has been on an organic growth journey thanks to success year on year.

With a team of now 30+ across Vejle and Copenhagen, they have built a genuine development driven community where team members get to be autonomous and drive their own solutions.

After successfully adding new team members in software development, platform engineering and data engineering - we are now looking for our next data analyst.

As our new data analyst you will be responsible for the data within our data driven products, taking ownership of the solution. Helping to provide new insights and market trends to help the business with their proven success:

Key responsibilities:


Dive deep into big data sets to spot and explore trends
Craft detailed reports, insightful analyses, and dynamic dashboards to monitor the vitality of our business
Pioneer the creation of innovative leading indicators to empower our data driven products in shaping new forward facing data strategies
Stay ahead of potential risks through proactive risk management and deliver compelling reports that resonate with stakeholders


Key skills required:


Prior experience delving into data
Love to craft efficient and well-structured SQL queries
In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.
In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and fluent in English


Any experience with data lakes on S3 would also be welcomed!

If you think you know how to unlock value out of a fast paced data solution, then you could be what I am looking for!

Title: Data Analyst to support commercial data stewardship (Copenhagen)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Data Analyst to support commercial data stewardship (Copenhagen)

In Commercial Data & Analytics (CDA) we are more than +50 Analysts, Consultants, Engineers and Data Scientists working on transforming, tracking and improving the commercial results of Danske Bank. 

We work with different types of behavioural data form Personal Customers. We are a global team working across the value chain from technical solutions and data, downstream towards the Business utilising BI and Data Science. Likewise we are part of the Forward ’28 strategy on delivering great customer experiences which involves a focus on digital solutions and a more tailored and holistic advisory experience where data will be the key enabler.  

You will be joining the Commercial Data team that consists of approx. 15 colleagues across Copenhagen, Vilnius and Bangalore, where we build and maintain data assets for a variety of use cases like BI and Data Science. 

Your task will include:


Working closely with the whole data value chain ranging from System Owners over Business users and analysts to data engineers and data architects 
Working with our Data Management framework and processes with a focus on critical data elements in the Business 
Working on continuous improvement of data quality with the team and our Technology organisation 
Drive the escalation and remediation process for Customer related data issues 
Assume responsibility of specific data assets within the commercial data domain 


About you:


Recently graduated with maximum of 2 years of experience
Experience with data modelling and ETL pipelines   
Experience with Data Management Frameworks is beneficial 
Experience in a programming language like SQL and/or Python 
High analytical and problem solving skills 
You like to proactively collaborate with people across the organisation and from different cultures 
Excellent written and spoken English 


A normal workday for our data analyst will consist of working with your team of data- and business experts ensuring our data assets are properly managed and documented. This will enable us to deliver on high quality customer journeys as well as enable us to become more digital cf. the Forward ’28 strategy. Likewise, a big part of the job will make use of the analytical skills working with our databases and understanding our data models and linking that knowledge into the data framework. 

Want to join our team?

Uniqueness is powerful-we welcome everyone in Danske Bank. Please note that responses to applications for this position may be delayed due to summer holidays. You can expect a response by the end of August. We appreciate your understanding and patience. If you have any questions regarding the profile, please reach out to Anders Müller, ANDML@danskebank.dk in August or Max Jørgensen MAXJO@danskebank.dk in July.

We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

Title: Revenue analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable business opportunities? Do you excel in dynamic environments, leading data-driven commercial improvements with multiple stakeholders?

Join Kahoot!, one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS companies, and be part of our exciting growth journey!

We are looking for a Revenue Analyst to join our Commercial Excellence team, responsible for driving commercial success across our global organization. If you thrive in a global setting, welcome challenges, enjoy being hands-on, and are driven to perform and succeed, this is a fantastic opportunity to shine in our commercial team. With access to vast amounts of data, you will play a key role in translating it into valuable business opportunities for our customer-facing teams and management.

This position can be located in Copenhagen, Denmark or Oslo, Norway. 

Please note due to vacation the first stage of this recruitment will not start before 15th August 2024.

About Kahoot!
The Kahoot! Group is on a mission to make learning awesome! We want to empower everyone, including children, students, and employees to unlock their full learning potential. Our Kahoot! learning platform makes it easy for any individual or corporation to create, share, and host learning sessions that drive compelling engagement.

Launched in 2013, Kahoot!'s vision is to build the leading learning platform in the world. Since launch, Kahoot! has hosted hundreds of millions of learning sessions with more than 10 billion participants (non-unique) in more than 200 countries and regions. The Kahoot! Group includes Clever, the leading US K-12 EdTech learning platform, together with the learning apps DragonBox, Poio, Drops, Actimo, Motimate, and Whiteboard.fi.

The Kahoot! Group is headquartered in Oslo, Norway, with offices in the US, the UK, France, Finland, Estonia, Denmark, Spain and Poland. To learn more, visit us at kahoot.com, and let's play!

Our K!rew

At the Kahoot! Group we champion a positive culture of collaborative learning and innovation. With a global team of more than 500 employees representing over 50 different nationalities, we're a diverse and fun bunch of people! We work hard and celebrate our wins, tackle challenges with original ideas and learn something new every day.

We are driven by our mission and guided by our values: playful, curious and inclusive.  

If you talk to anyone working in the Kahoot! Group, they will tell you that one of the greatest perks is being able to see how the work you do puts a smile on the face of kids, teachers and learners all around the world. 


The role

To further strengthen our commercial success, we are looking for a Revenue Analyst to join our team. You will report to the Director of Commercial Excellence and work closely with the commercial teams and sales operations in the US, EMEA & APAC regions.

We want to take the next step in becoming more data driven in our commercial operation, and your main responsibility is to work on revenue-generating initiatives, deliver valuable data insights, and collaborate cross-functionally to improve business performance. 

Responsibilities

Monitor and analyse sales performance data, revenue trends and patterns, to identify growth opportunities for our commercial functions. 
Identify and analyse revenue leakage or areas of underperformance to recommend corrective actions. 
Lead data projects that support revenue growth and strategic business initiatives.
Working closely with cross-functional teams, including Customer Success, Business Development, Industry Sales, Channel Sales, Data team and Sales Operations to ensure maximum impact of data projects. 
Collaborating with our CRM team to streamline processes and reporting across our CRM platform and other relevant tools. 
Work with relevant teams to ensure seamless integration of data insights into sales processes. 
Recommend, develop and maintain relevant key metrics to monitor commercial success and drive continuous improvement.
Perform ad-hoc analysis, reports/key metrics on recurring schedule, translate and communicate results to management.





Requirements


Bachelor's degree or equivalent.
3+ years of experience in similar position.
Experience supporting large account sales and customer success teams.
Experience with Google BigQuery, HubSpot and Amplitude is a clear advantage.
Strong skills in data analysis, including the ability to analyse large datasets, identify trends, and draw actionable insights.
Solid commercial acumen with a good understanding of sales and the commercial side of the business. 
Great communication and presentation skills for delivering data insights to various internal stakeholders.
Teamplayer with strong collaboration skills, experience and ability to work across functional teams and across multiple markets.
Ambitious with a track record of supporting strong results through analysis, insights, collaboration and the ability to make things happen and within tight deadlines.
Structured, proactive and professional approach, always seeking to create progression. 



Benefits


A competitive compensation package.
Paid maternity and paternity leave.
Home broadband allowance.
Mobile subscription.
Lunch contribution.
Hybrid work set up.
Flexible working.
Buddy program.
Social and company events (virtual and in person).
A diverse, friendly and international environment.
Modern office in central Copenhagen.
Show more
HTML:
Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable business opportunities? Do you excel in dynamic environments, leading data-driven commercial improvements with multiple stakeholders?

Join Kahoot!, one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS companies, and be part of our exciting growth journey!

We are looking for a Revenue Analyst to join our Commercial Excellence team, responsible for driving commercial success across our global organization. If you thrive in a global setting, welcome challenges, enjoy being hands-on, and are driven to perform and succeed, this is a fantastic opportunity to shine in our commercial team. With access to vast amounts of data, you will play a key role in translating it into valuable business opportunities for our customer-facing teams and management.

This position can be located in Copenhagen, Denmark or Oslo, Norway. 

Please note due to vacation the first stage of this recruitment will not start before 15th August 2024.

About Kahoot!
The Kahoot! Group is on a mission to make learning awesome! We want to empower everyone, including children, students, and employees to unlock their full learning potential. Our Kahoot! learning platform makes it easy for any individual or corporation to create, share, and host learning sessions that drive compelling engagement.

Launched in 2013, Kahoot!'s vision is to build the leading learning platform in the world. Since launch, Kahoot! has hosted hundreds of millions of learning sessions with more than 10 billion participants (non-unique) in more than 200 countries and regions. The Kahoot! Group includes Clever, the leading US K-12 EdTech learning platform, together with the learning apps DragonBox, Poio, Drops, Actimo, Motimate, and Whiteboard.fi.

The Kahoot! Group is headquartered in Oslo, Norway, with offices in the US, the UK, France, Finland, Estonia, Denmark, Spain and Poland. To learn more, visit us at kahoot.com, and let's play!

Our K!rew

At the Kahoot! Group we champion a positive culture of collaborative learning and innovation. With a global team of more than 500 employees representing over 50 different nationalities, we're a diverse and fun bunch of people! We work hard and celebrate our wins, tackle challenges with original ideas and learn something new every day.

We are driven by our mission and guided by our values: playful, curious and inclusive.  

If you talk to anyone working in the Kahoot! Group, they will tell you that one of the greatest perks is being able to see how the work you do puts a smile on the face of kids, teachers and learners all around the world. 


The role

To further strengthen our commercial success, we are looking for a Revenue Analyst to join our team. You will report to the Director of Commercial Excellence and work closely with the commercial teams and sales operations in the US, EMEA & APAC regions.

We want to take the next step in becoming more data driven in our commercial operation, and your main responsibility is to work on revenue-generating initiatives, deliver valuable data insights, and collaborate cross-functionally to improve business performance. 

Responsibilities

  • Monitor and analyse sales performance data, revenue trends and patterns, to identify growth opportunities for our commercial functions. 
  • Identify and analyse revenue leakage or areas of underperformance to recommend corrective actions. 
  • Lead data projects that support revenue growth and strategic business initiatives.
  • Working closely with cross-functional teams, including Customer Success, Business Development, Industry Sales, Channel Sales, Data team and Sales Operations to ensure maximum impact of data projects. 
  • Collaborating with our CRM team to streamline processes and reporting across our CRM platform and other relevant tools. 
  • Work with relevant teams to ensure seamless integration of data insights into sales processes. 
  • Recommend, develop and maintain relevant key metrics to monitor commercial success and drive continuous improvement.
  • Perform ad-hoc analysis, reports/key metrics on recurring schedule, translate and communicate results to management.



Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent.
  • 3+ years of experience in similar position.
  • Experience supporting large account sales and customer success teams.
  • Experience with Google BigQuery, HubSpot and Amplitude is a clear advantage.
  • Strong skills in data analysis, including the ability to analyse large datasets, identify trends, and draw actionable insights.
  • Solid commercial acumen with a good understanding of sales and the commercial side of the business. 
  • Great communication and presentation skills for delivering data insights to various internal stakeholders.
  • Teamplayer with strong collaboration skills, experience and ability to work across functional teams and across multiple markets.
  • Ambitious with a track record of supporting strong results through analysis, insights, collaboration and the ability to make things happen and within tight deadlines.
  • Structured, proactive and professional approach, always seeking to create progression. 


Benefits

  • A competitive compensation package.
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave.
  • Home broadband allowance.
  • Mobile subscription.
  • Lunch contribution.
  • Hybrid work set up.
  • Flexible working.
  • Buddy program.
  • Social and company events (virtual and in person).
  • A diverse, friendly and international environment.
  • Modern office in central Copenhagen.

Title: Senior Specialist Membership Performance Analytics & Insights
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Ready to transform LEGO® Membership's performance management, driving data-driven decisions and joining a value-driven company in a global role? Then look no further!

Join us for an exciting career as “Senior Membership Performance Specialist” as part of the newly established Membership & Personalisation team within LEGO® Market & Channels Global Marketing.

Please note the work location is either Copenhagen or Billund, Denmark and no relocation assistance is offered for this role.


Core Responsibilities





Lead performance management projects for Membership & Personalization, by supporting the creation of reporting frameworks, helping to define relevant performance and business metrics, and by supporting performance improvement initiatives across all cross-functional reporting & analytics teams
Support the delivery of high-quality reports on a weekly and monthly basis, covering the latest performance insights on our member base to drive data-driven decision making, in close partnership with reporting, analytics and finance teams across the business
Support the briefing and/or creation of self-service dashboards, to facilitate speed and transparency in performance updates
Support the delivery of member, channel and campaign insights, levering all available data and tools to showcase business opportunities, working closely with Membership Acquisition & Activation, and Membership Expansion teams
Support the (annual) forecasting & target setting process of Membership & Personalization, in conjunction with the LEGO Group’s OKR and portfolio planning process, and in close partnership with Finance, CRM Hub, Membership operations, M&C (Markets & Channels), PMD (Product Marketing Development), Digital and Supply chain
Support the P&L management process of Membership & Personalization, by investigating trends by and creating insights on what actions will improve top and bottom line results, in close partnership with Finance
Partner with the Membership Operations team on member feedback & satisfaction tracking and reporting, and help synthesize into overall membership performance
Contribute to creating a performance culture by helping to define the standard-of-excellence in performance management, and by actively encouraging knowledge-sharing across performance management teams in M&C, PMD and LEGO Retail
Help driving an agile way-of-working model, ensuring quality, flexibility and speed in how business questions are tackled




Play your part in our team succeeding

This position will be responsible for leading performance management projects and actively contributes to planning & target setting within Membership & Personalization. Collaborating with key cross functional teams across M&C (Markets & Channels), PMD (Product Marketing Department), and Digital, helping us leverage data to achieve our membership and personalization goals effectively and efficiently.

You will report directly to the Senior Director Performance, Development & Decisioning.

Do you have what it takes?





Strong experience in performance management, insights, and/or analytics, with proficiency in Adobe Analytics or similar tools, SQL-based databases, and Tableau or PowerBI.
Experience in SQL and Excel is a must
Strong structured problem solving & communication capabilities
Excels at creating clear, concise and actionable insights from multiple data sources to answer business questions
Proficient understanding of personalization, CRM, and loyalty programs
An enthusiastic, positive approach and determination to overcome obstacles; can-do attitude, focused on quality, efficiency, and operational excellence.
Open, collaborative communication style, with experience working across cultures and time zones to build connected, sustainable relationships regardless of organizational structure




Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different minority backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The position as Senior Data Engineer will be based in our HQ in Copenhagen and will be part of our Data Team, which sits within the Tech and R&D division. This is a full-time global role reporting into our Head of Data Science and with close collaboration with other departments such as Operations, Finance, etc.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES




To continue expanding JOE & THE JUICE, we need the best data, and insights, powered by a rock-solid data team, as along with store openings, growth must be increased by a greater rate of digitization and data knowledge.




We are an agile team that cherishes the “walk-the-talk” approach to continually improve insights, perform datamining, uncover hidden patterns, and opportunities, in an environment that fosters learning, experimentation, and growth. The Data team is responsible for the entire data ecosystem, including data platform, streamlined access to data through efficient data pipelines and providing visionary insights using advanced machine learning models. The team is working closely with in-house software engineering teams and other stakeholders within JOE & THE JUICE to establish best in class insight for the first F&B brand to truly run using a unified system globally.




In short – the team is the foundation of what makes JOE & THE JUICE run and grow from a tech point of view while maintaining a close dialog with other development teams and key business stakeholders such as finance, operations, etc.




The Data team is currently in the process of streamlining various data sources and establishing the data platform on Fivetran, dbt and Snowflake based stack. As a champion of data engineering and architecture, you will be responsible for delivering and maintaining data pipelines and source integrations on the foundational data platform.




To contribute to this process, we are seeking a Senior Data Engineer to:




Solidify the data platform by establishing best practices, standards, and processes for effective and efficient use.
Create data pipelines to automate data deliveries for business-critical functions.
Support Data team’s vision of enabling stakeholders across the organization through data-driven decision making.




KEY QUALIFICATIONS




Desired Competencies:

5+ years of experience in data engineering and platforms, with solid interest in big data analytics and machine learning.
Hands-on experience in complex time-series data in Retail or related industry.
Practical experience with integration of data from multiple data sources (PostgreSQL, MySQL RDS, MS Dynamics, etc.). We use Fivetran, dbt, Snowflake and AWS Redshift, so experience in this stack is preferable but relevant experience with other similar tools is also valuable and will be considered.
Experience with technologies like Docker, Airflow, Git, etc.
Knowledge of Software engineering and CI/CD principles for developing, deploying, and maintaining end-to-end data pipelines and data solutions using agile practices.
Skills in programming languages such as Python, SQL, and R.
Team player with excellent communication skills to facilitate collaboration across departments.
Curious, self-driven, solution-oriented individual eager to learn new skills and adapt.




Good To Have:

Experience in data visualization and knowledge of tools like PowerBI, Tableau etc.
Pipeline and Infrastructure monitoring tools like AWS Cloudwatch, ELK, Dagster, Prometheus, Grafana etc.
Kubernetes and Kafka.




THE BENEFITS




We offer a benefits package that includes pension plan, health insurance, parental leave, and additional vacation. Besides that, we provide some Joe-ified benefits:

Our global headquarter is located with great accessibility in the heart of Copenhagen and accommodates 130+ employees.
Our office facilities include a fully staffed JOE & THE JUICE bar, serving breakfast, daily lunch, juice and barista coffee.
Our office features an ambient atmosphere with carefully curated music.
In Joe we have a flat hierarchy where all opinions are valued, allowing plenty of room for input and improvement ideas.
Our monthly social calendar is packed with great activities such as running club, wine tasting, creative evenings and Friday bars.
Coming soon: Fitness facilities filled with all equipment you need to keep yourself healthy and fit, along with already accessible showers with complimentary towels as well as a steam room.




THE PROCESS




We are looking for a candidate to start as soon as possible
We will only consider applications through Easy Apply and will conduct interviews ongoingly.
If you have any questions, please direct them to Shashank Chauhan on shashank.chauhan@joejuice.com.

Title: Data analyst til SOEC (Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cell) Fabrikken i Herning.
Description:
Er du klar til at være en del af Topsoes CO2-reduktionsmission?

Kunne du tænke dig at være med fra starten i vores helt nye fabrik i Herning og være en del af et dynamisk team der starter produktionen op – så læs videre her

Om os

Topsoe er en global leverandør af løsninger til energiomstillingen.

Baseret på årtiers forskning og innovation hjælper vi vores kunder med at omdanne vedvarende ressourcer, såsom biomateriale, vind og vand, til brændstoffer og kemikalier. Vi bidrager samtidig med løsninger til effektiv produktion af brændstoffer, der udleder færre drivhusgasser, og til en renere luftkvalitet.

Vi blev grundlagt i 1940 og har hovedkontor i Danmark. Vores cirka 2.800 medarbejdere hjælper kunder over hele verden. Du kan læse mere om os på www.topsoe.com, topsoe.com, Topsoe A/S SOEC Fabrik Herning, www.Topsoe.com/Herning & Topsoe Herning | Facebook

Topsoes Power-to-X-enhed er et strategisk fyrtårn på vores vej til at være den førende leverandør af teknologier til reduktion af CO2-emissioner. Vi søger nu en Automation Engineer/ PLC specialist til at være en del af det team der skal opbygge og vedligeholde automationen på vores høj automatiseret fabrik i Herning. Vores SOEC-elektrolyseteknologi vil gennem sin uovertrufne energieffektivitet spille en væsentlig rolle i den grønne elektrificering af den kemiske industri og raffinaderiindustrien.

Den person, vi leder efter

Er passioneret og visionær Data analyst med en solid baggrund inden for MES/SCADA systemer. Du skal være passioneret omkring det at få automatiserede løsninger til at fungere i den virkelige verden. Din erfaring med at løse problemer og din evne til at opbygge og vedligeholde relationer vil være afgørende for succes i denne rolle. Du er dedikeret til vores mission om at føre an i CO2-reduktionsteknologier og forme fremtiden for grøn industri. Muligvis har du nogle års erfaring, men du kan også være nyuddannet, vigtigst er din nysgerrighed omkring og lyst til at arbejde inden for automation eller software. På vores fabrik, hvor automatiseringsgraden er ekstremt høj, og du og dine kolleger en afgørende indflydelse på fabrikkens succes. Din rolle bliver central i at sikre vores teknologiske overlegenhed og globale indflydelse. Vi arbejder med produkter fra Aveva, men kendskab til det er ikke et krav.

Det, du vil bringe

Som vores nye Data analyst bliver du bindeleddet imellem produktionen og data afdelingen. Din ekspertise i at finde de rette data i MES/SCADA systemet, er afgørende for at opnå vores mål om at være førende inden for grøn teknologi. Du har erfaring med MES/SCADA-systemer og ved hvilke data der kan findes og trækkes ud. Din erfaring i at vedligeholde MES/SCADA-systemer, er med til at forme vores succes på vores topmoderne fabrik i Herning, hvor automatisering er nøglen til vores enestående produktionspræstationer og banebrydende teknologiske løsninger.

Hvorfor arbejde hos os?

Vi har brug for dig! - Topsoe er på en mission for at redde planeten – ved at blive verdens førende inden for CO2-reduktionsteknologier. Og du vil få en meget vigtig rolle i at få vores produktion til at blive en succes. Du kan være med til at gøre en forskel og blive udfordret og udviklet personligt og fagligt.

Sådan kan du ansøge

Er du klar til denne udfordringer og at bidrage til vores mission, vil vi gerne hører fra dig. Kontakt Automation manager Anders Schmieg Toft, telefon +45 2647 8003 e-mail ATOF@topsoe.com hvis du vil vide mere om stillingen.

Hvis du gerne vil være en del af et team af dygtige og professionelle kolleger i en uformel organisation, skal du sende din ansøgning og CV på dansk eller engelsk og vedlægge en kopi af dine referencer via vores hjemmeside www.topsoe.com. Vi behandler ansøgningerne løbende.
Show more

Som vores nye Data analyst bliver du bindeleddet imellem produktionen og data afdelingen. Din ekspertise i at finde de rette data i MES/SCADA systemet, er afgørende for at opnå vores mål om at være førende inden for grøn teknologi. Du har erfaring med MES/SCADA-systemer og ved hvilke data der kan findes og trækkes ud. Din erfaring i at vedligeholde MES/SCADA-systemer, er med til at forme vores succes på vores topmoderne fabrik i Herning, hvor automatisering er nøglen til vores enestående produktionspræstationer og banebrydende teknologiske løsninger.

Hvorfor arbejde hos os?

Vi har brug for dig! - Topsoe er på en mission for at redde planeten – ved at blive verdens førende inden for CO2-reduktionsteknologier. Og du vil få en meget vigtig rolle i at få vores produktion til at blive en succes. Du kan være med til at gøre en forskel og blive udfordret og udviklet personligt og fagligt.

Sådan kan du ansøge

Er du klar til denne udfordringer og at bidrage til vores mission, vil vi gerne hører fra dig. Kontakt Automation manager Anders Schmieg Toft, telefon +45 2647 8003 e-mail ATOF@topsoe.com hvis du vil vide mere om stillingen.

Hvis du gerne vil være en del af et team af dygtige og professionelle kolleger i en uformel organisation, skal du sende din ansøgning og CV på dansk eller engelsk og vedlægge en kopi af dine referencer via vores hjemmeside www.topsoe.com. Vi behandler ansøgningerne løbende.

Title: Data Analyst/Business Intelligence Specialist-Bornfiber Danmark
Place: Taastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Bornfiber er en innovativ virksomhed som leverer fiber til private og erhvervskunder bl.a. på Sjælland og Bornholm. Bornfiber stræber efter at være i front med de nyeste teknologiske løsninger. Dedikerede til at levere datadrevne indsigter og skabe værdi for deres kunder gennem avancerede dataanalyser og business intelligence løsninger.

Bornfiber søger derfor en dygtig og engageret Data Analyst/Business Intelligence Specialist til at blive en del af deres team. Du vil arbejde i spændingsfeltet mellem finans, forretning og IT med at udvikle vores rapporteringer, analyser og systemer afhængig af interesse og kompetencer.

Arbejdsopgaver



Udvikle og implementere en topmoderne data platform baseret på Microsofts - MS Fabric.
Analysere og visualisere data ved hjælp af Microsoft Power BI for at understøtte forretningsbeslutninger.
Designe og vedligeholde dashboards og rapporter, der præsenterer data på en klar og intuitiv måde. Der skal udarbejdes bestyrelsesrapportering og analyser til forretningen
Samarbejde med forskellige afdelinger for at forstå deres data behov og levere skræddersyede løsninger.
Identificere og foreslå forbedringer til eksisterende data processer og BI løsninger.
Sikre datakvalitet og integritet gennem regelmæssige kontroller og opdateringer.
Vedligeholde vores data platform, som er bygget efter best practice i Microsoft Azure.



Kvalifikationer



Bachelorgrad i datalogi, business intelligence, økonomi eller en relateret disciplin.
Mindst 3 års erfaring med dataanalyse og business intelligence.
Stærk erfaring med Microsoft Power BI, herunder design og udvikling af dashboards og rapporter.
Erfaring med opbygning og vedligeholdelse af data platforme, gerne med kendskab til MS Fabric, Python, PoverBI og SQl.
Fremragende analytiske evner og evnen til at omsætte komplekse data til brugbare indsigter.
Gode kommunikationsfærdigheder og evnen til at arbejde effektivt både selvstændigt og i team.



Bornfiber tilbyder



Muligheden for at arbejde med banebrydende teknologi og innovative løsninger.
Et dynamisk og inspirerende arbejdsmiljø med gode udviklingsmuligheder.
Konkurrencedygtig løn og attraktive medarbejderfordele.
Fleksible arbejdstider og mulighed for hjemmearbejde.



Taplow Executive Search er udvalgt som rekrutteringspartner og står for udvælgelsen af denne rekruttering.

Title: Student Developer
Description:
Hvis du er én af de dygtigste på din årgang og er selvkørende med masser af drive, leder Trifork SKT9 lige nu efter en ny studenterprogrammør

Trifork SKT9 søger studenterprogrammør

Vi søger lige nu en studerende til at hjælpe med vores spændende projekter.

Vi arbejder med nyeste teknologi indenfor f.eks. Cloud (Google, AWS & Azure), RESTful API snitflader, Sikkerhed, Webudvikling, Native mobile apps, Microservices, Docker, Kubernetes, Vision, Conversational og Generative AI, Machine Learning og meget andet.

Hvis du brænder for at gøre en forskel for andre og gerne vil udvikle dig både fagligt og personligt, mens du tjener lidt til SU'en, så er det dig vi leder efter.

Om dig


Du er i slutningen af dit studie enten på Datalogi eller Softwareteknologi og brænder for at prøve dine evner af på ægte problemer
Du er en dygtig C#- eller Java udvikler
Du har erfaring med web-udvikling
Du har måske erfaring med appudvikling til Android eller iOS?
Du har måske erfaring med Angular eller React?
Du har erfaring med versionsstyring og samarbejde
Du har et stort drive og er meget selvkørende
Du trives når du arbejder som en del af et hold
Du tager ansvar for egne opgaver
Du er nysgerrig på at lære nye teknologier og har et par hobbyprojekter du udvikler på i din fritid


Hvad Vi Tilbyder

Hos Trifork vil du fra dag 1 blive en del af et af vores projekter, og få et medansvar for at udvikle og designe dele af projektet sammen med dine nye kolleger.

Vi tilbyder en fleksibel arbejdsplads med rig mulighed for at tilpasse både arbejdsplads og –tider så det passer i dit studie. Hos os finder du et afslappet arbejdsmiljø med højt til loftet og kort til bordfodbold og bordtennis bordet.

Ikke mere end 42 mennesker på kontoret

Hvorfor, spørger du så? Vi ønsker at sikre at et kontor ikke bliver for stort, så du altid ved hvem du sidder ved siden af. Ved ikke at have for store kontorer, sikrer vi at have en uformel og afslappet kultur, hvor alle kender hinanden. Det gør også at vi er små autonome enheder og hvor medbestemmelse/indflydelse på hverdagen er en væsentlig faktor. Så på trods af, at Trifork er en virksomhed med mere end 1200 ansatte, så føles det ofte som at arbejde i en startup virksomhed med et stærkt og samarbejdsvenligt miljø, hvor alle kan blive hørt.

Bemærk, screening af ansøgninger vil først finde sted fra uge 33.

Vi ser frem til at modtage dit CV, ansøgning samt karakterblad.

Title: BI Analyst til digital transformation i Telmore
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Har du interessen, evnerne og viljen til at optimere vores forretning gennem data og indsigter? Synes du at data, visualiseringer og struktur er det bedste i verden? Så er det dig vi søger til vores Digital Center of Excellence (DCX) i Telmore. Vi søger en Business Intelligence Analyst, som kan være med til at bringe fakta og indsigter i spil på tværs af hele organisationen.

Om stillingen

Telmore er en ledende spiller i det danske mobilmarked når det kommer til innovative produkter og gode kundeoplevelser. Vi stræber hele tiden efter at blive bedre, og vores fremskridt afhænger af evnen til at træffe datadrevne beslutninger. Og det er her, din rolle kommer ind i billedet. DCX er et lille, tværfagligt team bestående af blandt andet Product- og User Experience Managers. Vi bringer vores færdigheder sammen for at levere brugbare og værdiskabende indsigter til forretningen. I Telmore vil vi være digitale ”front runners”, og DCX-teamets fornemmeste opgave er at identificere områder, hvor Telmore kan digitalisere forretningen for at optimere kundeoplevelsen og reducere analoge henvendelser.

Dine primære opgaver bliver at:


Anbefale og bygge dataløsninger, der skaber relevante, kommercielle indsigter
Bygge PBI rapporter med en høj grad af automatisering til brug i hele Telmore
Udføre analytiske deep dives ved at kombinere data fra flere kilder
Være kravstiller til vores datafundament, som udvikles af dine BI kollegaer
Være ekspert og go-to person for dine kollegaer, når de har brug for at forstå og sammenligne data eller udføre specifikke analyser



Dine kvalifikationer


Du er analytisk dygtig og forstår at nedbryde komplicerede problemstillinger
Du formår at samarbejde med kollegaer på alle niveauer og jobtyper, har et godt øje for struktur og validering samt gode kommunikationsevner, så de nødvendige konklusioner når frem til forretningen
Du er desuden detaljeorienteret og har evnen til at dykke dybt ned for at finde de rigtige løsninger i komplekse datasæt
Du har stærke kundskaber inden for Power BI og Excel, evner at tage ejerskab og forstår at arbejde med opgaverne til et brugbart kommercielt output



Om Telmore

Telmore er det førende “Lovebrand” i Nuuday, og det er vi alle meget stolte af. Telmore har nu mere end 750.000 glade kunder, der bruger vores mobile produkter. Vi sidder sammen på Nuudays hovedkontor i København. Kulturen og hverdagen er uformel med højt til loftet, ansvar er noget du tager og tillid er helt naturligt noget du får som del af Telmore-familien. Vi sætter en ære og glæde i at dyrke vores sociale sammenhold og medarbejdertilfredsheden er i absolut top.

Ansøgning og kontakt

Har du yderligere spørgsmål omkring stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte kommerciel direktør og Head of BI, Ebbe Tølbøll Nielsen, på 20 25 78 60. Vi afholder løbende samtaler og anbefaler, at du sender din ansøgning hurtigst muligt.

Jobbet er baseret i Nuuday’s hovedkvarter på Teglholmen i København.

Ansøgningsfrist: 11 august 2024

Kontaktperson: Kommerciel direktør og Head of BI, Ebbe Tølbøll Nielsen, på 20 25 78 60.

Arbejdssted: Teglholmsgade 1, København

Nuuday – We make sense with technology

Nuuday er en familie af seks stærke og velkendte brands, der arbejder for det fælles mål at få teknologien til at give mening i vores liv. Vores familie består af YouSee, Telmore, Hiper, TDC Erhverv, eesy og Relatel. Vi arbejder for at forbedre menneskers og organisationers liv med innovative løsninger inden for TV, bredbånd, netværk og telefoni og underholdning. Og vi gør det sammen. På tværs af teams, 33 nationaliteter og mere end 3500 fantastiske kollegaer. Som Danmarks førende digitale service udbyder, stræber vi hver dag efter at bruge teknologien til at skabe en mere meningsfuld fremtid for vores kunder og samfundet som helhed. Derfor er vi også altid på udkig efter markedets stærkeste udviklere, de skarpeste kommercielle folk og de bedste kreative specialister, der tør udfordre og skille sig ud. Nuuday er dedikerede til at fremme en inkluderende kultur, som værdsætter diversitet, og vi er stolte af, at give lige muligheder til alle. Alle kvalificerede kandidater vil blive vurderet uafhængigt at etnicitet, religion, køn, kønsidentitet, handicap, seksuel orientering og alle de andre karakteristika, som gør os forskellige. Læs mere om, hvordan vi behandler dine personoplysninger her: https://nuuday.dk/karriere

Title: Senior IT Support Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
IT Technical Support – Join Marsh - the world's leading risk advisory and insurance brokerage firm

With over 45,000 employees across 130 countries, we empower Denmark's largest companies to navigate risks and seize business opportunities through our unrivaled expertise in risk management and insurance consulting. We are app. 150 colleagues in Denmark, eager to welcome you to our great organization.

As Senior IT Support Analyst you are on-site support to all our great colleagues and based in our modern facilities in Nordhavn. You will report to the Manager of the IT Support Team located in Sweden.

Please ensure that when applying, your CV & application is in English.

What you can expect:

Cutting-edge Technology: Work with a wide range of systems and applications, including Microsoft 365, ServiceNow, MoveWorks, Nexthink, Zoom and other Cloud based Technologies to support our local, Nordic, and global operations.

Collaborative Environment: Join forces with our Nordic teams to provide exceptional IT support to our local users in Denmark, ensuring smooth operations and seamless user experiences.

Diverse Responsibilities: From provisioning and maintaining workstations to managing mobile phones, you'll have a diverse range of tasks that keep you engaged and challenged.

Technical Excellence: Participate in technical operations and troubleshooting, leveraging your broad IT knowledge and familiarity with ITIL processes to deliver top-notch solutions.

Service-Oriented Mindset: As a customer-centric professional, you'll excel in communicating with users, providing timely assistance, and maintaining a calm and focused approach even in high-pressure situations.

What you will be rewarded with:


Collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diversity and innovation
Continuous learning and development opportunities to improve your skills and advance your career.
Competitive compensation and pension scheme
Global network of professionals providing opportunities for growth and mobility


We will rely on you to:


On-site support to our local colleagues in Denmark, primarily in Nordhavn but also our Aarhus office
On- and off boarding of colleagues
Prepare / maintain PC workstations.
Administer and prepare mobile devices.
Maintenance and operation of copy/print, local backup, and other operating systems
Participate in technical operational tasks, including troubleshooting.
Work with our Service Desk and asset management systems.
Carry out any other ad-hoc tasks as and when required.


What you need to have:


Speaks and understands English at a high level and can communicate in the Nordic languages
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role in an international organisation
Solid knowledge of software and hardware
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Microsoft environment in general
Knowledge of standard operating systems such as Windows 10
Knowledge of ITIL processes
Knowledge of Copiers, printers, and AV equipment
Knowledge of ServiceNow is a plus.
Solid interpersonal skills and service mindset
Pragmatic, robust and solution orientated personality


What makes you stand out:


Experience with Support/Ticket systems and asset management.


Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk advisor. With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marsh.com, and follow us on LinkedIn and X.

R_253489
Show more

Service-Oriented Mindset: As a customer-centric professional, you'll excel in communicating with users, providing timely assistance, and maintaining a calm and focused approach even in high-pressure situations.

What you will be rewarded with:

  • Collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diversity and innovation
  • Continuous learning and development opportunities to improve your skills and advance your career.
  • Competitive compensation and pension scheme
  • Global network of professionals providing opportunities for growth and mobility

We will rely on you to:

  • On-site support to our local colleagues in Denmark, primarily in Nordhavn but also our Aarhus office
  • On- and off boarding of colleagues
  • Prepare / maintain PC workstations.
  • Administer and prepare mobile devices.
  • Maintenance and operation of copy/print, local backup, and other operating systems
  • Participate in technical operational tasks, including troubleshooting.
  • Work with our Service Desk and asset management systems.
  • Carry out any other ad-hoc tasks as and when required.

What you need to have:

  • Speaks and understands English at a high level and can communicate in the Nordic languages
  • A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role in an international organisation
  • Solid knowledge of software and hardware
  • Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Microsoft environment in general
  • Knowledge of standard operating systems such as Windows 10
  • Knowledge of ITIL processes
  • Knowledge of Copiers, printers, and AV equipment
  • Knowledge of ServiceNow is a plus.
  • Solid interpersonal skills and service mindset
  • Pragmatic, robust and solution orientated personality

What makes you stand out:

  • Experience with Support/Ticket systems and asset management.

Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk advisor. With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marsh.com, and follow us on LinkedIn and X.

R_253489

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Dreamdata is the industry leader in B2B marketing attribution, optimization and automation. Founded by ex-Trustpilot product and engineering leaders starting in 2019 after building the platform internally, Dreamdata is on a mission to empower marketing professionals by democratizing access and usability of data.

Taking on the complex world of B2B marketing data Dreamdata helps marketing leaders to connect their efforts across all marketing channels to real revenue - something that wasn't fully possible until now.

We are expanding our team to further empower our customers and ensure their success. This is where you come in. We are scaling our product team in our Copenhagen office.

As an Analytics Engineer at Dreamdata you will be part of a cross-functional product team consisting of Software Engineering, Design and Product Manager.

At Dreamdata data is not just a support function - it is our product and what we do !

You will be responsible for the data function part of the team to build and iterate on our main product, ensuring that data pipelines and transformations are built using best practices and are transparent and easy-to-use for our customers.

You will also be part of the broader data group consisting of the analytics engineers and data scientists from other teams. Together we maintain the fundamental data models that power the entire Dreamdata product.

Requirements


You have 2-4 years of experience in a data related role such as analytics engineer, data engineer, data analyst, data scientist or a similar role
You most likely have real-world experience in working with data from multiple sources, extracting, visualizing, and explaining insights to stakeholders. Previous experience working with marketing and sales data is considered a plus
You are fluent in SQL. We use Google BigQuery, but experience with other cloud data warehouses like Snowflake, AWS Redshift, Azure SQL etc. is equally relevant
We use GCP Dataform for the majority of data transformations but experience with dbt or transformation libraries like Pandas, Polar, tidyr, dplyr etc. is also relevant
You have some exposure to other coding languages like Python, golang, Typescript etc
We use Github, but other version control systems are equally relevant
You have played with visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx etc. Experience using open source Python/R-based visualization libraries is equally relevant
We are heavy users of Google Cloud Platform, but exposure to the other public clouds are also considered a plus


If you think the role sounds exciting, but you don't match all points, don't hesitate to reach out as we are continuously hiring also with opportunities for less senior profiles.

Benefits


Flexibility - we are sharing our time between the office and remote work
Equity - be part of the growth journey ahead
Lunch at the office
Office next to the waterfront, in the heart of Copenhagen
A company where you will get the chance to grow with the company



Who is Dreamdata?

We are a young company with big ambitions, but also a company that emphasizes that it should be fun going to work. We are currently 18 nationalities from all over the world. You will also have opportunities to participate in activities outside of work.

We get together for various non-workrelated events to get to know our colleagues across the company and simply to have a good time together.

https://dreamdata.io/blog/summer-fun-at-dreamdata

https://dreamdata.io/blog/building-the-dream-team-at-dreamdata
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to be part of an international team that drives technological innovation that saves lives and enhances patient care?

Do you want to gain the experience of being at the forefront of a digitalization tranformation journey?

Do you have a deepfounded passion in data engineering, cloud platforms and data management systems?

This could be your moment to shine. Apply today and embark on a career that keeps moving forward!

Local Role with Global Impact

In this role, you will be part of the Data and Analytics department at Ambu’s headquarters. Our team is uniquely international, with members from around the world, and engages with business stakeholders globally. We are on a transformative journey, establishing a new foundation of processes, ownership, and technology, with a major focus on developing a cutting-edge Data Platform in the Microsoft Azure cloud.

As a Data Engineer, you will be at the forefront of automating business processes through digitalization and playing a pivotal role in our strategic initiative to enhance data-driven decision-making across the company.

In a collaborative and agile environment, we value open communication and a team-oriented approach to solving complex challenges. For new team members, we look for the eagerness to learn and adapt, rather than having detailed knowledge of or experience with every technology.

Your Day-to-day Work Will Involve


Designing, developing, and managing scalable data pipelines and architectures.
Ensuring data integrity and security, complying with the latest standards in data governance.
Collaborating with various business stakeholders globally to support data-driven decisions and innovations.
Leveraging new technologies to enhance the efficiency and capabilities of our data systems.


Suggested Candidate Profile

Setting you up for success is one of our cornerstones. We imagine you have a robust educational background in computer science, data science, or a related field, coupled with substantial experience in data engineering. As a person, you should be proactive, keen to learn new skills, and enthusiastic about sharing your expertise.

Experience Or Knowledge In The Following Is Highly Relevant


Microsoft Azure and other cloud services
ETL tools and processes
Data modeling and warehousing
Python, SQL, and other relevant data management technologies
Strong command of English, both written and spoken, is crucial for this role.


Apply for a career #ForeverForward

The Talent Attraction team will engage with candidates on an ongoing basis, hence we encourage you to not hesitate, and rather apply!

Questions? Reach out to Aike Baars, Head of Strategic Data Systems at aaba@ambu.com.
Show more
