Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Tester
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are You Ready to Work With the Latest Technologies?

We are looking to grow our IT team with a skilled and experienced Business Intelligence (BI) Tester. If you appreciate working with the latest technologies, wish to improve your career, and participate in continuous learning and training initiatives, it could be you who we are looking for.

Who Are We?

The RiskPoint Group is a global Managing General Underwriter (MGU) providing best-in-class insurance solutions backed by the insurance companies we act on behalf of.

You will become part of our new, small team of highly skilled BI professionals, who together holds many years of experience in insurance data. Our BI team is part of our growing IT team, which is part of our Finance & Operations department. In this role, you will be working with other IT colleagues in both Denmark and the UK as well as colleagues from other departments.

We operate in an agile organization with close cross-border cooperation across all business lines. And our organizational structure is flat, leaving many opportunities for all employees to make a difference, take responsibility, excel, and grow.

About The Position

As our new BI Tester, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of our data pipelines, reports, and dashboards.

This is an onsite role based either in our Copenhagen office or in our London office, with the option to work remotely if approved by your manager. Occasional domestic and international travel may be required.

You will report to our CTO, who is located in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Your key responsibilities will include but not be limited to:


Design, develop, and maintain comprehensive test plans and test cases for BI solutions
Perform regression testing to ensure existing functionalities are not affected by new developments
Conduct behavioral testing to validate the system’s behavior against expected outcomes
Write and execute tests in dbt (data build tool) to ensure data transformations are accurate and reliable
Collaborate with BI developers, data engineers, and analysts to understand requirements and validate solutions
Identify, document, and track defects and issues through to resolution
Ensure data quality and integrity across all data platforms
Participate in continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies to continuously improve our BI testing capabilities


Please note that current residency in either Denmark or the UK with work and residency permit needs to be in place before applying.

A Great Match for Us

The ideal candidate will have completed a degree that provides a solid foundation in computer science principles, programming, data structures, and database management. That could be, for example, a bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.

You must have worked professionally for 2-5 years in roles involving BI testing, demonstrating the ability to handle job-specific challenges and deliver results in a business environment.

Moreover you need to have:


Extensive experience conducting regression tests to ensure new code changes do not adversely affect existing functionalities.
Conducted behavioral tests to validate that the system behaves as expected under various conditions.
Hands-on experience in designing and executing test plans for ETL pipelines, ensuring data is accurately extracted from various sources, correctly transformed into the required format, and reliably loaded into data warehouses or other destinations.
Hands-on experience using dbt (data build tool) to write and execute tests for data transformations, proving your ability to ensure data quality and accuracy.
High proficiency level in SQL and the capability of writing complex queries to validate data integrity and accuracy.
Practical experience in validating data models and ensuring data consistency across the data warehouse.
Experience validating data visualizations and dashboards to ensure you provide accurate and actionable insights.
Demonstrated the ability to identify and solve complex data-related problems, ensuring high data quality and reliability.


It is furthermore a requirement that you have a proven track record of working effectively in team settings, communicating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver data solutions.

To be successful in this role, we expect you to have excellent problem solving skills, strong communication skills, and always pay attention to the details.

Although not required, we prefer you are:


Experienced in validating and testing big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Iceberg), ensuring data processing and transformations are performed correctly and efficiently across large-scale datasets.
Familiar with DevOps methodologies and tools, such as CI/CD pipelines, version control systems, and infrastructure automation, indicating your ability to contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.


Interested in the Position?

We are looking forward to receiving your resume and a motivational letter of application for this position. Please use the form below.

We hope to see your application before August 31, 2024, but have patience and can wait for the perfect match. Interviews will be held successively.

For more information about the position, contact CTO, Zubair Sabir, at *protected email*. Note that we do not accept applications via e-mail, please use the form below.

About The RiskPoint Group

The RiskPoint Group is one of Europe’s largest Managing General Underwriters (MGUs), providing best in class insurance solutions to businesses and their advisors globally. The RiskPoint Group operates as RiskPoint in Europe and Asia and RP Underwriting in the rest of the world.

With 250+ employees and 15 locations in Europe, North America, and Asia Pacific, the RiskPoint Group employs expert underwriting and specialized, in-house claims teams within Accident & Health, Transactional Risk, Property & Construction, Renewable Energy, Offshore Upstream, and Liabilities, including Financial Lines, Cyber, and Casualty.

The RiskPoint Group is a Coverholder with Lloyd’s of London and is backed by a strong panel of well-reputed insurance companies. The RiskPoint Group core values are: trust, openness & honesty, respect & tolerance, drive & dedication as well as being part of a winning team in a competitive environment.
Show more

For more information about the position, contact CTO, Zubair Sabir, at *protected email*. Note that we do not accept applications via e-mail, please use the form below.

About The RiskPoint Group

The RiskPoint Group is one of Europe’s largest Managing General Underwriters (MGUs), providing best in class insurance solutions to businesses and their advisors globally. The RiskPoint Group operates as RiskPoint in Europe and Asia and RP Underwriting in the rest of the world.

With 250+ employees and 15 locations in Europe, North America, and Asia Pacific, the RiskPoint Group employs expert underwriting and specialized, in-house claims teams within Accident & Health, Transactional Risk, Property & Construction, Renewable Energy, Offshore Upstream, and Liabilities, including Financial Lines, Cyber, and Casualty.

The RiskPoint Group is a Coverholder with Lloyd’s of London and is backed by a strong panel of well-reputed insurance companies. The RiskPoint Group core values are: trust, openness & honesty, respect & tolerance, drive & dedication as well as being part of a winning team in a competitive environment.

Title: IT systems engineer
Description:
Are you curious about the different fields within IT infrastructure and enjoy exploring unknown territories? Do you thrive in an energetic environment with many different tasks while keeping a high service level to all your users on a daily basis? Then you should grab this opportunity to join our IT Endpoint & Client Services team.

Here’s what the job entails
In the role, your primary function will be to prioritise and solve IT infrastructure tasks as well as escalate relevant tasks to the correct owners. You will be part of an operational team handling tasks all the way from 1st to 3rd level support.

Your areas of responsibility will include the following:

assist with handling various IT projects and tasks
support IT infrastructure and end-users, including participating in our call queue
handle surveillance of our systems and services
install, test and maintain systems and software
participate in 24/7 on-call duty (approximately every two months)



Meet the team
You will join our IT Endpoint & Client Services team, which delivers high-quality support and services to the entire organisation and continuously ensures that all systems are up and running. Our responsibility spans widely from providing daily IT support to assisting with developing our core IT infrastructure, which creates value for the business.

We are a team of 11 solution-oriented, collaborative and creative IT professionals in almost every corner of IT infrastructure. Even though we have different specialist areas, we honour knowledge sharing and like to utilise our different competencies to find the best solutions - together. We primarily manage operations internally, which gives everyone in the team great know-how of our setup.

But enough about us… over to you!
As there is a lot to learn in the field we work in, we are looking for a curious colleague, who is eager to learn new stuff within IT infrastructure and cloud technologies. We also picture you as an analytical person who thrives in troubleshooting software as well as hardware. As the team covers a wide range of tasks, we are looking for a team-player who is always ready to support colleagues in getting the job done.

We also imagine that you:

have a relevant educational background within IT, for example, as a data technician
are a skilled user of Microsoft Administration Tool, including Windows server, virtualisation, Active Directory and SCOM
have experience with Exchange and Teams administration
are familiar with FTP, ITSM Tools, and ITIL and its terms – or are keen to learn them
are proficient in English – both written and verbal



Please note that it is not a requirement to have prior knowledge of the energy industry to enter this role.

We’ll take good care of you
At Danske Commodities, we take great care of our people. Joining us means you’ll get a lot of great perks – including social events, cultural experiences, tasty food and benefits to better your health, your life and your future.

Here are some of the benefits we offer our employees:

Flexible working hours including the opportunity to work part-time as well as the option to work from home up to two days per week
Vast development opportunities with the help of your own individual development plan, access to our DC University with 50+ courses as well as remote courses through Harvard Learning
Global career prospects as part of the Equinor group with +20,000 colleagues across the world
10% paid pension as well as a beneficial health care and insurance package
Great parental leave conditions from day one including 26 weeks of paid maternity leave and 16 weeks of paid paternity/co-parent leave as well as the opportunity to join the network Inspired Beyond Babies
Unlimited paid children’s sick days no limit on paid absence days in relation to child sickness
Extra days off five, to be exact, as well as a Yay Day (an additional day off dedicated to ‘me time’) every year – adding to the standard five weeks off each year
Senior days if you’re over 55 years old
Bonus scheme
Share savings meaning you have the opportunity to participate in our parent company Equinor’s attractive share savings programme
Paid at home internet and equipment including a mobile phone with paid subscription and IT equipment for when working from home
100+ yearly social and professional events including DC Sports and DC Talks events, gatherings in our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, CS:GO team and more
Various free tickets to family-friendly and cultural attractions
Discounts at hotels, restaurants, sports clubs and more
Organic food including a light breakfast, lunch buffet and snacks throughout the day
An office in the heart of Aarhus right next to the central train station



Recruitment process and relocation
You can read more about our recruitment process here. Please note that if you are an international candidate, we will reimburse travel expenses in connection with potential interviews and support you with the relocation process.

What we’re about
We're a tech-driven energy trading company present in 42 markets across five continents. Our +600 people are driven by a need to constantly better things. If you are too, we could very well be the right place for you. You'll join a collective of thinkers and doers. Aspiring chefs, runners, parents, beekeepers, gamers – the list goes on. We're highly specialised experts within our fields. But it’s actually our diversity of ideas we’re most proud of, which is why we continuously work on strengthening an inclusive culture where diverse teams thrive.

Our organisation is flat with an open-door policy. We expect you to care. About your work. About your own and your colleagues’ collective successes. And about the difference we make at Danske Commodities. Together with our parent company Equinor, we have the vision and strength to accelerate the energy transition and make an impact. Like no other.
Show more

  • 10% paid pension as well as a beneficial health care and insurance package
  • Great parental leave conditions from day one including 26 weeks of paid maternity leave and 16 weeks of paid paternity/co-parent leave as well as the opportunity to join the network Inspired Beyond Babies
  • Unlimited paid children’s sick days no limit on paid absence days in relation to child sickness
  • Extra days off five, to be exact, as well as a Yay Day (an additional day off dedicated to ‘me time’) every year – adding to the standard five weeks off each year
  • Senior days if you’re over 55 years old
  • Bonus scheme
  • Share savings meaning you have the opportunity to participate in our parent company Equinor’s attractive share savings programme
  • Paid at home internet and equipment including a mobile phone with paid subscription and IT equipment for when working from home
  • 100+ yearly social and professional events including DC Sports and DC Talks events, gatherings in our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, CS:GO team and more
  • Various free tickets to family-friendly and cultural attractions
  • Discounts at hotels, restaurants, sports clubs and more
  • Organic food including a light breakfast, lunch buffet and snacks throughout the day
  • An office in the heart of Aarhus right next to the central train station


Recruitment process and relocation
You can read more about our recruitment process here. Please note that if you are an international candidate, we will reimburse travel expenses in connection with potential interviews and support you with the relocation process.

What we’re about
We're a tech-driven energy trading company present in 42 markets across five continents. Our +600 people are driven by a need to constantly better things. If you are too, we could very well be the right place for you. You'll join a collective of thinkers and doers. Aspiring chefs, runners, parents, beekeepers, gamers – the list goes on. We're highly specialised experts within our fields. But it’s actually our diversity of ideas we’re most proud of, which is why we continuously work on strengthening an inclusive culture where diverse teams thrive.

Our organisation is flat with an open-door policy. We expect you to care. About your work. About your own and your colleagues’ collective successes. And about the difference we make at Danske Commodities. Together with our parent company Equinor, we have the vision and strength to accelerate the energy transition and make an impact. Like no other.

Title: Data Architect/Analyst (f/m/d)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Rethinking IT.

We have lots of ideas about how to successfully drive digitalization in companies. For example, with open cloud platforms, highly developed security systems, and clever tools for developers. What is your role in this? Move the world from behind the scenes with your IT expertise and passion for game-changing information technology. Rethink IT and steer projects in completely new directions. Be bold when others would have given up. In short, play a key role in driving digitalization forward! We’ll provide the resources you need to do this. We also offer a variety of opportunities to get involved and to be part of a global network of IT experts and professionals. Welcome to our world!

We Make Real What Matters. This Is Your Role.

Vision:

As data is supposed to be the new oil, making tangible value out of data will make the difference and is what we are striving for.

Supporting the business in decision making and answering increasingly complex questions in ever shorter time or even real time is our aspiration.

Mission:

By combining a profound knowledge of finance and related end-2-end processes with deep technical know-how and a fresh thinking with respect to problem solving, we provide state of the art IT solutions, services and platforms for finance departments with a focus on reporting, analytics and planning.

Key Areas of Responsibility:


Support in the relaunch of a solution for group consolidation with a focus on the provision of an integrated data layer that enables a pass-through from consolidated data to unconsolidated ERP data
Permanent self-reliant optimization of data models (in the context of S/4 Group Reporting, SAP BW/4, S/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud, Snowflake)
You envision, design and implement architectures and data models optimized for the integration of various, heterogenous data sources. You extend our service offering by business intelligence and reporting solutions to effectively deal with the new non-financial reporting requirements like the EU Taxonomy
Autonomously deliver/lead projects mainly in the context of an SAP BW/4 environment
Perform changes in alignment with BI colleagues and business stakeholders
Constantly provide innovations to improve or enhance analytics related solutions and service offering
Provide added value to data analytics initiatives / projects (migrations, predictive analytics, SAC, new projects)
Manage and coordinate external partners and communicate with various business stakeholders for the successful completion of projects and changes in existing solutions


Use Your Skills To Move The World Forward.


University degree in IT or Business Insights related field
Some years of experience in analytics and reporting (SAP BW, SAP BW/4, SAC, SAP ABAP, Snowflake, PowerBI)
Experience in an international group company and experience in SAP Group reporting are valued
Extensive experience in data warehousing, ETL processes and reporting (SAP AO, SAC)
Knowledge on HANA Studio (SQL/Java Script/CDS views), experience in cloud platforms, as well as any other BI tool are valued
Practical experience in collaborating with business stakeholders, experience within the area of Accounting / Controlling / Closing process is valued
Ability to learn and adapt to new environments / contexts / applications
Business Value and Customer focused, as well as goal-oriented professional with innovative thinking and attention to detail and a team player
Project Management experience in agile methodology
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and willingness to work in a multicultural team
Strong engineering/analytic skills and in leading BI projects and data expertise (modelling, analytics, prediction, simulation, AI/ML) and profound background in digitalization technologies is highly valued
Business fluent English


What we offer.


2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
Attractive remuneration package
Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth
30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family
Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG
Find more benefits here


Individual benefits are adapted to meet local legal regulations, the requirements of different job profiles, locations, and individual preferences.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.

As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

www.siemens.com/careers - if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ - if you need further information on the application process.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Quantitative Analyst

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.




The job as Quantitative Analyst

As our new Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading and a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.




Your key responsibilities

Research new market opportunities
Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
Acquire and maintain data from external sources




Your qualifications and personal skills

Minimum 2 years of experience from a similar role or top of your university class
Quantitative background in Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar
Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, Numpy, etc.
Master machine learning and data-science fundamentals
Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
Strong analytic skills and an eye for detail
The ability to work independently and structure your workload
A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 163 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best – we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
The chance to one day become partner
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.




We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Senior Information Technology Support Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
IT Technical Support – Join Marsh - the world's leading risk advisory and insurance brokerage firm




With over 45,000 employees across 130 countries, we empower Denmark's largest companies to navigate risks and seize business opportunities through our unrivaled expertise in risk management and insurance consulting. We are app. 150 colleagues in Denmark, eager to welcome you to our great organization.




As Senior IT Support Analyst you are on-site support to all our great colleagues and based in our modern facilities in Nordhavn. You will report to the Manager of the IT Support Team located in Sweden.




Please ensure that when applying, your CV & application is in English.




What you can expect:




Cutting-edge Technology: Work with a wide range of systems and applications, including Microsoft 365, ServiceNow, MoveWorks, Nexthink, Zoom and other Cloud based Technologies to support our local, Nordic, and global operations.




Collaborative Environment: Join forces with our Nordic teams to provide exceptional IT support to our local users in Denmark, ensuring smooth operations and seamless user experiences.




Diverse Responsibilities: From provisioning and maintaining workstations to managing mobile phones, you'll have a diverse range of tasks that keep you engaged and challenged.




Technical Excellence: Participate in technical operations and troubleshooting, leveraging your broad IT knowledge and familiarity with ITIL processes to deliver top-notch solutions.




Service-Oriented Mindset: As a customer-centric professional, you'll excel in communicating with users, providing timely assistance, and maintaining a calm and focused approach even in high-pressure situations.




What you will be rewarded with:

Collaborative and inclusive work environment that values ​​diversity and innovation
Continuous learning and development opportunities to improve your skills and advance your career.
Competitive compensation and pension scheme
Global network of professionals providing opportunities for growth and mobility

We will rely on you to:

On-site support to our local colleagues in Denmark, primarily in Nordhavn but also our Aarhus office
On- and off boarding of colleagues
Prepare / maintain PC workstations.
Administer and prepare mobile devices.
Maintenance and operation of copy/print, local backup, and other operating systems
Participate in technical operational tasks, including troubleshooting.
Work with our Service Desk and asset management systems.
Carry out any other ad-hoc tasks as and when required.




What you need to have:

Speaks and understands English at a high level and can communicate in the Nordic languages
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role in an international organisation
Solid knowledge of software and hardware
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Microsoft environment in general
Knowledge of standard operating systems such as Windows 10
Knowledge of ITIL processes
Knowledge of Copiers, printers, and AV equipment
Knowledge of ServiceNow is a plus.
Solid interpersonal skills and service mindset
Pragmatic, robust and solution orientated personality

What makes you stand out:

Experience with Support/Ticket systems and asset management.




Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk advisor. With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marsh.com, and follow us on LinkedIn and X.

At Marsh McLennan, we understand the complexity, and the reality, of the modern career path. If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified and you think you would be a great fit for the role, we would love to hear from you.

Title: EDC/Clinical Programmer
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about Clinical Data? Do you have solid experience building an eCRF in an EDC CDMS and/or clinical programing for complex studies? Are you familiar with clinical data management activities from start-up, conduct to closure?

If so, now is your chance to join Ascendis Pharma as our new EDC Clinical Programmer.

Ascendis Pharma is a fast-growing biopharmaceutical company with locations in Denmark, Germany, and the United States. We are applying our TransCon technology to build a leading, fully integrated biopharmaceutical company with an independent pipeline of long-acting prodrug therapies that address unmet patient needs.

As our new EDC/Clinical Programmer, you have a deep understanding of clinical data, and through your work you will be recognized as an expert. Your way of collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, will help the data management study team to succeed.

In this position you will be given broad responsibility tailored to our studies. You will be involved in data management activities associated with the development, conduct, and management of assigned studies in endocrinology, and future therapeutic areas. You will provide expert knowledge and support across phase 1 to 4 trials serving as the EDC & Clinical Programmer to ensure the success of the trial. You will work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic team environment.

You will work closely with our Data Management team, to ensuring quality study deliverables are met. As a key point of contact for internal stakeholders and Vendors, your will be actively involved together with the Clinical Data Manager on how best data can be captured as well ensuring with oversight of the clinical data both within DM and our stakeholders.

You will be joining the newly established Clinical Data Management team in the Copenhagen office. In this role you have a unique opportunity to be part of shaping the way we work within the Global Clinical Data Management organization. You bring with you a wealth of professional experience, you are passionate and have an eye for frameworks, processes, and best practices. We encourage you to think out of the box supporting the organization in doing an even better job, when preparing for future requirements. For the right candidate you will be given the mandate to participate or manage non-study initiatives and / or projects.

You will be supported by line management, who has in depth clinical data management experience, who can challenge, and spar as needed, and who will pave the way for you to succeed. Throughout the year you and your manager will meet to perform deep dive communication, where well-being, growth and collaboration are on the agenda.

Main areas of responsibility:

Develop and Update Clinical Databases (EDC).
Ensures adherence to clinical database standards, SOPs and Process Guidelines.
Leads and/or participates in the review of eCRFs and validation checks, database development, programming of validation checks in Clinical Data Management System (CDMS).
Interface with members of study teams, including external CROs/Vendors where applicable, to integrate study team requirements into all deliverables.
Participates in extra activities including, but not limited to, evaluation and testing of new systems and helps coordinate CDM Systems technical initiatives. Contributes strategies, innovative and creative solutions to enhance processes and increase productivity of the group.
Contribute to the ongoing development, review, and revisions of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), Work Instructions, Training and standard DM templates.  
Contribute to the development of CDM and EDC standards.
Generate metric reports and listings to facilitate the management and review of external data, as required. 

 Your Profile

A minimum of 6 years of clinical programming and/or EDC database development and experience from pharma, biotech or CRO and a relevant academic degree in life sciences (e.g. data science, computer science, pharmacy, biology, statistics).

Furthermore, you have:

Demonstrated technical proficiency in a Clinical Data Management Systems (i.e. Veeva CDMS, Medidata Rave, Oracle Inform etc.).
At least 4 years of EDC database development experience.
At least 2 years of Programming experience preferably in SAS and SQL.
Proficiency in cultivating and sustaining positive collaborative relationships across diverse functional areas.
Keen emphasis on prompt action and prioritizing stakeholder needs.
Project management capabilities encompassing effective group presentation, leadership, verbal and written communication, interpersonal adeptness, and organizational proficiency.
Desire to learn new processes and technologies.
Proficiency in multitasking, independent work, and effective communication.
Well-versed in the drug discovery process, FDA regulations, GxP guidelines, ICH guidelines, clinical database cleaning procedures, and 21 CFR Part 11.

Also, you are proficient in English at a professional level, both written and spoken.

As a person, you are a strong team player, proactive in nature and have a can-do attitude. As we are taking new steps towards developing best-in-class therapeutics for patients with rare diseases we are looking for people who possess an entrepreneurial mindset who can handle ambiguity, analyze, and create clarity and desires to be part of an organization where everything isn't set in stone. We rely on you to help us shape the cement and be part of building the Clinical Data Management team in the Copenhagen office. The person we are looking for thrives in a dynamic environment, short lines of communication and an open and informal working atmosphere.

Travel: Up to 5 - 15 days per year.

Place of work: Ascendis Pharma headquarter resides in a modern and wonderful office facility in Tuborg Havn in Hellerup with a view of the harbor, the canals, and the sea.

For more details about the position or the company, please contact Peter Bayer, Senior Director of Clinical Data Management, Endocrinology, via pbr@ascendispharma.com/ +45 30191920 or visit out website

All applications must be submitted in English and are treated confidentially.

Applications will be evaluated when received, so please apply as soon as possible.

Show more

Furthermore, you have:

  • Demonstrated technical proficiency in a Clinical Data Management Systems (i.e. Veeva CDMS, Medidata Rave, Oracle Inform etc.).
  • At least 4 years of EDC database development experience.
  • At least 2 years of Programming experience preferably in SAS and SQL.
  • Proficiency in cultivating and sustaining positive collaborative relationships across diverse functional areas.
  • Keen emphasis on prompt action and prioritizing stakeholder needs.
  • Project management capabilities encompassing effective group presentation, leadership, verbal and written communication, interpersonal adeptness, and organizational proficiency.
  • Desire to learn new processes and technologies.
  • Proficiency in multitasking, independent work, and effective communication.
  • Well-versed in the drug discovery process, FDA regulations, GxP guidelines, ICH guidelines, clinical database cleaning procedures, and 21 CFR Part 11.

Also, you are proficient in English at a professional level, both written and spoken.

As a person, you are a strong team player, proactive in nature and have a can-do attitude. As we are taking new steps towards developing best-in-class therapeutics for patients with rare diseases we are looking for people who possess an entrepreneurial mindset who can handle ambiguity, analyze, and create clarity and desires to be part of an organization where everything isn't set in stone. We rely on you to help us shape the cement and be part of building the Clinical Data Management team in the Copenhagen office. The person we are looking for thrives in a dynamic environment, short lines of communication and an open and informal working atmosphere.

Travel: Up to 5 - 15 days per year.

Place of work: Ascendis Pharma headquarter resides in a modern and wonderful office facility in Tuborg Havn in Hellerup with a view of the harbor, the canals, and the sea.

For more details about the position or the company, please contact Peter Bayer, Senior Director of Clinical Data Management, Endocrinology, via pbr@ascendispharma.com/ +45 30191920 or visit out website

All applications must be submitted in English and are treated confidentially.

Applications will be evaluated when received, so please apply as soon as possible.

Title: PowerBI Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du passioneret for dataanalyse og ønsker du at bidrage til en datadrevet beslutningsramme i Verisure? Vi søger en erfaren PowerBI Analyst med 2-3 års erfaring, der kan skabe værdi gennem indsigtsfulde analyser og rapporter. I denne rolle vil du få bred interaktion med organisationen og betydelig indflydelse på vores daglige resultater.



Om stillingen


Udvikle og vedligeholde Power BI-rapporter og dashboards for at understøtte forretningsbeslutninger.
Indsamle, analysere og fortolke data fra forskellige kilder for at identificere tendenser og mønstre.
Samarbejde med forretningsenheder for at forstå deres behov og levere skræddersyede rapporteringsløsninger.
Sikre datakvalitet og integritet gennem hele rapporteringsprocessen.
Træne og støtte brugere i forståelse og anvendelse af Power BI-løsninger.


Din profil



Vi søger en analytiker med stærk forretningsforståelse og erfaring inden for Power BI. Du skal have:


2-3 års erfaring med udvikling af Power BI-rapporter og dashboards.
Erfaring med DAX, SQL og datamodellering.
Stærke analytiske færdigheder og evne til at præsentere komplekse data på en letforståelig måde.
Evne til at arbejde selvstændigt og håndtere "end-to-end" processer.
Gode kommunikative færdigheder og evne til at formidle tekniske problemstillinger klart på både dansk og engelsk.
Dokumenterbar erfaring fra job, studiejob eller projekter.


Fordele (men ikke krav)


Kendskab til Power Automate og Power Apps.
Erfaring med Microsoft 365 Power Platform og SharePoint.
Erfaring med forretningsprocesoptimering og automatisering.


Personlige kompetencer


Proaktiv og løsningsorienteret tilgang til arbejdsopgaver.
Evnen til at samarbejde med både tekniske og ikke-tekniske interessenter.
Ambition og motivation for at skabe værdi gennem datadrevet indsigt.


Om Verisure



Hos Verisure udfører vores medarbejdere noget fantastisk hver eneste dag. Ved at beskytte det, der betyder mest, ændrer vi livet til det bedre for vores kunder. Vi er den førende europæiske udbyder af professionelt overvågede sikkerhedsløsninger med 24/7 respons og service, og vi er til stede i 17 lande i Europa og Latinamerika. Vi integrerer produktudvikling, design, salg, installation og en 24/7 professionel overvågningsløsning. Vi har en dokumenteret historie, som går 35 år tilbage, og vi har gennem årene vist kontinuerlig vækst - også i Danmark. Siden 2017 har vi i Danmark vækstet eksplosivt, og vi har spændende planer om at fortsætte med at udvide, transformere og føre markedet ind i fremtiden. 

Vores succes afhænger af vores medarbejdere, og vi investerer i dem hver eneste dag. Hos Verisure bliver du en del af en førende virksomhed inden for branchen.



Vil du være en del af Verisure og være med til at gøre en forskel?



Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, kan du kontakte Leadgen og MCC manager Simon From på e-mail Simon.From@verisure.com eller HR Partner Marcel Worm-Marquardtsen marcel.worm-marquardtsen@verisure.com.

Vi vil løbende gennemgå ansøgninger og afholde interviews, så vi opfordrer dig til at søge stillingen i dag.

I Verisure er vores mission at tage ansvar for at beskytte det, der betyder mest, og tilbyde sikkerhed og tryghed for alle. Det tror vi på, at vi bedst gør, når vi har talentfulde medarbejdere der bidrager med forskellige baggrunde, kulturer og perspektiver. Vi forpligter os derfor til en kultur præget af diversitet og inklusion og opfordrer alle uanset baggrund, kultur, køn, alder og erfaring, til at ansøge om at blive en del af vores team. Vi er alle mennesker, som beskytter mennesker, og sammen står vi endnu stærkere om at tilbyde sikkerhed og tryghed til vores kunder.  

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Title: Business Intelligence Konsulent
Description:
Business Intelligence Konsulent med Fokus på Dataanalyse og Teknologi Søges til itm8 i Aarhus, København, Skovlunde & Odense

Er du passioneret omkring dataanalyse og business intelligence? Har du en solid teknisk baggrund og erfaring med at omdanne data til indsigt, der driver forretningsbeslutninger? Vi er på udkig efter en dygtig Business Intelligence Konsulent, der kan bringe avancerede dataanalysefærdigheder til vores team og hjælpe vores kunder med at navigere i datadrevne beslutningsprocesser.

Hvad tilbyder vi?


En nøglerolle i en organisation, hvor data og indsigt er i centrum for vores forretningsstrategi.
Muligheden for at arbejde med state-of-the-art teknologier inden for dataanalyse og business intelligence.
Et dynamisk arbejdsmiljø, hvor du kan påvirke og bidrage til virksomhedens vækst og succes.



Dine opgaver vil inkludere:


Udvikling og implementering af BI-løsninger, der understøtter kundens forretningsmål.
Arbejde med PowerBi, T-SQL, stored procedures og ETL-processer for at extracte, transformere og indlæse data.
Anvende Microsoft-teknologier som SQL Server, Data Factory, Azure SQL, Azure Data Lakes, Azure Synapse og udforske nye teknologier som Fabric.



Ideel kandidat:


Har en stærk baggrund som konsulent i dataanalyse og business intelligence med over 5 års erfaring.
Er teknisk dygtig med erfaring i PowerBi, SQL, Python, og Microsofts cloud-teknologier.
Er kundeminded, en god kollega, nysgerrig og altid på udkig efter at lære om nye teknologier, især inden for AI og data science.
Arbejdssted på Aarhus kontoret hvor resten af teamet sidder, men det er ikke et ultimativt krav. Det er også muligt at arbejde fra vores kontorer i København Ø, Skovlunde eller Odense.



Om itm8:

itm8 er en innovativ IT-partner, der specialiserer sig i at levere løsninger, der transformerer og optimerer vores kunders forretningsprocesser gennem intelligent brug af data. Vi værdsætter et miljø, hvor samarbejde, innovation og teknologisk ekspertise er nøglen til vores fælles succes.

Skal du med på holdet?

Er du klar til at tage skridtet og blive en del af vores team? Send dit CV og en kort motiverende ansøgning til os. Vi ser frem til at integrere dine færdigheder og passion i vores virksomhed!

Kontakt:

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, så kontakt Andreas Hvejsel Andersen på mail anhan@itm8.com. Vi afholder løbende samtaler og ansætter, når vi finder den rette kandidat. Vi indhenter straffeattest før ansættelse.

Title: Systems Engineer/Technical Lead, Engineering & Imaging
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hast du Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Medizinprodukten? Möchtest du innovative neue Produkte entwerfen, die das Leben der Patienten positiv beeinflussen, und deine Fähigkeiten in einem globalen MedTech-Unternehmen einbringen, das derzeit den Endoskopie Markt revolutioniert? Dann könnte dein nächster Karriereschritt als Systems Engineer/Technical Lead bei Ambu genau das Richtige für dich sein!

In dieser anspruchsvollen Position wirst du ein aktiver Beitragender innerhalb der F&E-Organisation und ein führendes Mitglied eines Produktentwicklungsprojekts sein. Du übernimmst eine Schlüsselrolle bei der Entwicklung unserer neuen, spannenden Endoskopie Produkte und trägst zum zukünftigen Erfolg von Ambu und zum Nutzen unserer Anwender bei.

Du wirst Teil eines dynamischen, professionellen und globalen Teams, das an Projekten sowohl in unserer Zentrale in Ballerup, Dänemark, als auch an unserem Entwicklungsstandort in Augsburg, Deutschland arbeitet. Unsere Innovationskultur ist hervorragend und wir legen großen Wert auf eine schnelle Markteinführung.

Wir sind bestrebt, das richtige Produkt zu entwickeln, um die Bedürfnisse der Kunden und Anwender zu erfüllen und das Leben der Patienten zu verbessern. Dies erfordert ein tiefes Verständnis für die Entwicklung von Medizinprodukten und deren Integration in komplexe Systeme.

Globale, nutzergetriebene Innovation – von der Idee bis zur Markteinführung

Als Systems Engineer wirst du die technische Gesamtübersicht behalten und den Fachexperten, Teammitgliedern und relevanten Stakeholdern helfen, sich gegenseitig zu verstehen und effektiv zusammenzuarbeiten. Du fungierst als technischer Leiter in unseren Endoskopieprojekten und triffst bei Bedarf Entscheidungen über notwendige Kompromisse. Darüber hinaus wirst du Produktdokumentationen wie Anforderungen, Designinputs, Designoutputs und technische Überprüfungen erstellen, erleichtern und überprüfen.

Du arbeitest gerne in Projektteams und findest pragmatische Lösungen für technische Probleme, während du die richtige Dokumentationsebene gegenüber Stakeholdern förderst. Du wirst in alle Phasen des Produktentwicklungsprozesses eingebunden sein – von der ersten Scope-Untersuchung über das Konzeptdesign bis hin zur Produktvalidierung und Markteinführung.

Du berichtest an den Leiter Systems Engineering, Engineering & Imaging. Diese Position kann entweder in Ballerup oder Augsburg angesiedelt sein.

Deine Aufgaben


Definition, Planung, Dokumentation und technische Leitung von Produktentwicklungsaktivitäten innerhalb eines Endoskopieentwicklungsprojekts, um sicherzustellen, dass das Produkt gemäß den definierten Projektzielen und dem Design- und Entwicklungsplan geliefert wird.
Analyse und Zerlegung der Benutzeranforderungen, Geschäftsanforderungen und Systemanforderungen in Produktanforderungen, einschließlich Designkontrolle und Entwicklungsanforderungen.
Aufbau und Leitung des technischen Teams in Abstimmung mit dem Projektleiter und den Linienmanagern.
Abstimmung der Produktarchitektur und Designlösungen innerhalb der F&E-Organisation.
Identifizierung und Verständnis der Benutzeranforderungen durch Engagement mit wichtigen Stakeholdern.
Untersuchung, Scope und Konzeptentwicklung neuer Produkte in bestehenden oder neuen klinischen Bereichen für Ambu basierend auf unserer Technologie und unseren Fähigkeiten.
Erstellung und Pflege der technischen Übersicht einschließlich Schnittstellen und Kompromisse zwischen Technologien.
Arbeit, Dokumentation und Tests gemäß den Anforderungen der FDA und ISO.


Dein Kontaktbereich ist breit gefächert, und du wirst mit Ambus globaler Organisation, allen Abteilungen, die an Produktentwicklungsprojekten beteiligt sind, sowie extern mit Nutzern, Wissenszentren, technischen Partnern und Lieferanten zusammenarbeiten. Unsere Produktionsstandorte befinden sich in Malaysia, China, USA und Mexiko, und wir arbeiten mit KOLs und Entwicklungszentren in ganz Europa und den USA zusammen, sodass einige Reisen in dieser Position zu erwarten sind.

Du bist ein erfahrener Medizingeräte-Ingenieur

Idealerweise hast du einen Bildungshintergrund im Bereich Maschinenbau oder ähnliches. Du hast Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Medizinprodukten und ein fundiertes Verständnis von Designkontrolle. Du hast eine starke System- und Systems-Engineering-Mentalität sowie eine mechanische Denkweise, bei der „Dinge gleich beim ersten Mal richtig machen“ und robuste Designs für dich wichtig sind. Du hast Erfahrung in der Produktentwicklung, insbesondere im Bereich Kunststoff- und mechanisches Design für Einwegprodukte. Höchstwahrscheinlich kommst du aus einer ähnlichen Position in der Medizingeräteindustrie oder einer Beratung im Bereich Medizingeräte.

Als Person bist du proaktiv, mit hohem Antrieb und Engagement, und hast ein starkes Verantwortungsbewusstsein für deine Aufgaben. Du bist gründlich und qualitätsbewusst; du hast ausgezeichnete zwischenmenschliche Fähigkeiten und ein gutes Situationsbewusstsein, was dich zu einem großartigen Teamplayer in globalen Teams macht. Du bist ein „Macher“ und bevorzugst es, Aufgaben und Herausforderungen direkt anzugehen, anstatt lange darüber zu theoretisieren. Du arbeitest eigenständig und übernimmst Verantwortung für deine Aufgaben und hast einen pragmatischen und praktischen Ansatz bei Aufgabenstellungen. Du unterstützt aktiv den Wissensaustausch und die Nutzung von Best Practices und genießt es, Teil eines globalen Teams zu sein.

Da Ambu ein globales Unternehmen ist, ist es wichtig, dass du fließend Englisch kommunizierst.

Wie du dich bewirbst

Wir werden Kandidaten kontinuierlich zu Vorstellungsgesprächen einladen, also zögere nicht, dich zu bewerben.

Deine Bewerbung wird vertraulich behandelt.

Idealerweise hast du einen Bildungshintergrund im Bereich Maschinenbau oder ähnliches. Du hast Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Medizinprodukten und ein fundiertes Verständnis von Designkontrolle. Du hast eine starke System- und Systems-Engineering-Mentalität sowie eine mechanische Denkweise, bei der „Dinge gleich beim ersten Mal richtig machen“ und robuste Designs für dich wichtig sind. Du hast Erfahrung in der Produktentwicklung, insbesondere im Bereich Kunststoff- und mechanisches Design für Einwegprodukte. Höchstwahrscheinlich kommst du aus einer ähnlichen Position in der Medizingeräteindustrie oder einer Beratung im Bereich Medizingeräte.

Als Person bist du proaktiv, mit hohem Antrieb und Engagement, und hast ein starkes Verantwortungsbewusstsein für deine Aufgaben. Du bist gründlich und qualitätsbewusst; du hast ausgezeichnete zwischenmenschliche Fähigkeiten und ein gutes Situationsbewusstsein, was dich zu einem großartigen Teamplayer in globalen Teams macht. Du bist ein „Macher“ und bevorzugst es, Aufgaben und Herausforderungen direkt anzugehen, anstatt lange darüber zu theoretisieren. Du arbeitest eigenständig und übernimmst Verantwortung für deine Aufgaben und hast einen pragmatischen und praktischen Ansatz bei Aufgabenstellungen. Du unterstützt aktiv den Wissensaustausch und die Nutzung von Best Practices und genießt es, Teil eines globalen Teams zu sein.

Da Ambu ein globales Unternehmen ist, ist es wichtig, dass du fließend Englisch kommunizierst.

Wie du dich bewirbst

Wir werden Kandidaten kontinuierlich zu Vorstellungsgesprächen einladen, also zögere nicht, dich zu bewerben.

Deine Bewerbung wird vertraulich behandelt.

Title: Data Engineer - One-Year contract
Description:
Do you want to play a key role in establishing and developing our data foundation and thereby make a difference for patients by transforming the approach of innovative research? Now is your opportunity to join a fun and diverse team working to bring our area vision of fast access to all CMC information through connected solutions and futureproof scalable & secure IT platforms come to life.

Apply now for a life changing career!

 

The position
You will be part of a digital team investigating, solving, and utilizing data potential and possibilities across the business, always in close collaboration with the scientists and other users. You will be responsible for streamlining data operations and creating a strong data backbone by developing and expanding our data infrastructure to enable our research departments to make data driven decisions.

 

Your main responsibilities will be:



Design and implement data processing pipelines, ensuring that data is collected, stored, and processed in a reliable, scalable, and efficient manner
Design data models & databases to support end-users in various use cases
Build full end-to-end digital solutions leveraging on cloud capabilities and automated CI/CD pipelines
Explore new technologies and tools to apply during the development of these solutions
Expose data to a broad range of different end users
Implementing effective monitoring processes and metrics
Collaborate cross-functionally with architects, security & quality teams, end users, and other stakeholders to ensure product suitability




 

Working as a Data Engineer in CMC Digitalisation comes with great flexibility for experimentation with new technology and you can look forward to playing a key role in shaping the future in close collaboration with other developers across the organisation. Please note that this position is a cover for one of our current Data Engineers who is on leave, so it's a one year fixed-term contract.

 

Qualifications

We imagine you have a background in Software Development or other relevant field, as this position requires great technical and developer skills, and you have +2 years of experience working with data engineering.

Likewise, we believe you can tick most of the following boxes:



Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, and computer science fundamentals
Solid understanding of software engineering principles: scalability, extensibility, readability, etc.
Experience working with SQL, Python, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), AWS and/or Azure Cloud, Data Warehouse, Big Data Analysis, building CI/CD pipelines, Azure DevOps, Agile Methodologies
Experience with building and deploying ETL pipelines
Experience with designing, developing, and appropriating data models for varying use cases
Strong mathematical, statistical, and problem-solving skills coupled with excellent communication skills and strong English fluency.




 

As a person, it comes naturally to you to test new techniques, software, and you have an eye for detail. You have a burning desire to learn new things and are curious about the processes and people you work with. You can work both independently and together with others. 

 

About The Department

You will be a part of CMC Development & Scaling (Chemistry, Manufacturing and Control) which is the organisation that ties research and manufacturing together. The scientist teams are vital in producing and delivering medicine to patients. We are advancing fundamental elements around data and information to meet future needs and using new technologies without compromising on the quality of our products. The position is anchored within CMC Digitalisation, working to bring our area vision of fast access to all CMC information through connected solutions and futureproof scalable & secure IT platforms come to life.

 

You will join a diverse and international team consisting of 30 colleagues with different backgrounds and expertise areas, but a shared passion for digital transformation. We are an ambitious and high-performing department that will support your personal and professional development. Our daily work language is English. Our frequent social gatherings contribute to a great and informal atmosphere.

 

Working at Novo Nordisk
At Novo Nordisk, we don’t wait for change. We drive it. We’re a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop; we seize them, from research and development through to manufacturing, marketing, and sales. 

Contact
For further information, please contact Snr. Department Manager Camilla Petersen, +45 34481999

 

Deadline
18 August 2024

 

We will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis, so please do not hesitate to apply today. You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. 

 

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: Student Worker Strategic Data Office
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
#WeAreUR and we continuously redefine automation

At Universal Robots, part of Teradyne Inc., our mission is simple: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere. Our vision is to create a world where people work with robots, not like robots. With 75,000+ cobots already installed worldwide, we’re making a significant impact. Working towards our vision provides endless opportunities to learn, grow, innovate, and solve problems together as we bring our technology to companies of all sizes globally.

We are seeking a talented and versatile student worker to join our team as a Data Science, Data Analytics, and Business Development Specialist. This role is ideal for a student with a blend of technical expertise, analytical skills, and a keen interest in business development.

Due to summer vacations, we will start reviewing candidates in August.

Key Responsibilities


Perform statistical analysis and create visualizations using Python, R, SQL, Power BI, and Tableau.
Develop machine learning models and apply statistical methods to solve business problems.
Clean, process, and analyze large datasets; manage data warehousing and ETL processes.
Write efficient, scalable code in Python, R, SQL, and possibly Java or Scala.
Build and deploy models using TensorFlow, Keras, and Scikit-learn.
Utilize business intelligence tools (Tableau, Power BI) and manage code with Git.
Understand business operations, translate data insights into strategies, and develop business initiatives.
Conduct market research and analyze competitive landscapes.
Present data insights to non-technical stakeholders and create business reports.
Plan, execute, and monitor projects; build and maintain relationships with stakeholders.


We are driven by honesty and act with integrity - #WhoAreUR

For you to have success in the position as our Student Worker, we imagine you have the following:


Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field.
Experience in data science, data analytics, or business development is a plus. Strong proficiency in statistical analysis, data visualization, programming, and machine learning.
Commitment to continuous learning and ethical standards.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to approach problems methodically and develop data-driven solutions.
Adaptability to new technologies, tools, and business environments.
Good interpersonal skills for collaborative teamwork and effective engagement with diverse teams and stakeholders.
Strategic thinking about business opportunities and challenges.
High ethical standards and integrity in all business and data-related activities, ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations.


The working hours will be around 15 hours/week and be flexibly scheduled around your studies. There is also flexibility in additional hours and hours after 4pm as one colleague is based in Boston. You should expect to work in the office at our headquarters in Energivej.

We collaborate - it´s in our DNA

Join Universal Robots, the ground-breaking technology company, and help us on our mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere. Shaping next year’s innovations. Moving a fast-growing industry forward. Building a truly global career. You can do it all here .

At Universal Robots we are a diverse group of bright, ambitious people working at the forefront of collaborative robotics. Through our agility, resilience, and entrepreneurial approach, we are taking our innovative robot products into more markets and regions than ever before.

We employ around 1000 people in offices across North America, South America, Europe, and Asia – and we’re growing all the time. So, if you’re looking to build your career working with some of the best talent from all over the world, we want to get in touch with you!

Send your application using the link. We take candidates into the recruitment process on a continuous basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Title: Principal Data Engineer (Azure Synapse/Fabric)
Description:
Vær med til at skabe unikke dataløsninger og enestående kundeoplevelser.




Delegate er et IT-konsulenthus i vækst, hvor stærke værdier og høj faglighed er grundlaget for din og vores udvikling og succes. Vi er med helt fremme på alle Microsofts Cloud platforme og har en spændende pipeline af projekter på tværs af brancher i den private og offentlige sektor. Hos os får du mere end 200 dygtige kollegaer fordelt på vores fire kontorer i Virum, Aarhus, Aalborg og Naarden i Holland, og du bliver en del af en arbejdsplads, der i 2023 både er blevet hædret som ’Danmarks Bedste Arbejdsplads i IT-branchen’ samt ’Danmarks Bedste Arbejdsplads for Unge’ på tværs af alle kategorier af den globale konsulent- og analysevirksomhed Great Place to Work.




Stillingskrav

Du bliver en del af vores Data & AI serviceline og vil blive tilknyttet vores kontor i Aarhus eller Virum. Delegate og TDN (The Digital Neighborhood) har valgt at satse massivt på udviklingen af robuste og skalerbare data platforme, hvorfor vi får brug for endnu en ledende profil indenfor data engineering på Microsoft Fabric.

Du vil være ledende i leverancen i forhold til at designe, estimere og implementere projekter. Du kommer til at være ansvarlig for planlægning, indsamling af krav og gennemførelse af workshops. Som principal konsulent i Delegate er din fornemmeste opgave dog at sikre at de data platforme, vi leverer til vores kunder, er af højeste kvalitet.




Ansvarsområder:

Du vil samarbejde med interessenter på ledelsesniveau for at forstå deres strategiske mål og identificere muligheder for at udnytte data og datakvalitet.
Du vil rådgive om komplekse dataplatformsprogrammer, synkronisere tværgående arkitektoniske aspekter og give teknisk ledelse og vejledning som ekspert inden for dataplatforme.
Du vil være ansvarlig for design og udvikling af komplekse dataplatforme og datapipelines.
Du vil levere i overensstemmelse med CI/CD-bedste praksis for at implementere, supportere og betjene data pipelines.
Du vil lede og rådgive klienter om, hvordan man bruger forskellige cloud computing-teknologier i relation til dataplatforme.
Du vil vælge egnede datamodelleringsmetoder, optimere og designe datamodeller og forstå afvejningerne mellem forskellige datamodelleringsmetoder.
Du vil designe og drive strategien omkring data governance herunder datasikkerhed og databeskyttelse for at understøtte forretnings- og lovkrav.




Tekniske færdigheder:

Du er ekspert i Microsoft cloud data teknologier, og har gjort dig erfaringer med Fabric.
Du har skabt Big Data-arkitektur, kan opbygge og betjene data pipelines og vedligeholde data storage og alt inden for distribuerede data systemer.
Du har en dyb forståelse for datamodellering og erfaring med moderne datateknologiværktøjer og -platforme, i sammenspil med cloud data warehousing.
Du har bygget og implementeret større data pipelines og datacentriske applikationer.
Du har erfaring med datavisualiseringsteknikker og kan kommunikere indsigterne i overensstemmelse med målgruppen.
Du har erfaring med at definere og implementere datastyrings- og sikkerhedspolitikker.
Du har erfaring med at udvikle i Pyhton og PySpark i Notebooks.
Hvis du har viden om MLOps og data science-koncepter er det et plus.




Professionelle færdigheder:

Du forstår vigtigheden af stakeholderstyring og kan nemt fungere som bindeled mellem klienter og andre centrale interessenter i løbet af projekter, sikre accept og opbygge tillid undervejs.
Du er robust i uklare situationer og kan tilpasse din rolle til at tackle udfordringer fra flere perspektiver.
Du coacher og motiverer andre, og du stræber efter at påvirke teammedlemmer til at handle positivt og tage ansvar for deres arbejde.
Du nyder at påvirke andre og advokerer altid for teknisk excellence, mens du er åben for ændringer, når det er nødvendigt.
Generelt er vigtigt, at du har erfaring med best practices inden for data engineering og teknisk erfaring med komplekse data pipelines.
Taler og skriver dansk og engelsk.




Work from anywhere

Vi gør meget ud af at skabe rammerne for at kunne balancere arbejdsliv og privatliv. I Delegate har du fuld fleksibilitet til at planlægge din hverdag, så du f.eks. kan hente børnene tidligt, eller lægge din træning midt på dagen, for til gengæld at åbne computeren på et andet tidspunkt, ligesom du har mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra. Vi kalder det #workfromanywhere. Vi er forpligtet over for hinanden og vores kunder, og derfor stoler vi på, at du også anerkender den betydelige værdi af at møde ind på vores fysiske kontor i løbet af ugen.

Velkommen hjem

Hos Delegate bliver du mødt med nærvær og kvalitet på alle niveauer, og vi tager os tid til at hjælpe hinanden og gør os umage for, at både kunder og kollegaer føler sig hjemme. Her kan du udvikle dig i et stærkt fællesskab, hvor du får faglig sparring med dygtige kollegaer, som har lige så høje standarder for løsninger som dig. Samarbejdet med vores kunder er kendetegnet ved gode og afslappede relationer med en åben dialog, hvor kundens team er trygge ved at fortælle dig om behov og udfordringer, fordi de ved, at du sætter en ære i at løse dem.




Nysgerrig?

Du må meget gerne booke et uforpligtende og uformelt kaffemøde med Julie Lindvald Thorsen her, hvis du vil høre mere eller har spørgsmål, inden du søger.

Send din ansøgning ved at klikke på ’Ansøg’ her på siden og følg anvisningerne. Vedhæft dit CV og relevante bilag. Tiltrædelse er snarest muligt, og ansøgninger behandles løbende.

  • Du er robust i uklare situationer og kan tilpasse din rolle til at tackle udfordringer fra flere perspektiver.
  • Du coacher og motiverer andre, og du stræber efter at påvirke teammedlemmer til at handle positivt og tage ansvar for deres arbejde.
  • Du nyder at påvirke andre og advokerer altid for teknisk excellence, mens du er åben for ændringer, når det er nødvendigt.
  • Generelt er vigtigt, at du har erfaring med best practices inden for data engineering og teknisk erfaring med komplekse data pipelines.
  • Taler og skriver dansk og engelsk.


Work from anywhere

Vi gør meget ud af at skabe rammerne for at kunne balancere arbejdsliv og privatliv. I Delegate har du fuld fleksibilitet til at planlægge din hverdag, så du f.eks. kan hente børnene tidligt, eller lægge din træning midt på dagen, for til gengæld at åbne computeren på et andet tidspunkt, ligesom du har mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra. Vi kalder det #workfromanywhere. Vi er forpligtet over for hinanden og vores kunder, og derfor stoler vi på, at du også anerkender den betydelige værdi af at møde ind på vores fysiske kontor i løbet af ugen.

Velkommen hjem

Hos Delegate bliver du mødt med nærvær og kvalitet på alle niveauer, og vi tager os tid til at hjælpe hinanden og gør os umage for, at både kunder og kollegaer føler sig hjemme. Her kan du udvikle dig i et stærkt fællesskab, hvor du får faglig sparring med dygtige kollegaer, som har lige så høje standarder for løsninger som dig. Samarbejdet med vores kunder er kendetegnet ved gode og afslappede relationer med en åben dialog, hvor kundens team er trygge ved at fortælle dig om behov og udfordringer, fordi de ved, at du sætter en ære i at løse dem.


Nysgerrig?

Du må meget gerne booke et uforpligtende og uformelt kaffemøde med Julie Lindvald Thorsen her, hvis du vil høre mere eller har spørgsmål, inden du søger.

Send din ansøgning ved at klikke på ’Ansøg’ her på siden og følg anvisningerne. Vedhæft dit CV og relevante bilag. Tiltrædelse er snarest muligt, og ansøgninger behandles løbende.

Title: Information System Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints.

As pioneer and leading company in the field of robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare’s hardest challenges and advance what is possible.

Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere—we strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves.

Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture—our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real-world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential.

Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let’s advance the world of minimally invasive care.

Job Description

Primary Function of Position:

Our digital solutions provide technology to enable easier capturing, archiving, live streaming and sharing of clinical video and other data around diagnostic and therapeutic procedures, while also allowing for a complete integration with electronic medical records (EMR) and picture archival and communications (PACS) systems.

We are seeking a highly motivated technical expert to install and support our digital products and to ensure service agreements and warranty obligations are fulfilled to the highest satisfaction. This person shall thrive to exceed customer expectations and maintain customer satisfaction at the highest possible level. The position will be located in the Nordics (remote setup), with a focus on Nordic countries, but will also serve any other markets as per current needs.

Roles And Responsibilities


Performs remote server installation as well as server, network and services configurations.
Performs physical system installations, when needed (exceptional)
Installs system upgrades.
Provides technical support to customers and other Intuitive employees.
Performs maintenance inspections as required to ensure system meets performance specifications.
Troubleshoots and repairs Intuitive products and associated equipment failures.
Maintains accurate configurations of installed base.
Supports tradeshow activity.
Maintains up-to-date documentation, which include but not limited to; Field Activity Reports, Return Material Authorizations, etc.
Provides excellent customer support by timely addressing reported issues.
Provides feedback to improve processes and efficiencies.
Is the advanced technical go-to person with regards to Intuitive’s digital solutions.
Creates and validates architectural, technical, and functional design of the system


Qualifications

Required Knowledge, Skills and Experience

Minimum


7-10 years of field service experience with medical systems preferred.
Proven track record of troubleshooting medical software systems.
Good written and oral communication skills – English and Danish or Swedish.
Windows Operating System and server system administrator.
Professional installation and wiring of PC hardware in multiple configurations (wall, boom, mobile cart).
Proven administrative and record keeping skills.
Strong analysis, troubleshooting and debugging skills.
Ability to work independent and purposeful from remote.
Effective self-management with moderate supervision.


Preferred


Hardware and Software installation and configuration.
Healthcare and Medical system installation.
LDAP configuration and troubleshooting.
SQL system administrator and troubleshooting.
Good knowledge of core IT technologies (e.g., network systems, operating systems, databases, access controls, IT operations, etc.).


Additional Notes And Physical Requirements


Ability to work from remote.
Able to enter surgical and other patient care areas.
Ability to travel up to 25%. Some short notice travel required.
Able to lift 50 lbs.


Additional Information

Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws.

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.

Shift: Day

Travel: 25% of the time

Title: Open Source Data Platform Specialist
Description:
Job Description

What You’ll Do:


Guide customers already using or looking to adopt open source technologies by showcasing and directing on best practices.
Accelerate customer opportunities with new and existing customers through technical presentations, workshops, solution assistance, or hands-on support.
Research and evaluate emerging and upcoming open source technologies to drive continuous improvement and build your knowledge base.
Collaborate directly with product management to steer features based on customers’ inputs and requirements.
Create compelling assets encompassing external publications and internal documentation, focusing on the open source technologies.
Deliver innovation workshops with customers to shape the future of a customer using the latest open source technologies embedded in Oracle Cloud.



Career Level - IC4

Responsibilities

Required Skills/Experience

What You’ll Bring:


5+ years of Solution Engineering experience with a Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Ability to engage with Customers and Internal Stakeholders to have strategic conversations around designing and using open source technologies in Oracle Cloud.
Experience with cloud technologies (OCI, AWS, Azure, GCP, etc)
Experience with open source databases, like PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, OpenSearch, Redis, Valkey, or NoSQL.
Experience with building and deploying data processing or streaming pipelines, using technologies like Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, MQTT, etc.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to solve sophisticated technical issues in cloud-based environments, effective communication skills, collaboration across teams, and conveying technical concepts to non-technical key stakeholders.
Proven ability to quickly learn new technical domains and innovative mindset.
Industry understanding coming from real life working experience with customers.
Passion for technology and innovation, including market trends like data lakehouse, and cloud native development, hybrid and multi cloud, data science, AI/ML, vector database, ...
Comfortable with ambiguity and time spent outside of comfort zone acquiring new skills.
Excellent written, oral and visual communication skills, both with technical stakeholders and with C-Levels.



A career at Oracle is defined by you. We give you the freedom—and the skills—to write your own success story. Whatever avenue you go down, you’ll gain priceless learning experiences and be supported to do your best work.

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English & local language.

Roles open across EMEA, focusing on Nordics.

About Us

As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

Disclaimer:

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.


Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer
