Title: Back End Developer - 50-60K DKK - Hybrid
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Backend Node Engineer – Copenhagen – 50,000 – 60,000 DKK per month







We’ve partnered with a truly exciting tech business in Copenhagen, as they look to grow their software engineering team this year!




The company definitely fall under the ‘tech for good’ umbrella – as they help businesses and consumers to make the transition into using electric vehicles. Because of the complexity of their industry, they have a variety of products on offer to their users.




They currently have a headcount of approximately 120 – with 45 of those being in the technology team! The goal this year is to increase the team by another 8-10 people, following the successful launch of a new platform.




You’ll be working on a hybrid model in their stylish Copenhagen HQ. Most of the team do three days per week in the office, but you can do anywhere between 2-5 depending on what works best for you!




The role




Due to the amount of greenfield work & new feature development that will be happening this year they are looking to add an experienced developer to the team. This is a pure backend role so you will be utilizing Node.




The team you will be joining handles some of the most complex parts of the business’ technology, so you’ll need to be comfortable handling large-scale systems and taking ownership of features end to end when needed.




The process

Introductory call with Talent team
Call with hiring manager
Short coding challenge & meeting to review
In-person meeting to chat with the Founder & members of your new team.

On offer is up to 60,000 DKK per month plus incredibly strong pension, discretionary bonus, private healthcare and over 30 days of vacation per year!




Would you be interested in discussing this role with me?

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
For DI - Dansk Industri søger vi en Lead Data Engineer




Om stillingen




DI har en ambitiøs digital strategi, der skal bringe dem tættere på medlemmerne, understøtte vækst og sikre effektiv kommunikation og samarbejde på tværs. Som en del af dette og for at styrke Data & Automations Teamet søger DI en Lead Data Engineer.




Som Lead Data Engineer vil du være med til at opbygge en moderne dataplatform i DI. Du får mulighed for at være med i alle faser – fra analyse, design og udvikling til test, implementering og den måske vigtigste fase, forankringen i hverdagen. Du sætter den faglige retning ift. data engineering/dimensionel modellering, og viser at teori kan omsættes til praksis. Du kan skabe overblik på tværs, og ”tænker stort, men starter småt” med øje for, at få data ud at leve i forretningen ved at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter.




Afdelingen har ansvaret for dataprocessering og dataløsninger og er godt i gang med at opbygge en dataplatform på Microsoft Azure stacken – startende med et datavarehus og en række analytiske løsninger. Afdelingen har til ansvar at få teknologierne til at tale sammen ved at automatisere og strømline datapipelines.




Du får en nøglerolle, hvor du er med til at sætte retningen i afdelingen, som er Center of Excellence i forhold til dataplatformen. Du samarbejder tæt med forretningen om at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter gennem bl.a. selvbetjeningsløsninger. I den forbindelse vil du til dagligt være i tæt dialog med forretningen, hvor du også vil agere sparringspartner og indgå i dialog ift. opsætning af integration af data fra forskellige kildesystemer.




Derudover vil dit ansvarsområder bl.a være at:

Være drivende i at opbygge en moderne og mangfoldig dataplatform i DI.
Sætte den faglige retning ift. data engineering/dimensionel modellering, og viser at teori kan omsættes til praksis.
Skabe overblik på tværs, og ”tænker stort, men starter småt” med øje for, at få data ud at leve i forretningen ved at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter.
Du får en nøglerolle, hvor du er med til at sætte retningen i forhold til dataplatformen







Af arbejdsopgaver kan bl.a. nævnes:

Udarbejde tekniske løsningsforslag, såvel som at estimere opgaver og effektivt kommunikere det til forretningen
Designe, udvikle og implementere dataløsninger, primært til data warehouset
Designe, udvikle og vedligeholde dataplatformen og data pipelines
Bidrage til at udvikle en langsigtet strategi for dataplatformen
Integrere data fra en række kilder, og opbygning af datamodeller
Bidrage til tekniske og forretningsmæssige afklaringer af løsninger
Deltage i udviklings- og projektopgaver i forbindelse med optimering af processer og systemer på tværs af DI.




Om dig

Den ideelle kandidat brænder for data og udvikling og tør udfordre status quo og flirte med cloud teknologi og data arkitektur. Du har fire til otte års erfaring fra en lignende stilling, evt. fra et konsulenthus eller en brancheorganisation, hvor du har haft hands-on erfaring med opbygning af data løsninger. Du har en relevant akademisk baggrund formentlig fra CBS, KU eller ITU med særlig fokus på data. Du er serviceorienteret, hjælpsom og kan være bindeled mellem forretningen og it-specialister. Vi ser gerne at du er fagligt nysgerrig i forhold til nye tendenser og udviklingen inden for datavidenskab, herunder data services i Azure. Derudover arbejder du struktureret og selvstændigt med et analytisk mindset og en metodisk tilgang.




Vi ser gerne at du besidder følgende kvalifikationer:

Ekspert i ETL processen, SQL programmering og datamart modellering iflg. Kimball
Solid erfaring med agil udvikling, gerne med afsæt i Git platformen
Gode kommunikationsevner på både dansk og engelsk




Det er en fordel, men ikke et krav, hvis du også har erfaring med:

T-SQL og SQL Server automation rammeværk generelt set
Analytiske applikationer, gerne Microsoft Power BI
Microsoft Azure dataplatform (Infrastruktur)
Azure data factory




Derudover er du en person, der tager ansvar for at kvaliteten, af det der leveres, er høj. Du er god til at sætte dig ind i komplekse og fagligt tunge opgaver. Du er resultatorienteret og har stor handlekraft. Det er også vigtigt, at du er vedholdende, også når det kommer til at udvikle dig selv fagligt og personligt, da teamet har stort fokus på det gode kollegaskab, samt at være gode samarbejdspartnere for hele huset. Det er altså vigtigt, at du er i stand til at danne dig en helhedsforståelse af hele DI. Endelig er du en person som har både hjerte og hjerne med på job og er enig med teamet i, at et godt socialt arbejdsmiljø er en nødvendig del af det at gå på arbejde.




Interesseret?

Så klik på linket herunder med det samme. Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt, og vi behandler kandidater løbende. Rekrutteringen faciliteres af vores rekrutteringspartner Kold+Partners. Har du spørgsmål eller brug for mere viden, er du velkommen til at kontakte Peter Kold (2989 0903).

Show more

  • Deltage i udviklings- og projektopgaver i forbindelse med optimering af processer og systemer på tværs af DI.


Om dig

Den ideelle kandidat brænder for data og udvikling og tør udfordre status quo og flirte med cloud teknologi og data arkitektur. Du har fire til otte års erfaring fra en lignende stilling, evt. fra et konsulenthus eller en brancheorganisation, hvor du har haft hands-on erfaring med opbygning af data løsninger. Du har en relevant akademisk baggrund formentlig fra CBS, KU eller ITU med særlig fokus på data. Du er serviceorienteret, hjælpsom og kan være bindeled mellem forretningen og it-specialister. Vi ser gerne at du er fagligt nysgerrig i forhold til nye tendenser og udviklingen inden for datavidenskab, herunder data services i Azure. Derudover arbejder du struktureret og selvstændigt med et analytisk mindset og en metodisk tilgang.


Vi ser gerne at du besidder følgende kvalifikationer:

  • Ekspert i ETL processen, SQL programmering og datamart modellering iflg. Kimball
  • Solid erfaring med agil udvikling, gerne med afsæt i Git platformen
  • Gode kommunikationsevner på både dansk og engelsk


Det er en fordel, men ikke et krav, hvis du også har erfaring med:

  • T-SQL og SQL Server automation rammeværk generelt set
  • Analytiske applikationer, gerne Microsoft Power BI
  • Microsoft Azure dataplatform (Infrastruktur)
  • Azure data factory


Derudover er du en person, der tager ansvar for at kvaliteten, af det der leveres, er høj. Du er god til at sætte dig ind i komplekse og fagligt tunge opgaver. Du er resultatorienteret og har stor handlekraft. Det er også vigtigt, at du er vedholdende, også når det kommer til at udvikle dig selv fagligt og personligt, da teamet har stort fokus på det gode kollegaskab, samt at være gode samarbejdspartnere for hele huset. Det er altså vigtigt, at du er i stand til at danne dig en helhedsforståelse af hele DI. Endelig er du en person som har både hjerte og hjerne med på job og er enig med teamet i, at et godt socialt arbejdsmiljø er en nødvendig del af det at gå på arbejde.


Interesseret?

Så klik på linket herunder med det samme. Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt, og vi behandler kandidater løbende. Rekrutteringen faciliteres af vores rekrutteringspartner Kold+Partners. Har du spørgsmål eller brug for mere viden, er du velkommen til at kontakte Peter Kold (2989 0903).

Title: Car Pricing Data Analyst!
Place: Vejle, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Hey there! At AUTOproff, we're all about shaking things up in the automotive world with our tech-savvy approach. We’re on the lookout for a new colleague to join our cool dynamic squad, based at our HQ in Vejle, Denmark, in this newly created position a Car Pricing Data Analyst!

If you've got a knack for crunching numbers and love diving into data, this might just be your thing. We need someone to help us analyze car pricing data and dish out some insights to keep our pricing game strong.

At AUTOproff, we're all about turning challenges into adventures! Our squads are meticulously organized into problem spaces, each dedicated to addressing real-life challenges. As a part of the Seller Problem Space squad, your role is pivotal in simplifying the vehicle selling process and empowering our clients to excel in sales. Join our dynamic squad, specializing in pricing trade-in and in-stock cars, where your expertise will make a tangible impact!

As our new Car Pricing Data Analyst at AUTOproff you will start up this new function within the AI team and own the area of building analytics for our Pricing Team. Secondarily provide auction and retail market insight on pricing and Risk Management.

Let's Dive Into Your Key Responsibilities, You Will


Dive deep into big piles of car pricing data to spot trends
Craft detailed reports, insightful analyses, and dynamic dashboards to monitor the vitality of our business, auction activities, and the retail markets
Pioneer the creation of innovative leading indicators to empower our Price Engines and Price Specialists in shaping cutting-edge pricing strategies
Stay ahead of potential risks through proactive risk management and deliver compelling reports that resonate with stakeholders


The Need-to-have Skills


A degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent
Prior experience delving into data, particularly within the automotive market
Love to craft efficient and well-structured SQL queries
In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and fluent in English
In-depth knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis.


The Nice-to-have Skills


Experience working with Python
Proficient working with Excel
Experience working with data lakes in S3


You will thrive in this role if you


Have a curious mindset and always want to get hands-on experience with the newest technologies
Are a team player, who loves to share their knowledge with colleagues and like-minded enthusiast
Can work independently and structure your tasks in an efficient way
Have a strong sense of ownership for the solutions you develop


If you think we could be a match, we can’t wait to hear from you. Hurry up and apply!

About AUTOproff

AUTOproff is a fully transparent digital B2B vehicle platform where professionals can seamlessly and securely sell and buy vehicles directly via AUTOproff’s online auction, with a unique range of integrated on-demand trading services (including on-site car appraisal, wholesale price guidance, guaranteed minimum pricing, secure escrow-based transactions/payment, car transportation etc.) or sell cars via AUTOproff’s fully managed, end-to-end selling service.

AUTOproff also provides C2B web solutions for dealerships, internal digital trading solutions for larger dealership groups and their ecosystems, as well as dedicated enterprise solutions for leasing, rental and insurance firms. More information on www.autoproff.com

We employ 100 enthusiastic professionals across our offices. In 2021, we posted revenues of more than DKK 750 million and we have been profitable since our inception.

In August 2022, AutoScout24, the leading specialized pan-European online car marketplace, acquired the majority stake in AUTOproff. The partnership supports a rapid expansion of AUTOproff’s solutions across Europe and enable the creation of Europe’s first fully integrated C2B-B2B-B2C used car trading solution. More information on www.autoscout24.de .

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented, curious, and data-driven problem solver who wants to build up and maintain a Data Platform for reporting and analytics in a fast-growing FinTech company? Then you might be the one we are looking for.




Banking Circle is a truly international and vibrant company with more than 550 skilled and dedicated employees worldwide, who are all passionate about creating next-generation mission-critical financial services infrastructure and leading the rise of a super-correspondent banking network.




About the role

We are looking to hire a highly skilled Data Engineer to join our Data Engineering team in Copenhagen, reporting to the Data Engineering Team Lead.




In this role you will get the chance to work on building and maintaining our next generation Data Platform in Azure. The Data Engineering team owns Banking Circle’s Data Platform, which is closely coupled to our payment processing system. Our tech stack includes Python, Terraform, Microsoft Azure cloud ecosystem, Azure DevOps, and Microsoft Power BI. Furthermore, we also use Databricks SQL warehouses and Astronomer/Airflow to orchestrate our processing pipelines.

What you will be doing

Build and maintain our Data Platform in collaboration with peers
Advocate for software architecture patterns, efficient data processing, modern data integration, and solid data modelling
Collaborate in the continual analysis of project requirements in collaboration with teams across the organization
Participate in Agile team rituals (stand-up, planning, and retrospective)
Contribute to continuous improvements of the team’s way of working
Take responsibility for own learning and development




What we are looking for

To be the right candidate for this position, we expect you to have an educational background within computer science, software engineering, or other related fields, with a bachelor's degree as a minimum. We expect you to have 3+ years of relevant work experience within pipelines, infrastructure, or the platform world, including strong Python skills. Furthermore, it is a big advantage if you have experience within Microsoft Azure cloud.




As a person we expect you to be open-minded, and willing to learn and further expand your existing experience in Data Engineering. You are curious, communicative, and able to work well on your own as well in a team.




As Banking Circle is an international company it´s a requirement, that you are fluent in English.




What we offer you

We offer a hybrid work model for our employees to allow for flexibility and productivity, however we do also expect you to spend time in the office on a regular basis to build community and efficiency in the team. Furthermore, we offer a competitive salary and a generous benefit package, opportunities for continuous learning, development, and a dynamic and collaborative culture that values personal initiative and professional achievements.




Would you like to join us?

We will be conducting interviews continuously; therefore, we urge interested candidates to apply online as soon as possible. Please note that we do not accept applications by email.




If you have questions do not hesitate to contact Kheira Nougal, Global Recruitment Partner on khno@bankingcircle.com. No agencies, please.




Who we are

Banking Circle is a fully licensed next generation Payments Bank that is designed to meet the global banking and payments needs of Payments businesses, Banks, and Marketplaces. Through our API, we deliver fast, low-cost global payments and banking services by connecting to the world’s clearing systems – enabling our clients to move liquidity in real-time for all major currencies securely and compliantly. To learn more about Banking Circle, visit us at www.bankingcircle.com




We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, age, religion, sexual orientation, national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local laws, regulations and ordinances.

Title: BI Analyst til digital transformation i Telmore
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Har du interessen, evnerne og viljen til at optimere vores forretning gennem data og indsigter? Synes du at data, visualiseringer og struktur er det bedste i verden? Så er det dig vi søger til vores Digital Center of Excellence (DCX) i Telmore. Vi søger en Business Intelligence Analyst, som kan være med til at bringe fakta og indsigter i spil på tværs af hele organisationen.

Om stillingen

Telmore er en ledende spiller i det danske mobilmarked når det kommer til innovative produkter og gode kundeoplevelser. Vi stræber hele tiden efter at blive bedre, og vores fremskridt afhænger af evnen til at træffe datadrevne beslutninger. Og det er her, din rolle kommer ind i billedet. DCX er et lille, tværfagligt team bestående af blandt andet Product- og User Experience Managers. Vi bringer vores færdigheder sammen for at levere brugbare og værdiskabende indsigter til forretningen. I Telmore vil vi være digitale ”front runners”, og DCX-teamets fornemmeste opgave er at identificere områder, hvor Telmore kan digitalisere forretningen for at optimere kundeoplevelsen og reducere analoge henvendelser.

Dine primære opgaver bliver at:


Anbefale og bygge dataløsninger, der skaber relevante, kommercielle indsigter
Bygge PBI rapporter med en høj grad af automatisering til brug i hele Telmore
Udføre analytiske deep dives ved at kombinere data fra flere kilder
Være kravstiller til vores datafundament, som udvikles af dine BI kollegaer
Være ekspert og go-to person for dine kollegaer, når de har brug for at forstå og sammenligne data eller udføre specifikke analyser



Dine kvalifikationer


Du er analytisk dygtig og forstår at nedbryde komplicerede problemstillinger
Du formår at samarbejde med kollegaer på alle niveauer og jobtyper, har et godt øje for struktur og validering samt gode kommunikationsevner, så de nødvendige konklusioner når frem til forretningen
Du er desuden detaljeorienteret og har evnen til at dykke dybt ned for at finde de rigtige løsninger i komplekse datasæt
Du har stærke kundskaber inden for Power BI og Excel, evner at tage ejerskab og forstår at arbejde med opgaverne til et brugbart kommercielt output



Om Telmore

Telmore er det førende “Lovebrand” i Nuuday, og det er vi alle meget stolte af. Telmore har nu mere end 750.000 glade kunder, der bruger vores mobile produkter. Vi sidder sammen på Nuudays hovedkontor i København. Kulturen og hverdagen er uformel med højt til loftet, ansvar er noget du tager og tillid er helt naturligt noget du får som del af Telmore-familien. Vi sætter en ære og glæde i at dyrke vores sociale sammenhold og medarbejdertilfredsheden er i absolut top.

Ansøgning og kontakt

Har du yderligere spørgsmål omkring stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte kommerciel direktør og Head of BI, Ebbe Tølbøll Nielsen, på 20 25 78 60. Vi afholder løbende samtaler og anbefaler, at du sender din ansøgning hurtigst muligt.

Jobbet er baseret i Nuuday’s hovedkvarter på Teglholmen i København.

Ansøgningsfrist: 11 august 2024

Kontaktperson: Kommerciel direktør og Head of BI, Ebbe Tølbøll Nielsen, på 20 25 78 60.

Arbejdssted: Teglholmsgade 1, København

Nuuday – We make sense with technology

Nuuday er en familie af seks stærke og velkendte brands, der arbejder for det fælles mål at få teknologien til at give mening i vores liv. Vores familie består af YouSee, Telmore, Hiper, TDC Erhverv, eesy og Relatel. Vi arbejder for at forbedre menneskers og organisationers liv med innovative løsninger inden for TV, bredbånd, netværk og telefoni og underholdning. Og vi gør det sammen. På tværs af teams, 33 nationaliteter og mere end 3500 fantastiske kollegaer. Som Danmarks førende digitale service udbyder, stræber vi hver dag efter at bruge teknologien til at skabe en mere meningsfuld fremtid for vores kunder og samfundet som helhed. Derfor er vi også altid på udkig efter markedets stærkeste udviklere, de skarpeste kommercielle folk og de bedste kreative specialister, der tør udfordre og skille sig ud. Nuuday er dedikerede til at fremme en inkluderende kultur, som værdsætter diversitet, og vi er stolte af, at give lige muligheder til alle. Alle kvalificerede kandidater vil blive vurderet uafhængigt at etnicitet, religion, køn, kønsidentitet, handicap, seksuel orientering og alle de andre karakteristika, som gør os forskellige. Læs mere om, hvordan vi behandler dine personoplysninger her: https://nuuday.dk/karriere

Title: Senior IT Support Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
IT Technical Support – Join Marsh - the world's leading risk advisory and insurance brokerage firm

With over 45,000 employees across 130 countries, we empower Denmark's largest companies to navigate risks and seize business opportunities through our unrivaled expertise in risk management and insurance consulting. We are app. 150 colleagues in Denmark, eager to welcome you to our great organization.

As Senior IT Support Analyst you are on-site support to all our great colleagues and based in our modern facilities in Nordhavn. You will report to the Manager of the IT Support Team located in Sweden.

Please ensure that when applying, your CV & application is in English.

What you can expect:

Cutting-edge Technology: Work with a wide range of systems and applications, including Microsoft 365, ServiceNow, MoveWorks, Nexthink, Zoom and other Cloud based Technologies to support our local, Nordic, and global operations.

Collaborative Environment: Join forces with our Nordic teams to provide exceptional IT support to our local users in Denmark, ensuring smooth operations and seamless user experiences.

Diverse Responsibilities: From provisioning and maintaining workstations to managing mobile phones, you'll have a diverse range of tasks that keep you engaged and challenged.

Technical Excellence: Participate in technical operations and troubleshooting, leveraging your broad IT knowledge and familiarity with ITIL processes to deliver top-notch solutions.

Service-Oriented Mindset: As a customer-centric professional, you'll excel in communicating with users, providing timely assistance, and maintaining a calm and focused approach even in high-pressure situations.

What you will be rewarded with:


Collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diversity and innovation
Continuous learning and development opportunities to improve your skills and advance your career.
Competitive compensation and pension scheme
Global network of professionals providing opportunities for growth and mobility


We will rely on you to:


On-site support to our local colleagues in Denmark, primarily in Nordhavn but also our Aarhus office
On- and off boarding of colleagues
Prepare / maintain PC workstations.
Administer and prepare mobile devices.
Maintenance and operation of copy/print, local backup, and other operating systems
Participate in technical operational tasks, including troubleshooting.
Work with our Service Desk and asset management systems.
Carry out any other ad-hoc tasks as and when required.


What you need to have:


Speaks and understands English at a high level and can communicate in the Nordic languages
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role in an international organisation
Solid knowledge of software and hardware
Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Microsoft environment in general
Knowledge of standard operating systems such as Windows 10
Knowledge of ITIL processes
Knowledge of Copiers, printers, and AV equipment
Knowledge of ServiceNow is a plus.
Solid interpersonal skills and service mindset
Pragmatic, robust and solution orientated personality


What makes you stand out:


Experience with Support/Ticket systems and asset management.


Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk advisor. With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marsh.com, and follow us on LinkedIn and X.

Show more
HTML:
IT Technical Support – Join Marsh - the world's leading risk advisory and insurance brokerage firm

With over 45,000 employees across 130 countries, we empower Denmark's largest companies to navigate risks and seize business opportunities through our unrivaled expertise in risk management and insurance consulting. We are app. 150 colleagues in Denmark, eager to welcome you to our great organization.

As Senior IT Support Analyst you are on-site support to all our great colleagues and based in our modern facilities in Nordhavn. You will report to the Manager of the IT Support Team located in Sweden.

Please ensure that when applying, your CV & application is in English.

What you can expect:

Cutting-edge Technology: Work with a wide range of systems and applications, including Microsoft 365, ServiceNow, MoveWorks, Nexthink, Zoom and other Cloud based Technologies to support our local, Nordic, and global operations.

Collaborative Environment: Join forces with our Nordic teams to provide exceptional IT support to our local users in Denmark, ensuring smooth operations and seamless user experiences.

Diverse Responsibilities: From provisioning and maintaining workstations to managing mobile phones, you'll have a diverse range of tasks that keep you engaged and challenged.

Technical Excellence: Participate in technical operations and troubleshooting, leveraging your broad IT knowledge and familiarity with ITIL processes to deliver top-notch solutions.

Service-Oriented Mindset: As a customer-centric professional, you'll excel in communicating with users, providing timely assistance, and maintaining a calm and focused approach even in high-pressure situations.

What you will be rewarded with:

  • Collaborative and inclusive work environment that values diversity and innovation
  • Continuous learning and development opportunities to improve your skills and advance your career.
  • Competitive compensation and pension scheme
  • Global network of professionals providing opportunities for growth and mobility

We will rely on you to:

  • On-site support to our local colleagues in Denmark, primarily in Nordhavn but also our Aarhus office
  • On- and off boarding of colleagues
  • Prepare / maintain PC workstations.
  • Administer and prepare mobile devices.
  • Maintenance and operation of copy/print, local backup, and other operating systems
  • Participate in technical operational tasks, including troubleshooting.
  • Work with our Service Desk and asset management systems.
  • Carry out any other ad-hoc tasks as and when required.

What you need to have:

  • Speaks and understands English at a high level and can communicate in the Nordic languages
  • A minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role in an international organisation
  • Solid knowledge of software and hardware
  • Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Microsoft environment in general
  • Knowledge of standard operating systems such as Windows 10
  • Knowledge of ITIL processes
  • Knowledge of Copiers, printers, and AV equipment
  • Knowledge of ServiceNow is a plus.
  • Solid interpersonal skills and service mindset
  • Pragmatic, robust and solution orientated personality

What makes you stand out:

  • Experience with Support/Ticket systems and asset management.

Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk advisor. With more than 45,000 colleagues advising clients in over 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data-driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue of $23 billion, Marsh McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. For more information, visit marsh.com, and follow us on LinkedIn and X.

R_253489

Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Dreamdata is the industry leader in B2B marketing attribution, optimization and automation. Founded by ex-Trustpilot product and engineering leaders starting in 2019 after building the platform internally, Dreamdata is on a mission to empower marketing professionals by democratizing access and usability of data.

Taking on the complex world of B2B marketing data Dreamdata helps marketing leaders to connect their efforts across all marketing channels to real revenue - something that wasn't fully possible until now.

We are expanding our team to further empower our customers and ensure their success. This is where you come in. We are scaling our product team in our Copenhagen office.

As an Analytics Engineer at Dreamdata you will be part of a cross-functional product team consisting of Software Engineering, Design and Product Manager.

At Dreamdata data is not just a support function - it is our product and what we do !

You will be responsible for the data function part of the team to build and iterate on our main product, ensuring that data pipelines and transformations are built using best practices and are transparent and easy-to-use for our customers.

You will also be part of the broader data group consisting of the analytics engineers and data scientists from other teams. Together we maintain the fundamental data models that power the entire Dreamdata product.

Requirements


You have 2-4 years of experience in a data related role such as analytics engineer, data engineer, data analyst, data scientist or a similar role
You most likely have real-world experience in working with data from multiple sources, extracting, visualizing, and explaining insights to stakeholders. Previous experience working with marketing and sales data is considered a plus
You are fluent in SQL. We use Google BigQuery, but experience with other cloud data warehouses like Snowflake, AWS Redshift, Azure SQL etc. is equally relevant
We use GCP Dataform for the majority of data transformations but experience with dbt or transformation libraries like Pandas, Polar, tidyr, dplyr etc. is also relevant
You have some exposure to other coding languages like Python, golang, Typescript etc
We use Github, but other version control systems are equally relevant
You have played with visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx etc. Experience using open source Python/R-based visualization libraries is equally relevant
We are heavy users of Google Cloud Platform, but exposure to the other public clouds are also considered a plus


If you think the role sounds exciting, but you don't match all points, don't hesitate to reach out as we are continuously hiring also with opportunities for less senior profiles.

Benefits


Flexibility - we are sharing our time between the office and remote work
Equity - be part of the growth journey ahead
Lunch at the office
Office next to the waterfront, in the heart of Copenhagen
A company where you will get the chance to grow with the company



Who is Dreamdata?

We are a young company with big ambitions, but also a company that emphasizes that it should be fun going to work. We are currently 18 nationalities from all over the world. You will also have opportunities to participate in activities outside of work.

We get together for various non-workrelated events to get to know our colleagues across the company and simply to have a good time together.

https://dreamdata.io/blog/summer-fun-at-dreamdata

https://dreamdata.io/blog/building-the-dream-team-at-dreamdata
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to be part of an international team that drives technological innovation that saves lives and enhances patient care?

Do you want to gain the experience of being at the forefront of a digitalization tranformation journey?

Do you have a deepfounded passion in data engineering, cloud platforms and data management systems?

This could be your moment to shine. Apply today and embark on a career that keeps moving forward!

Local Role with Global Impact

In this role, you will be part of the Data and Analytics department at Ambu’s headquarters. Our team is uniquely international, with members from around the world, and engages with business stakeholders globally. We are on a transformative journey, establishing a new foundation of processes, ownership, and technology, with a major focus on developing a cutting-edge Data Platform in the Microsoft Azure cloud.

As a Data Engineer, you will be at the forefront of automating business processes through digitalization and playing a pivotal role in our strategic initiative to enhance data-driven decision-making across the company.

In a collaborative and agile environment, we value open communication and a team-oriented approach to solving complex challenges. For new team members, we look for the eagerness to learn and adapt, rather than having detailed knowledge of or experience with every technology.

Your Day-to-day Work Will Involve


Designing, developing, and managing scalable data pipelines and architectures.
Ensuring data integrity and security, complying with the latest standards in data governance.
Collaborating with various business stakeholders globally to support data-driven decisions and innovations.
Leveraging new technologies to enhance the efficiency and capabilities of our data systems.


Suggested Candidate Profile

Setting you up for success is one of our cornerstones. We imagine you have a robust educational background in computer science, data science, or a related field, coupled with substantial experience in data engineering. As a person, you should be proactive, keen to learn new skills, and enthusiastic about sharing your expertise.

Experience Or Knowledge In The Following Is Highly Relevant


Microsoft Azure and other cloud services
ETL tools and processes
Data modeling and warehousing
Python, SQL, and other relevant data management technologies
Strong command of English, both written and spoken, is crucial for this role.


Apply for a career #ForeverForward

The Talent Attraction team will engage with candidates on an ongoing basis, hence we encourage you to not hesitate, and rather apply!

Questions? Reach out to Aike Baars, Head of Strategic Data Systems at aaba@ambu.com.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Tester
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are You Ready to Work With the Latest Technologies?

We are looking to grow our IT team with a skilled and experienced Business Intelligence (BI) Tester. If you appreciate working with the latest technologies, wish to improve your career, and participate in continuous learning and training initiatives, it could be you who we are looking for.

Who Are We?

The RiskPoint Group is a global Managing General Underwriter (MGU) providing best-in-class insurance solutions backed by the insurance companies we act on behalf of.

You will become part of our new, small team of highly skilled BI professionals, who together holds many years of experience in insurance data. Our BI team is part of our growing IT team, which is part of our Finance & Operations department. In this role, you will be working with other IT colleagues in both Denmark and the UK as well as colleagues from other departments.

We operate in an agile organization with close cross-border cooperation across all business lines. And our organizational structure is flat, leaving many opportunities for all employees to make a difference, take responsibility, excel, and grow.

About The Position

As our new BI Tester, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of our data pipelines, reports, and dashboards.

This is an onsite role based either in our Copenhagen office or in our London office, with the option to work remotely if approved by your manager. Occasional domestic and international travel may be required.

You will report to our CTO, who is located in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Your key responsibilities will include but not be limited to:


Design, develop, and maintain comprehensive test plans and test cases for BI solutions
Perform regression testing to ensure existing functionalities are not affected by new developments
Conduct behavioral testing to validate the system’s behavior against expected outcomes
Write and execute tests in dbt (data build tool) to ensure data transformations are accurate and reliable
Collaborate with BI developers, data engineers, and analysts to understand requirements and validate solutions
Identify, document, and track defects and issues through to resolution
Ensure data quality and integrity across all data platforms
Participate in continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies to continuously improve our BI testing capabilities


Please note that current residency in either Denmark or the UK with work and residency permit needs to be in place before applying.

A Great Match for Us

The ideal candidate will have completed a degree that provides a solid foundation in computer science principles, programming, data structures, and database management. That could be, for example, a bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.

You must have worked professionally for 2-5 years in roles involving BI testing, demonstrating the ability to handle job-specific challenges and deliver results in a business environment.

Moreover you need to have:


Extensive experience conducting regression tests to ensure new code changes do not adversely affect existing functionalities.
Conducted behavioral tests to validate that the system behaves as expected under various conditions.
Hands-on experience in designing and executing test plans for ETL pipelines, ensuring data is accurately extracted from various sources, correctly transformed into the required format, and reliably loaded into data warehouses or other destinations.
Hands-on experience using dbt (data build tool) to write and execute tests for data transformations, proving your ability to ensure data quality and accuracy.
High proficiency level in SQL and the capability of writing complex queries to validate data integrity and accuracy.
Practical experience in validating data models and ensuring data consistency across the data warehouse.
Experience validating data visualizations and dashboards to ensure you provide accurate and actionable insights.
Demonstrated the ability to identify and solve complex data-related problems, ensuring high data quality and reliability.


It is furthermore a requirement that you have a proven track record of working effectively in team settings, communicating technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver data solutions.

To be successful in this role, we expect you to have excellent problem solving skills, strong communication skills, and always pay attention to the details.

Although not required, we prefer you are:


Experienced in validating and testing big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Iceberg), ensuring data processing and transformations are performed correctly and efficiently across large-scale datasets.
Familiar with DevOps methodologies and tools, such as CI/CD pipelines, version control systems, and infrastructure automation, indicating your ability to contribute to a culture of continuous improvement and operational excellence.


Interested in the Position?

We are looking forward to receiving your resume and a motivational letter of application for this position. Please use the form below.

We hope to see your application before August 31, 2024, but have patience and can wait for the perfect match. Interviews will be held successively.

For more information about the position, contact CTO, Zubair Sabir, at *protected email*. Note that we do not accept applications via e-mail, please use the form below.

About The RiskPoint Group

The RiskPoint Group is one of Europe’s largest Managing General Underwriters (MGUs), providing best in class insurance solutions to businesses and their advisors globally. The RiskPoint Group operates as RiskPoint in Europe and Asia and RP Underwriting in the rest of the world.

With 250+ employees and 15 locations in Europe, North America, and Asia Pacific, the RiskPoint Group employs expert underwriting and specialized, in-house claims teams within Accident & Health, Transactional Risk, Property & Construction, Renewable Energy, Offshore Upstream, and Liabilities, including Financial Lines, Cyber, and Casualty.

The RiskPoint Group is a Coverholder with Lloyd’s of London and is backed by a strong panel of well-reputed insurance companies. The RiskPoint Group core values are: trust, openness & honesty, respect & tolerance, drive & dedication as well as being part of a winning team in a competitive environment.

For more information about the position, contact CTO, Zubair Sabir, at *protected email*. Note that we do not accept applications via e-mail, please use the form below.

About The RiskPoint Group

The RiskPoint Group is one of Europe’s largest Managing General Underwriters (MGUs), providing best in class insurance solutions to businesses and their advisors globally. The RiskPoint Group operates as RiskPoint in Europe and Asia and RP Underwriting in the rest of the world.

With 250+ employees and 15 locations in Europe, North America, and Asia Pacific, the RiskPoint Group employs expert underwriting and specialized, in-house claims teams within Accident & Health, Transactional Risk, Property & Construction, Renewable Energy, Offshore Upstream, and Liabilities, including Financial Lines, Cyber, and Casualty.

The RiskPoint Group is a Coverholder with Lloyd’s of London and is backed by a strong panel of well-reputed insurance companies. The RiskPoint Group core values are: trust, openness & honesty, respect & tolerance, drive & dedication as well as being part of a winning team in a competitive environment.

Title: Student Worker Strategic Data Office
Place: Odense, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
#WeAreUR and we continuously redefine automation

At Universal Robots, part of Teradyne Inc., our mission is simple: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere. Our vision is to create a world where people work with robots, not like robots. With 75,000+ cobots already installed worldwide, we’re making a significant impact. Working towards our vision provides endless opportunities to learn, grow, innovate, and solve problems together as we bring our technology to companies of all sizes globally.

We are seeking a talented and versatile student worker to join our team as a Data Science, Data Analytics, and Business Development Specialist. This role is ideal for a student with a blend of technical expertise, analytical skills, and a keen interest in business development.

Due to summer vacations, we will start reviewing candidates in August.

Key Responsibilities


Perform statistical analysis and create visualizations using Python, R, SQL, Power BI, and Tableau.
Develop machine learning models and apply statistical methods to solve business problems.
Clean, process, and analyze large datasets; manage data warehousing and ETL processes.
Write efficient, scalable code in Python, R, SQL, and possibly Java or Scala.
Build and deploy models using TensorFlow, Keras, and Scikit-learn.
Utilize business intelligence tools (Tableau, Power BI) and manage code with Git.
Understand business operations, translate data insights into strategies, and develop business initiatives.
Conduct market research and analyze competitive landscapes.
Present data insights to non-technical stakeholders and create business reports.
Plan, execute, and monitor projects; build and maintain relationships with stakeholders.


We are driven by honesty and act with integrity - #WhoAreUR

For you to have success in the position as our Student Worker, we imagine you have the following:


Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field.
Experience in data science, data analytics, or business development is a plus. Strong proficiency in statistical analysis, data visualization, programming, and machine learning.
Commitment to continuous learning and ethical standards.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills to approach problems methodically and develop data-driven solutions.
Adaptability to new technologies, tools, and business environments.
Good interpersonal skills for collaborative teamwork and effective engagement with diverse teams and stakeholders.
Strategic thinking about business opportunities and challenges.
High ethical standards and integrity in all business and data-related activities, ensuring compliance with data privacy regulations.


The working hours will be around 15 hours/week and be flexibly scheduled around your studies. There is also flexibility in additional hours and hours after 4pm as one colleague is based in Boston. You should expect to work in the office at our headquarters in Energivej.

We collaborate - it´s in our DNA

Join Universal Robots, the ground-breaking technology company, and help us on our mission: Automation for Anyone. Anywhere. Shaping next year’s innovations. Moving a fast-growing industry forward. Building a truly global career. You can do it all here .

At Universal Robots we are a diverse group of bright, ambitious people working at the forefront of collaborative robotics. Through our agility, resilience, and entrepreneurial approach, we are taking our innovative robot products into more markets and regions than ever before.

We employ around 1000 people in offices across North America, South America, Europe, and Asia – and we’re growing all the time. So, if you’re looking to build your career working with some of the best talent from all over the world, we want to get in touch with you!

Send your application using the link. We take candidates into the recruitment process on a continuous basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible.


Show more

At Universal Robots we are a diverse group of bright, ambitious people working at the forefront of collaborative robotics. Through our agility, resilience, and entrepreneurial approach, we are taking our innovative robot products into more markets and regions than ever before.

We employ around 1000 people in offices across North America, South America, Europe, and Asia – and we’re growing all the time. So, if you’re looking to build your career working with some of the best talent from all over the world, we want to get in touch with you!

Send your application using the link. We take candidates into the recruitment process on a continuous basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Title: Snowflake Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who wants to work with the Snowflake Data Cloud. You want to work with the latest in data engineering and have the desire and skills to learn new languages and services. Experience within Azure / AWS, Snowflake, ELT/ETL, Python, and SQL is a plus.

Are you our new Snowflake Data Engineer?

As a Snowflake Data Engineer at Intellishore, you will get the opportunity to be innovative, create lasting impacts for a wide range of customers, and excel in a culture of collaboration. We are not an industry-specific consultancy, so you should thrive in learning new industries and bring a healthy dose of curiosity. Two projects are rarely the same!

You will get the opportunity to influence and drive the development of Intellishore to make sure we deliver value to our clients across different industries and business areas. Working at Intellishore means working together with people representing other competencies than yourself and we take great pride in the development of all our Intellishorians. We focus on bringing together a broad mix of people to build a unique combination of expertise and backgrounds. The personal edge of every Intellishorian is what creates our distinct collective power – that is our belief!

If this sounds like something for you – Then keep on reading below

What are we looking for?

We Realize That Few People Are Experts At Everything. But If You Can Nod Your Head At Some Of The Following Attributes Then You Could Be The Person We Are Looking For


Work experience as a Data Engineer, building and maintaining performant data platforms for reporting and analytics
Implementing ELT/ETL models is something you are all for and might even be passionate about
The cloud you love the most is the Snowflake Data Cloud – also as an “end-user”
You worked with data engineering services on Azure or AWS and have been giving multiple high-fives for your work!
A big enthusiast and some might call a connoisseur when it comes to SQL
Good understanding of data modeling principles
Relevant background in computer science and engineering, mathematical modeling, or similar



It would be a plus if you have experience with making it snow in the Snowflake Data Cloud with security, access, integration, etc.

To Succeed In This Role, We Believe That You


Love to be a team and you are one that takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships, and is all about sharing knowledge
Dig being part of different teams, projects, and challenges
Value the importance of a great environment where productive work is done by communication and contributing constructively
Want to be part of a journey that is bigger than yourself but you are an essential part of it!



Why work for Intellishore?

1 | Challenging projects

Exciting and challenging Consultant role in data-intensive and strategic client projects

2 | Entrepreneurial work environment

Dynamic and entrepreneurial environment with kind & ambitious colleagues

3 | Courses & training

We will provide you with access to the necessary courses and certifications within the newest technologies (i.e. AWS, Snowflake, & Azure)

4 | Strategic seminars

Annual Strategic Seminar where you get to socialize with your colleagues whilst building the company for the future (we've been to South Africa, Japan, India, China, Dubai, Iceland, and Germany)

5 | Sustainable consulting

A sustainable consulting career with high levels of flexibility and a great and informal work environment

6 | Exciting growth journey

We are on a mission to redefine the world of data & analytics and we are constantly expanding our team and scope

Any questions?

If you are interested in applying for this position, fill out the formula below. Applicants will be invited to interviews on a rolling basis.

We acknowledge that a change in career path requires careful consideration and that timing is crucial. Therefore, you are always welcome to reach out as you see fit.

For more information about the position, please reach out to David Andreasen Lyngh: dly@intellishore.dk / +45 28 59 42 76

At the moment, we are only accepting applications from applicants inside of the EU or the Nordics.

Who is Intellishore?

Intellishore was founded in 2013 with the idea of providing clients with a seamless combination of strategic and technical support. Today, we are more than 60 skilled, entrepreneurial, and passionate employees from many different backgrounds; engineers, economists, marketers, and we even have a rhetorician (with a degree in economics, but still).

We are Intellishorians; a family, a unique collective of passionate professionals who have jumped at the chance to be part of a larger journey.
Show more

Title: Principal Data Engineer (Azure Synapse/Fabric)
Description:
Vær med til at skabe unikke dataløsninger og enestående kundeoplevelser.




Delegate er et IT-konsulenthus i vækst, hvor stærke værdier og høj faglighed er grundlaget for din og vores udvikling og succes. Vi er med helt fremme på alle Microsofts Cloud platforme og har en spændende pipeline af projekter på tværs af brancher i den private og offentlige sektor. Hos os får du mere end 200 dygtige kollegaer fordelt på vores fire kontorer i Virum, Aarhus, Aalborg og Naarden i Holland, og du bliver en del af en arbejdsplads, der i 2023 både er blevet hædret som ’Danmarks Bedste Arbejdsplads i IT-branchen’ samt ’Danmarks Bedste Arbejdsplads for Unge’ på tværs af alle kategorier af den globale konsulent- og analysevirksomhed Great Place to Work.




Stillingskrav

Du bliver en del af vores Data & AI serviceline og vil blive tilknyttet vores kontor i Aarhus eller Virum. Delegate og TDN (The Digital Neighborhood) har valgt at satse massivt på udviklingen af robuste og skalerbare data platforme, hvorfor vi får brug for endnu en ledende profil indenfor data engineering på Microsoft Fabric.

Du vil være ledende i leverancen i forhold til at designe, estimere og implementere projekter. Du kommer til at være ansvarlig for planlægning, indsamling af krav og gennemførelse af workshops. Som principal konsulent i Delegate er din fornemmeste opgave dog at sikre at de data platforme, vi leverer til vores kunder, er af højeste kvalitet.




Ansvarsområder:

Du vil samarbejde med interessenter på ledelsesniveau for at forstå deres strategiske mål og identificere muligheder for at udnytte data og datakvalitet.
Du vil rådgive om komplekse dataplatformsprogrammer, synkronisere tværgående arkitektoniske aspekter og give teknisk ledelse og vejledning som ekspert inden for dataplatforme.
Du vil være ansvarlig for design og udvikling af komplekse dataplatforme og datapipelines.
Du vil levere i overensstemmelse med CI/CD-bedste praksis for at implementere, supportere og betjene data pipelines.
Du vil lede og rådgive klienter om, hvordan man bruger forskellige cloud computing-teknologier i relation til dataplatforme.
Du vil vælge egnede datamodelleringsmetoder, optimere og designe datamodeller og forstå afvejningerne mellem forskellige datamodelleringsmetoder.
Du vil designe og drive strategien omkring data governance herunder datasikkerhed og databeskyttelse for at understøtte forretnings- og lovkrav.




Tekniske færdigheder:

Du er ekspert i Microsoft cloud data teknologier, og har gjort dig erfaringer med Fabric.
Du har skabt Big Data-arkitektur, kan opbygge og betjene data pipelines og vedligeholde data storage og alt inden for distribuerede data systemer.
Du har en dyb forståelse for datamodellering og erfaring med moderne datateknologiværktøjer og -platforme, i sammenspil med cloud data warehousing.
Du har bygget og implementeret større data pipelines og datacentriske applikationer.
Du har erfaring med datavisualiseringsteknikker og kan kommunikere indsigterne i overensstemmelse med målgruppen.
Du har erfaring med at definere og implementere datastyrings- og sikkerhedspolitikker.
Du har erfaring med at udvikle i Pyhton og PySpark i Notebooks.
Hvis du har viden om MLOps og data science-koncepter er det et plus.




Professionelle færdigheder:

Du forstår vigtigheden af stakeholderstyring og kan nemt fungere som bindeled mellem klienter og andre centrale interessenter i løbet af projekter, sikre accept og opbygge tillid undervejs.
Du er robust i uklare situationer og kan tilpasse din rolle til at tackle udfordringer fra flere perspektiver.
Du coacher og motiverer andre, og du stræber efter at påvirke teammedlemmer til at handle positivt og tage ansvar for deres arbejde.
Du nyder at påvirke andre og advokerer altid for teknisk excellence, mens du er åben for ændringer, når det er nødvendigt.
Generelt er vigtigt, at du har erfaring med best practices inden for data engineering og teknisk erfaring med komplekse data pipelines.
Taler og skriver dansk og engelsk.




Work from anywhere

Vi gør meget ud af at skabe rammerne for at kunne balancere arbejdsliv og privatliv. I Delegate har du fuld fleksibilitet til at planlægge din hverdag, så du f.eks. kan hente børnene tidligt, eller lægge din træning midt på dagen, for til gengæld at åbne computeren på et andet tidspunkt, ligesom du har mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra. Vi kalder det #workfromanywhere. Vi er forpligtet over for hinanden og vores kunder, og derfor stoler vi på, at du også anerkender den betydelige værdi af at møde ind på vores fysiske kontor i løbet af ugen.

Velkommen hjem

Hos Delegate bliver du mødt med nærvær og kvalitet på alle niveauer, og vi tager os tid til at hjælpe hinanden og gør os umage for, at både kunder og kollegaer føler sig hjemme. Her kan du udvikle dig i et stærkt fællesskab, hvor du får faglig sparring med dygtige kollegaer, som har lige så høje standarder for løsninger som dig. Samarbejdet med vores kunder er kendetegnet ved gode og afslappede relationer med en åben dialog, hvor kundens team er trygge ved at fortælle dig om behov og udfordringer, fordi de ved, at du sætter en ære i at løse dem.




Nysgerrig?

Du må meget gerne booke et uforpligtende og uformelt kaffemøde med Julie Lindvald Thorsen her, hvis du vil høre mere eller har spørgsmål, inden du søger.

Send din ansøgning ved at klikke på ’Ansøg’ her på siden og følg anvisningerne. Vedhæft dit CV og relevante bilag. Tiltrædelse er snarest muligt, og ansøgninger behandles løbende.

Show more

Title: Information System Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints.

As pioneer and leading company in the field of robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare’s hardest challenges and advance what is possible.

Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere—we strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves.

Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture—our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real-world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential.

Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let’s advance the world of minimally invasive care.

Job Description

Primary Function of Position:

Our digital solutions provide technology to enable easier capturing, archiving, live streaming and sharing of clinical video and other data around diagnostic and therapeutic procedures, while also allowing for a complete integration with electronic medical records (EMR) and picture archival and communications (PACS) systems.

We are seeking a highly motivated technical expert to install and support our digital products and to ensure service agreements and warranty obligations are fulfilled to the highest satisfaction. This person shall thrive to exceed customer expectations and maintain customer satisfaction at the highest possible level. The position will be located in the Nordics (remote setup), with a focus on Nordic countries, but will also serve any other markets as per current needs.

Roles And Responsibilities


Performs remote server installation as well as server, network and services configurations.
Performs physical system installations, when needed (exceptional)
Installs system upgrades.
Provides technical support to customers and other Intuitive employees.
Performs maintenance inspections as required to ensure system meets performance specifications.
Troubleshoots and repairs Intuitive products and associated equipment failures.
Maintains accurate configurations of installed base.
Supports tradeshow activity.
Maintains up-to-date documentation, which include but not limited to; Field Activity Reports, Return Material Authorizations, etc.
Provides excellent customer support by timely addressing reported issues.
Provides feedback to improve processes and efficiencies.
Is the advanced technical go-to person with regards to Intuitive’s digital solutions.
Creates and validates architectural, technical, and functional design of the system


Qualifications

Required Knowledge, Skills and Experience

Minimum


7-10 years of field service experience with medical systems preferred.
Proven track record of troubleshooting medical software systems.
Good written and oral communication skills – English and Danish or Swedish.
Windows Operating System and server system administrator.
Professional installation and wiring of PC hardware in multiple configurations (wall, boom, mobile cart).
Proven administrative and record keeping skills.
Strong analysis, troubleshooting and debugging skills.
Ability to work independent and purposeful from remote.
Effective self-management with moderate supervision.


Preferred


Hardware and Software installation and configuration.
Healthcare and Medical system installation.
LDAP configuration and troubleshooting.
SQL system administrator and troubleshooting.
Good knowledge of core IT technologies (e.g., network systems, operating systems, databases, access controls, IT operations, etc.).


Additional Notes And Physical Requirements


Ability to work from remote.
Able to enter surgical and other patient care areas.
Ability to travel up to 25%. Some short notice travel required.
Able to lift 50 lbs.


Additional Information

Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws.

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.

Shift: Day

Travel: 25% of the time
Show more

  • LDAP configuration and troubleshooting.
  • SQL system administrator and troubleshooting.
  • Good knowledge of core IT technologies (e.g., network systems, operating systems, databases, access controls, IT operations, etc.).

Additional Notes And Physical Requirements

  • Ability to work from remote.
  • Able to enter surgical and other patient care areas.
  • Ability to travel up to 25%. Some short notice travel required.
  • Able to lift 50 lbs.

Additional Information

Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws.

We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.

Shift: Day

Travel: 25% of the time

Title: Open Source Data Platform Specialist
Description:
Job Description

What You’ll Do:


Guide customers already using or looking to adopt open source technologies by showcasing and directing on best practices.
Accelerate customer opportunities with new and existing customers through technical presentations, workshops, solution assistance, or hands-on support.
Research and evaluate emerging and upcoming open source technologies to drive continuous improvement and build your knowledge base.
Collaborate directly with product management to steer features based on customers’ inputs and requirements.
Create compelling assets encompassing external publications and internal documentation, focusing on the open source technologies.
Deliver innovation workshops with customers to shape the future of a customer using the latest open source technologies embedded in Oracle Cloud.



Career Level - IC4

Responsibilities

Required Skills/Experience

What You’ll Bring:


5+ years of Solution Engineering experience with a Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Ability to engage with Customers and Internal Stakeholders to have strategic conversations around designing and using open source technologies in Oracle Cloud.
Experience with cloud technologies (OCI, AWS, Azure, GCP, etc)
Experience with open source databases, like PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch, OpenSearch, Redis, Valkey, or NoSQL.
Experience with building and deploying data processing or streaming pipelines, using technologies like Apache Spark, Apache Kafka, MQTT, etc.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to solve sophisticated technical issues in cloud-based environments, effective communication skills, collaboration across teams, and conveying technical concepts to non-technical key stakeholders.
Proven ability to quickly learn new technical domains and innovative mindset.
Industry understanding coming from real life working experience with customers.
Passion for technology and innovation, including market trends like data lakehouse, and cloud native development, hybrid and multi cloud, data science, AI/ML, vector database, ...
Comfortable with ambiguity and time spent outside of comfort zone acquiring new skills.
Excellent written, oral and visual communication skills, both with technical stakeholders and with C-Levels.



A career at Oracle is defined by you. We give you the freedom—and the skills—to write your own success story. Whatever avenue you go down, you’ll gain priceless learning experiences and be supported to do your best work.

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English & local language.

Roles open across EMEA, focusing on Nordics.

About Us

As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.

We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.

Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.

We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.

Disclaimer:

Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.


Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

Title: Back End Developer - 50-60K DKK - Hybrid
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Backend Node Engineer – Copenhagen – 50,000 – 60,000 DKK per month







We’ve partnered with a truly exciting tech business in Copenhagen, as they look to grow their software engineering team this year!




The company definitely fall under the ‘tech for good’ umbrella – as they help businesses and consumers to make the transition into using electric vehicles. Because of the complexity of their industry, they have a variety of products on offer to their users.




They currently have a headcount of approximately 120 – with 45 of those being in the technology team! The goal this year is to increase the team by another 8-10 people, following the successful launch of a new platform.




You’ll be working on a hybrid model in their stylish Copenhagen HQ. Most of the team do three days per week in the office, but you can do anywhere between 2-5 depending on what works best for you!




The role




Due to the amount of greenfield work & new feature development that will be happening this year they are looking to add an experienced developer to the team. This is a pure backend role so you will be utilizing Node.




The team you will be joining handles some of the most complex parts of the business’ technology, so you’ll need to be comfortable handling large-scale systems and taking ownership of features end to end when needed.




The process

Introductory call with Talent team
Call with hiring manager
Short coding challenge & meeting to review
In-person meeting to chat with the Founder & members of your new team.

On offer is up to 60,000 DKK per month plus incredibly strong pension, discretionary bonus, private healthcare and over 30 days of vacation per year!




Would you be interested in discussing this role with me?

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
For DI - Dansk Industri søger vi en Lead Data Engineer




Om stillingen




DI har en ambitiøs digital strategi, der skal bringe dem tættere på medlemmerne, understøtte vækst og sikre effektiv kommunikation og samarbejde på tværs. Som en del af dette og for at styrke Data & Automations Teamet søger DI en Lead Data Engineer.




Som Lead Data Engineer vil du være med til at opbygge en moderne dataplatform i DI. Du får mulighed for at være med i alle faser – fra analyse, design og udvikling til test, implementering og den måske vigtigste fase, forankringen i hverdagen. Du sætter den faglige retning ift. data engineering/dimensionel modellering, og viser at teori kan omsættes til praksis. Du kan skabe overblik på tværs, og ”tænker stort, men starter småt” med øje for, at få data ud at leve i forretningen ved at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter.




Afdelingen har ansvaret for dataprocessering og dataløsninger og er godt i gang med at opbygge en dataplatform på Microsoft Azure stacken – startende med et datavarehus og en række analytiske løsninger. Afdelingen har til ansvar at få teknologierne til at tale sammen ved at automatisere og strømline datapipelines.




Du får en nøglerolle, hvor du er med til at sætte retningen i afdelingen, som er Center of Excellence i forhold til dataplatformen. Du samarbejder tæt med forretningen om at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter gennem bl.a. selvbetjeningsløsninger. I den forbindelse vil du til dagligt være i tæt dialog med forretningen, hvor du også vil agere sparringspartner og indgå i dialog ift. opsætning af integration af data fra forskellige kildesystemer.




Derudover vil dit ansvarsområder bl.a være at:

Være drivende i at opbygge en moderne og mangfoldig dataplatform i DI.
Sætte den faglige retning ift. data engineering/dimensionel modellering, og viser at teori kan omsættes til praksis.
Skabe overblik på tværs, og ”tænker stort, men starter småt” med øje for, at få data ud at leve i forretningen ved at levere værdiskabende data og indsigter.
Du får en nøglerolle, hvor du er med til at sætte retningen i forhold til dataplatformen







Af arbejdsopgaver kan bl.a. nævnes:

Udarbejde tekniske løsningsforslag, såvel som at estimere opgaver og effektivt kommunikere det til forretningen
Designe, udvikle og implementere dataløsninger, primært til data warehouset
Designe, udvikle og vedligeholde dataplatformen og data pipelines
Bidrage til at udvikle en langsigtet strategi for dataplatformen
Integrere data fra en række kilder, og opbygning af datamodeller
Bidrage til tekniske og forretningsmæssige afklaringer af løsninger
Deltage i udviklings- og projektopgaver i forbindelse med optimering af processer og systemer på tværs af DI.




Om dig

Den ideelle kandidat brænder for data og udvikling og tør udfordre status quo og flirte med cloud teknologi og data arkitektur. Du har fire til otte års erfaring fra en lignende stilling, evt. fra et konsulenthus eller en brancheorganisation, hvor du har haft hands-on erfaring med opbygning af data løsninger. Du har en relevant akademisk baggrund formentlig fra CBS, KU eller ITU med særlig fokus på data. Du er serviceorienteret, hjælpsom og kan være bindeled mellem forretningen og it-specialister. Vi ser gerne at du er fagligt nysgerrig i forhold til nye tendenser og udviklingen inden for datavidenskab, herunder data services i Azure. Derudover arbejder du struktureret og selvstændigt med et analytisk mindset og en metodisk tilgang.




Vi ser gerne at du besidder følgende kvalifikationer:

Ekspert i ETL processen, SQL programmering og datamart modellering iflg. Kimball
Solid erfaring med agil udvikling, gerne med afsæt i Git platformen
Gode kommunikationsevner på både dansk og engelsk




Det er en fordel, men ikke et krav, hvis du også har erfaring med:

T-SQL og SQL Server automation rammeværk generelt set
Analytiske applikationer, gerne Microsoft Power BI
Microsoft Azure dataplatform (Infrastruktur)
Azure data factory




Derudover er du en person, der tager ansvar for at kvaliteten, af det der leveres, er høj. Du er god til at sætte dig ind i komplekse og fagligt tunge opgaver. Du er resultatorienteret og har stor handlekraft. Det er også vigtigt, at du er vedholdende, også når det kommer til at udvikle dig selv fagligt og personligt, da teamet har stort fokus på det gode kollegaskab, samt at være gode samarbejdspartnere for hele huset. Det er altså vigtigt, at du er i stand til at danne dig en helhedsforståelse af hele DI. Endelig er du en person som har både hjerte og hjerne med på job og er enig med teamet i, at et godt socialt arbejdsmiljø er en nødvendig del af det at gå på arbejde.




Interesseret?

Så klik på linket herunder med det samme. Tiltrædelse er hurtigst muligt, og vi behandler kandidater løbende. Rekrutteringen faciliteres af vores rekrutteringspartner Kold+Partners. Har du spørgsmål eller brug for mere viden, er du velkommen til at kontakte Peter Kold (2989 0903).

Show more
