Title: Analytics Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Unlock the Future of Sustainable Energy with Data Analytics!

We are currently undergoing an exciting carve-out process, rebuilding our entire data infrastructure along with associated data products. We operate exclusively on cloud-based solutions and implement everything in Microsoft Fabric, adhering to best practice data platforms.




Our Ambition: Ignite a Data-Driven Revolution

Our grand vision? To supercharge CM Biomass with data! We're not just talking about fancy reports for the higher-ups; we're democratizing data to enhance transparency, accessibility, and data-driven insights across the entire organization.




Your Responsibilities:

As our new Analytics Engineer, you're not just part of the team – you're the cornerstone of CM Biomass's data-driven future. You will be working closely with the business to understand their needs and enable their visions with data solutions.

Here's what awaits you:

You will develop and document our Lakehous, the backbone of our data solution.
You will develop and implement data models and utilize cloud-based technologies.
Alongside the rest of the team, you will assist the business with ad-hoc analyses and continuous data insights.

Your impact matters! Here are our success criteria:

Ensure data reaches the right hands at the right time.
Engineer our infrastructure to be as scalable as a rocket, ready for our meteoric growth.




The Ideal Candidate:

We envision the ideal candidate to possess a technical educational background. Additionally, you should have at least a couple of years of experience and preferably have worked in an international company, gaining an understanding of diverse professional tasks and national cultures. Proficiency in MS SQL, Python and a deep understanding of Power BI are essential. It's also a plus if you are skilled in Azure Data Factory, ,and other exciting Azure applications.




It will considered a plus, if you have one or more of the following certifications:

PL-300 Power BI Data Analyst Associate
DP-203 Azure Data Engineer Associate
DP-600: Implementing Analytics Solutions Using Microsoft Fabric




On a personal level, we're looking for a candidate who thrives on creating structures and efficient processes, works in a planned and organized manner, and enjoys tackling diverse tasks within a dynamic, international, and entrepreneurial culture.




Join Us for an Exciting Opportunity!

Joining our team means immersing yourself in a growth company with a vibrant and unique culture. Our flat hierarchy, swift decision-making processes, and calculated risk-taking foster an exciting and enjoyable work environment with a strong sense of community and accountability. We value our traditions, from savoring delicious freshly baked goods from Halima to wearing shorts in the summer. Our renowned Friday bar is a hit among employees. We offer you substantial autonomy to shape your role and pave your path for growth and development. Located in the exclusive and inspiring surroundings of Klubiensvej in Nordhavn, Copenhagen, you will find yourself in an ideal setting to thrive both personally and professionally. Our corporate language is English.




If you are curious to learn more about this opportunity or, even better, ready to apply, please follow the application link provided below. If you have any questions, you are more than welcome to reach out to August Godballe, Data Architect at + 45 73 83 19 27 .

We look forward to hearing from you!




Please be advised that response times for applications may be extended due to the summer holiday period.




About CM Biomass

CM Biomass is the largest independent trader of wood pellets and the 3rd largest producer/trader, employing more than 226 dedicated professionals in 12 countries. We work with a variety of clients across several markets, trading around 3.3 million tons of industrial or premium-grade wood pellets per year, striving to decarbonize power and heat production.

CM Biomass has its roots in the family-owned Copenhagen Merchants Group, which still remains a minority owner. CM Biomass's majority owner is United Shipping & Trading Company (USTC), represented in 40 countries across various sectors, including oil & energy, shipping & logistics, risk management, car activities, IT, sustainable energy, and environment & recycling.

Title: Back End Developer
Description:
Backend Developer - Construction Industry




Our client is currently expanding their team within backend development to accelerate development of a new innovative platform for the construction industry. The solution covers visualization, automation solutions and system integration for the construction industry.




As a backend developer you will be part of a cross functional team consisting of highly skilled

developers and engineers within software development, civil engineering and data analytics. It is a chance to be part of a skilled team with high ambitions to develop a cloud solution and create a successful international company.




Our client are a company with high ambitions, both in terms of growth and positive impact on the world around us and encourage their developers to be the same.




They are looking for a passionate software engineer who enjoys building innovative applications using modern technologies, and with the ability to understand 3D-modelling software used in the construction industry. It will include both DevOps and Backend development on the existing

development stack including Node JS and React JS, running on AWS.




Tech Stack




• Node JS

• DB-PostgreSQL

• Core Java

• General AWS platform

• General Infrastructure

• React JS

• Elastic Search

• Web services Administration




This role is based in north of Copenhagen in Søborg, please apply if you are interested 🚀

Title: Consulting Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

Job Description

Visa Consulting and Analytics (VCA) drives tangible, impactful and financial results for Visa’s network clients, including issuers, acquirers, merchants, processors, and Fintechs.

Drawing on our expertise in strategy consulting, data analytics, brand management, marketing, operational and macroeconomics, we solve the most strategic problems for our clients.

The Nordics and Baltics consulting practice within VCA provides consulting and analytics services for Visa clients in the region. We apply our deep expertise in the payments industry to provide solutions that assist clients with their key business priorities to drive growth and improve profitability.

Our team is seeking a Consulting Analyst based in Copenhagen to join our Core- Consulting practice. This role involves contributing to the development and implementation of high-impact projects for our clients in the N&B region.

As a key team member, you will be part of our exciting growth journey. We are rapidly expanding our consulting business and offer you the platform to build and deploy your business and entrepreneurial proficiencies within the framework of a large global organization.

You will have the opportunity to make significant contributions, grow your skills, and shape your career in a vibrant and fast-paced environment.

This is an incredibly thrilling time to join us.

Typical VCA projects may include:

Strategy:


Formulate growth strategies tailored to each client, paving the way for their successful entry into new markets or customer segments
Design comprehensive payment and ecosystem strategies, providing clients with the tools to understand and respond to evolving economic, regulatory, and market forces and assist in developing data and other strategic partnerships


Performance Improvement:


Implement customer lifecycle benchmarking: Compare the performance of client portfolios against industry benchmarks to pinpoint and implement areas of improvement across the entire customer lifecycle
Enhance customer retention: Optimize loyalty programs and implement proactive strategies to retain customers
Risk optimization: Improve processes related to underwriting, line management, fraud detection, authorizations, and collections
Digital optimization: Enhance targeting strategies, streamline customer acquisition processes, improve digital experience, and bolster capabilities


Hands-on project execution:


Implement strategies, enhance operational processes, and/or execute projects on behalf of clients in collaboration with our VCA Managed Services


What We Expect Of You, Day To Day.


Play an integral role on a team of experienced professionals in delivering consulting services to Visa clients
Lead the gathering and analysis of information, support the formulation and testing of hypotheses to address our client’s business problems
Produce insights, analyses and recommendations to improve client performance, boost growth, drive understanding of client issues and provide strategic guidance for client priorities across the verticals and segments
Support the development of frameworks, approaches, solutions and recommendations
Support and develop client-specific presentations which address executive needs and deliver presentations to clients and internal Visa partners
Successfully collaborate with peers in other functional areas (marketing, sales, risk, innovation) to execute projects and deliver value for our clients
Monitor industry trends and contribute to the development of thought leadership whitepapers


This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 set days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.

Qualifications


1-3 years of prior experience in a management consulting firm or a similar role within Banks/Financial Institutions/Payment Ecosystem Entities
You have graduated from a highly regarded university or business school
Must possess exceptional analytical skills, with the ability to leverage data in crafting clear, compelling messages to clients and the business
Adept at addressing business challenges through data-driven methodologies and proficiency in cutting-edge analytic and business intelligence tool
Self-driven, results-focused individual capable of supporting multiple projects simultaneously
Strong sense of responsibility, ready to take charge from the first day
Outstanding communication, narrative crafting, and presentation skills
Inquisitive mindset, with a keen interest in staying current with digital trends and applications, especially in the payment ecosystem
While proficiency in Danish (or Swedish/Norwegian) is not a hard requirement, it would be a very valuable addition to your application.


Additional Information

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst Opportunity

Surrey Based

Hybrid Working – x2 days on site/week




We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to support various business units in enhancing commercial opportunities and drive insights.




The Data Analyst will be responsible for creating and overseeing commercial analyses across multiple workstreams to aid in business decision-making, proposal development, and growth strategies for both internal and external stakeholders.




Key responsibilities include:




Providing analytical support to influence and execute strategic initiatives.
Building and maintaining strong relationships with key stakeholders.
Managing, tracking, and reporting across projects.
Understanding and integrating various data sources.
Analyzing complex commercial data and pricing structures and summarizing findings for different audiences.
Conducting scenario modelling and delivering summaries to expedite business decisions.
Performing proactive ad-hoc financial analysis to support business decisions.
Understanding the commercial business model and integrating deals accordingly.
Monitoring and auditing team outputs for accuracy and relevance.




The ideal candidate will have:

Proven analytical skills with attention to detail, capable of deploying automation and standardization.
A proactive approach, strong commercial acumen, resilience, technical ability, and high integrity.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and excellent numeric and analytical skills.
Experience developing and working with complex spreadsheets.
Confidence in making decisions, recommendations, and advising the team.
Commercial finance experience in improving business results and adding value.
Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to present information clearly and concisely.
The ability to drive innovation and continuous improvement.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
About Inigo




We enable your ambition. We insure good people – knowledgably, fairly, and efficiently. We combine our expertise with the best of science, data, and analytics.




Inigo's aim is to create an underwriting focused insurance and reinsurance business, concentrating on limited classes. We want to combine the best data and analytics that exist and build our own capability to generate insights to drive business decisions. At the top of our agenda is to create a diverse and open culture where we foster talent and provide opportunities to build a rewarding career in a company that is vibrant and at the start of an exciting journey.

We have a culture that is inclusive, fun, and constantly strives for excellence, we describe it as ‘all in’. Our values are:




Get Smart – we ask questions, explore, learn, and continuously strive for excellence
Park the Ego – we are welcoming and open, and embrace different thinking
Share the Passion – we collaborate and communicate our expertise honestly and thoughtfully
Radical Simplicity – we are transparent, focused and actively avoid complexity in how we operate




Aim of the role




The aim of the role is to support the actuarial reserving team as well as the finance team. The candidate will work closely with the actuarial and finance teams to support various analytical tasks, including data collection, cleansing, and analysis. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI, and the ability to communicate findings effectively.




The successful candidate will do this by:




Being the data manager and extracting, treating and cleansing data in order to have accurate and complete data for the reserving and finance process
Identifying and addressing data quality issues, including correcting data errors and capturing missing business information
Automating tasks in Alteryx or Power BI
Maintaining current Alteryx and Power BI models
Identifying opportunities to streamline data processes and enhance data quality though process and model improvements
Validating and reconciling data across multiple systems and providing reports to actuaries and management
Ensuring the data tools provide appropriate, complete and accurate data
Working with IT so they are aware of changes to tools and databases that may impact corporate systems or databases
Providing data to different stakeholders (Reserving, Pricing, Capital, Finance)




In addition to the above key responsibilities, you may be required to undertake other duties from time to time as the Company may reasonably require.




To do this, we’re going to need you to bring:




Experience in data analysis for Non-Life business
Experience with dealing with large amount of data
High proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of individuals in a variety of functions (e.g. finance, claims, underwriting, actuarial, operations)
Ability to deliver results under tight deadlines
Good problem-solving abilities

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - £30K-£40K - Cumbria - Hybrid




My client is looking for a Data Analyst to work with the large and complex datasets associated with their financial comparison products. The role has a broad remit encompassing analysis, interpretation, and prediction. The Data Analyst will also bring statistical rigor to their product teams’ efforts as they continuously enhance comparison products.




Role




Dive into complex datasets and extract actionable insights, e.g.
Identify customer segments across our comparison services where no or very few quotes are provided.
Analyse the conversion funnel data to improve the click to sale conversion to make recommendations on segments that are being poorly served, and
Utilize multiway statistical techniques to identify trends and correlations.
Facilitate discussions with the wider business to gain insight into pain points, problems and opportunities where analysis could help us with these either for business or for our partners/customers.
Support AB/MVT test plans and assessing results independently.
Assist with new provider due diligence and performance issue investigations.
Use of analytics tools/applications to undertake multi factor analysis to generate robust, accurate analysis to inform decision making.
Pro-actively work with stakeholders and colleagues to find ways for continuous evolution and improvement of the use of data/insight, to ensure solutions are best in class, and that value is continually generated from the data asset.
Create clear and concise reports and visualizations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.




Skills




Proven experience as a Data Analyst, handling large datasets and performing statistical analysis.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Qlik).
Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Familiarity with Python, R or similar for data analysis.
Experience in filtering and cleaning complex datasets to provide actionable insights.
Experience working within the Financial Technology industry will be helpful.




Benefits




27 days holiday plus public holidays
Performance rated bonus
Enhanced pension
Generous private medical care
Sickness and insurance benefits
Share schemes.




If this sounds like your next role, apply today!

Title: Trainee Data Analyst
Description:
e-Careers is a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business decisions.

We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team.

We are seeking someone who may not have any prior experience, but has the hunger to start a career in data analysis.

We will provide any necessary training and support to help you do your job and build the foundational knowledge to launch a career as a data analyst.

Responsibilities:


Collect, clean, and analyse data from various sources to support business objectives
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data insights
Assist in the development and implementation of data collection systems and strategies
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights
Conduct ad-hoc analysis and present findings to stakeholders
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular data quality checks
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis



Requirements


No prior experience or qualifications required. We will provide all the training necessary
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent attention to detail and organisational skills
Ability to communicate complex data findings in a clear and concise manner
Eagerness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment



Benefits


Full training provided
Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunities for professional development and growth
Collaborative and supportive work environment
Access to cutting-edge tools and technologies

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company:

A leading company in the CBD industry is seeking a passionate and motivated Junior Data Analyst to join their innovative team in Central London. This organisation is dedicated to delivering comprehensive CBD products and services, emphasizing sustainable, natural, and organic solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Market Research: Conduct thorough market research to gather and analyze data on industry trends, consumer behavior, and competitive landscape.
Data Analytics: Perform data collection, cleansing, and analysis to generate actionable insights. Utilize statistical tools and software to interpret complex data sets.
Direct Reporting: Act as a direct report to senior team members, providing accurate and timely data analysis and insights.
Presentation Work: Prepare and deliver clear, concise, and compelling presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Business, or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, R, Python, or SQL.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Detail-oriented with strong organisational skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a hybrid work environment.
Prior experience in market research or data analytics is a plus.




This position would suit someone who is a recent graduate from a top-tier university with an environmental data background. To apply for this position, please apply with your most up to date CV.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Passionate about data - Azure - Python - Data - Vision - Drive




***This role requires 3 days in the office in Bournemouth - close to the train station***




Your new company

Join a dynamic and innovative company that values data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement. Our team is dedicated to leveraging data to drive commercial value and business growth. We foster a collaborative and supportive environment where your skills and expertise will be highly valued.




Your new role

As a Data Analyst, you will be at the forefront of transforming large and complex data sets into actionable insights that drive business decisions. You will work directly with C-Level executives to define and execute a portfolio of data analysis projects. Your responsibilities will include:




- Gathering and preparing data from multiple sources.

- Building analytical solutions to identify growth opportunities.

- Interpreting and analysing data to deliver business improvement opportunities.

- Leveraging third-party data to enhance analytical outputs.

- Communicating findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




What you'll need to succeed

- Strong analytical skills to interpret large datasets and identify trends.

- Experience in designing data analysis solutions that drive commercial value.

- Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel.

- Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau.

- Ability to work effectively in a team and lead in a diverse technical environment.

- Strong communication and collaboration skills.

- A proactive approach to learning new technologies.

- Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to maintain strong working relationships with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.




What you'll get in return

- A competitive salary and benefits package.

- Opportunities for professional development and continuous learning.

- A supportive and collaborative work environment.

- The chance to work on impactful projects that drive business growth.

- The opportunity to act as a professional ambassador for the company at external events, conferences, and presentations.




If you are passionate about data analysis and eager to make a significant impact, we would love to hear from you! Apply now to join our team and take your career to the next level.




What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.




If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion about your career.

Your new role

As a Data Analyst, you will be at the forefront of transforming large and complex data sets into actionable insights that drive business decisions. You will work directly with C-Level executives to define and execute a portfolio of data analysis projects. Your responsibilities will include:


- Gathering and preparing data from multiple sources.

- Building analytical solutions to identify growth opportunities.

- Interpreting and analysing data to deliver business improvement opportunities.

- Leveraging third-party data to enhance analytical outputs.

- Communicating findings clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.


What you'll need to succeed

- Strong analytical skills to interpret large datasets and identify trends.

- Experience in designing data analysis solutions that drive commercial value.

- Proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel.

- Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau.

- Ability to work effectively in a team and lead in a diverse technical environment.

- Strong communication and collaboration skills.

- A proactive approach to learning new technologies.

- Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to maintain strong working relationships with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.


What you'll get in return

- A competitive salary and benefits package.

- Opportunities for professional development and continuous learning.

- A supportive and collaborative work environment.

- The chance to work on impactful projects that drive business growth.

- The opportunity to act as a professional ambassador for the company at external events, conferences, and presentations.


If you are passionate about data analysis and eager to make a significant impact, we would love to hear from you! Apply now to join our team and take your career to the next level.


What you need to do now

If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.


If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion about your career.

Title: Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
Bumble Inc. is seeking a skilled Product Analyst to collaborate with senior business stakeholders and product managers in providing data-driven insights across all stages of the product development lifecycle. This role will focus on experimentation, statistical analysis, data modelling and visualisation, as well as in-depth product analyses. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys a fast-paced environment and has a passion for contributing to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections.

Key Accountabilities


Be an analytical thought partner to a cross-functional team of engineers, designers and product managers. This will include providing analytical support across all areas of the product development lifecycle, from ideation and broad product strategy to analytics deep dives and experimentation.
You will lead experimentation across an area of the product. You will design and execute multi-step experiments to understand the impact of a feature or product change on user behaviour and business KPIs. You will interpret experiment results and translate them into actionable recommendations for a non-technical audience.
You will own event tracking for one area of the app, understanding which events are critical to track user behaviour.
You will create self-serve dashboards to ensure stakeholders have access to real-time insights.
You will provide actionable insights on product strategy and recommendations to your stakeholders, automating decision-making where applicable and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
You will develop deep knowledge of the product domain, becoming an authority on its characteristics, drivers, and subsystems.
You will contribute to data quality related to the domain, proactively working with Data and Analytics Eng. and other teams to improve data collection and modelling.
You will create an environment of utilising data for planning and execution, always keeping in mind alternative and creative solutions to performance measurement across a variety of product initiatives.


Required Experience & Skills


Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
You will have experience using SQL and python to solve data science, statistical and analytics problems.
I prefer experience working in similar dating, social, or gaming tech product industries or in financial services or high-data-volume industries.
You have experience working in a highly collaborative cross functional space and translating technical insights for a non-technical audience.
You have experience setting up experimentation, statistical measurement, and data collection in the product domain.
Strong experience creating data visualisations and self serve tools for a product forced audience.
You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our product strategy.
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
3+ years experience in product analytics analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.


About You


Strong believer in Bumble Inc.’s brand vision and values
Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator. A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes.
Understands and can demonstrate a data science skillset and use advanced analytical tools and visualisations to produce impact in an organisation.
Deep commercial understanding and a proven ability to create impact through the power of customer-led insights.
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping cross functional teams to define the questions that help support product development.
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
Strong experience with python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
Strong governance and data quality mindset.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
TryHackMe is the fastest-growing online cyber security training platform. Our mission is to make learning and teaching cyber security easier by providing gamified security exercises and challenges. Having only been around for handful of years, we've grown to more than 3 million community members and our growth isn't slowing down! 🥷




The Role

We’re looking for a data analyst to join our growing data team. As the second member of our data team, you’ll be at the forefront of building an analytics culture across TryHackMe. You’ll play a pivotal role in delivering impactful insights, building scalable analytics solutions and helping build out the foundational pillars of our data function. Responsibilities will include:

Collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business objectives and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Analyse company data to uncover trends, opportunities and areas for improvement.
Developing and maintaining data models to support analytics.
Create interactive dashboards and visualisations to effectively communicate insights.
Leverage product usage data to inform product strategies.




Skills & Requirements

1-2 years of experience working as a data analyst.
Strong SQL skills are essential.
Demonstrable experience using visualisation tools, preferably Tableau.
Knowledge of data warehousing and modelling is a nice to have.
Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
Start-up experience preferred.




Benefits & Perks

💸 Salary - up to £40,000 GBP (depending on experience)

🚣 100% Remote - In a fully digital world, work from anywhere you want!

🕒 Flexi Time - Choose your own hours as long as you have at least 4 hours of overlap with the UK timezone (from 8am - 6pm)

💻 Tools - a dedicated work laptop + any accessories you need to do your best work.

👕 Swag Pack - start your TryHackMe journey with a branded swag bundle!

💪 Personal Development - £2,500 training budget to acquire certifications, and more.

⛱️ Company Retreat - an annual company retreat, fully paid for by us!

🧡 Health Insurance - if you're in a country that doesn't have public health care.

🍼 Enhanced Maternity & Paternity- an enhanced package on top of statutory requirements.

💸 401k / Pension - TryHackMe makes it easy to save money for your retirement.




Our Hiring Process:

Stage One: Intro call with hiring manager (30 mins)

Stage Two: Technical Take-Home Task

Stage Three: Interview with hiring manager (1 hour)

Stage Four: Final call with a Co-Founder (20 mins)

Title: Data Analyst (Sage)
Description:
Job Role: Data Analyst (Sage)




Salary: £40,000 – £50,000 DOE + Benefits




Location: Birmingham




Working Pattern: Hybrid




Summary:

We are looking for a Data Analyst with Sage experience and a passion for managing and migrating data to join a Birmingham-based company on a hybrid basis. This is a great chance to join a leading company within the IT consulting and services space where your career development will be greatly supported.




The Company:

The company are an IT consultancy who work with firms within the financial sector. They have over 50 years of experience providing innovative data solutions to enhance the decision-making processes of their high-profile clients.




This is a company that will empower your career development in a supportive and highly dynamic environment. You’ll be assured fantastic professional growth opportunities and a means to a successful long-term career.




The Role:

The role has opened as the company needs a driven Data Analyst to join their team to support the migrations of clients, suppliers and employee data. Your expertise in financial data will be integral in ensuring a successful and efficient migration processes. You’ll be collaborating with the company’s clients and internal teams to understand these data requirements so we’re looking for a team-player, with great communication skills, who is ready to get stuck in!




The role is being offered as hybrid working with a minimum of one day a week in their office.




Responsibilities:

Provide support and maintenance to post-migration to ensure long-term data reliability.
Develop and maintain data transformation scripts and processes
Collaborate with clients and internal teams to ensure data integrity.
Ensure data quality by resolving any irregularities that arise during migration




Required Skills:

Sage Intacct – this is an essential requirement
A background in financial data analysis
Excel
Data Transformation Tools




Benefits:

Flexible Hybrid Working
Competitive Salary
Private Health Insurance
Bonus Schemes
An environment that will support your professional development goals




Apply Now!

If you are a Data Analyst with Sage Intacct experience and you are looking to progress with an organisation that has a fantastic approach to work in a supportive and thriving environment, then look no further – this is the role for you!




Please note unfortunately, this role does not offer sponsorship.




Referrals:

If this role isn’t right for you, do you know someone that might be interested? You could earn £1,000 of retail vouchers if you refer a successful candidate to Oscar. Email: mark.whales@oscar-tech.com to recommend someone for this role.




Interviews for this role will be held imminently. To be considered, please send your CV to me now to avoid disappointment.

Location: Birmingham




Working Pattern: Hybrid

Title: Data Specialist
Description:
Data Specialist

Hampshire

Travel Sector

£45,000-£60,000 DOE




My client are a leading provider of maritime transportation based on the South Coast. They’re a medium business who are rapidly growing, investing in new technology and constantly innovating to improve customer experience and business efficiency.




This business are looking to grow out their data capability, and this Data Specialist role is pivotal in leading that. You’ll be hands-on using Power BI, SQL, and the data warehouse/data lake setup, but you’ll also be business-facing working on how the business uses data.




This Data Specialist role will involve:




Working closely with the Infrastructure, GDPR and Security teams to integrate data-driven decisions and insights, as well as integrate the technologies
Working on how the business collaborates and manages data, including Sharepoint
You’ll be hands-on with Power BI, ETL, SQL, etc.
As the Data Specialist, you’ll be interacting with business SMEs and reporting to the IT Director, to play a pivotal role in driving data strategies and technology forwards
You may have a background as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, Data Manager, Business Intelligence Developer, Business Intelligence Analyst, Business Intelligence Manager, or other data-related positions, as long as you are business-facing and able to operate in small/solo teams
Any experience you have with AI (Artificial Intelligence) would be hugely beneficial




If you are interested in this Data Specialist role, please apply directly with a CV reflecting your skills. This role is a hybrid position based from a Portsmouth office- candidates not in a commutable distance of Portsmouth won’t be considered.




Benefits include a salary of £40,000-£60,000 dependant on experience, 33 days annual leave, discounts on ferry travel, and an excellent culture and team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Supply Chain | Hatfield | Hybrid (2 days office)

Please note this is a Junior-Mid Level Data Analyst position with the Hiring Manager ideally looking for 2-5 years commercial experience

About Us

Ocado Technology is putting the world’s retailers online using the cloud, robotics, AI, and IoT. We develop the innovative software and systems that power Ocado.com, the world’s largest online-only grocery retailer as well as the global ‘Ocado Smart Platform’. With everything from websites to fully autonomous warehouses that we design in-house, our employees need to be specialists in a wide range of technologies to help drive our business. We champion a value-led culture to get our teams working at their very best and to help create a collaborative working environment that our people love.

About The Role

The Data Analyst - Supply Chain has the responsibility of developing and improving tools & reports whilst ensuring the appropriate level of support is available for all projects, and the tools are updated to ensure accuracy and relevance.

Working closely with Demand Planners, Supply Planners, Logistics and Tech Operations you will:


Provide analytical support; daily, weekly and monthly key performance indicator reporting
Provide insights for Supply Chain teams and the senior leadership teams which lead towards a positive impact to the business performance
Coordinate root cause analysis cases that arise from these insights


What We’re Looking For


Working knowledge of SQL
Ability to work with Data Visualisation Tools (Tableau / Looker preferred)
Proficient with Microsoft Office and/or Google Suite
Strong communication skills (able to present in a variety of formats and styles to a range of technical / non-technical stakeholders)
Commercially aware and consider cost impacts on decisions and proposals


We’d also love to hear from you if you have;


Knowledge of VBA and Google script
Knowledge of Oracle Fusion and/or Oracle Apex
Knowledge of Python.


What Do I Get In Return


30 Day ‘work from anywhere’ policy +
Remote working for the month of August
25 days annual leave, rising to 27 days after 5 years service (plus optional holiday purchase)
Pension scheme (various options available including employer contribution matching up to 7%)
Private Medical Insurance
22 weeks paid maternity leave and 6 weeks paid paternity leave (once relevant service requirements complete)
Train Ticket loan (interest-free)
Cycle to Work Scheme
Opportunity to participate in Share save and Buy as You Earn share schemes
15% discount on Ocado.com and free delivery for all employees
Income Protection(can be up to 50% of salary for 3 years) and Life Assurance(3 x annual salary)


About Ocado Group

When our journey started, we were all about changing the way people shop for groceries. 20 years later, we’re developing our own ground breaking technology, opening multiple sites at an accelerating rate and engaging in exciting new business partnerships around the world!

Transforming an industry also means transforming the way we do business. As we continually develop new technologies and customer propositions, we’re looking for the Everyday Pioneers to lead us into the next stage of our evolution: enhancing our capabilities, inspiring our teams and developing new ways of working.

Changing the way the world shops, for good.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Senior Data Analyst




Location: Derby (Hybrid)




Salary: Up to £50K (DOE)




Data analysis experience in the housing sector is a non negotiable for this role.




As the Senior Data Analyst, you will be essential in measuring, evaluating, analysing, interpreting, and benchmarking the organisation's performance. Your role will involve supporting strategic decision-making through framing key questions and delivering recommendations, forecasts, and models based on thorough analysis and valuable insights.




Key Responsibilities:




Conducting data analysis to uncover trends and insights, offering actionable recommendations for enhancing operational efficiency and service quality.
Collaborating with senior stakeholders to formulate hypotheses and questions aligned with business goals, using statistical methods to validate assumptions and support evidence-based decision-making.
Overseeing monthly Key Performance Indicator (KPI) scorecard production for leadership and quarterly reporting for the Board and Customer Committee, providing trend analysis and insightful commentary.
Managing the relationship with House mark, interpreting data for senior leaders, and coordinating an annual feedback session.
Performing annual and ad-hoc benchmarking against sector benchmarks to identify best practices and areas for improvement.
Analysing performance data to identify strengths and improvement opportunities, providing constructive challenges to senior colleagues.
Coordinating regulatory submissions and supporting automation efforts in performance management and reporting, including transitioning reporting to PowerBI.
Continuously refining KPI frameworks and improving reporting methods across the organisation.




Key Skills:




Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Familiarity with basic statistical methods like median and quartile.
Effective communicator, capable of presenting complex ideas to non-technical audiences.
Robust problem-solving capabilities.
Experience in conducting exploratory data analysis across diverse datasets.
Competence in SQL and Power BI for data manipulation and visualisation.




Experience:




5 years of data analysis experience in the housing sector.
Track record of driving continuous improvement and achieving measurable outcomes.
Experience in developing and overseeing performance measurement frameworks and KPIs.




If you are interested in this role and have the relevant experience and qualifications, please apply immediately for consideration and interview. For further details on the role, please contact us.

  • Familiarity with basic statistical methods like median and quartile.
  • Effective communicator, capable of presenting complex ideas to non-technical audiences.
  • Robust problem-solving capabilities.
  • Experience in conducting exploratory data analysis across diverse datasets.
  • Competence in SQL and Power BI for data manipulation and visualisation.


Experience:


  • 5 years of data analysis experience in the housing sector.
  • Track record of driving continuous improvement and achieving measurable outcomes.
  • Experience in developing and overseeing performance measurement frameworks and KPIs.


If you are interested in this role and have the relevant experience and qualifications, please apply immediately for consideration and interview. For further details on the role, please contact us.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Location-Stockport , UK

This role is ideal for professionals or graduates who enjoy working with large data sets, have an interest in statistical modelling and would relish the opportunity to be involved in the data reporting process for both internal and external clients, as well as contributing to the thought leadership and application of data driven solutions to wider business needs.

Responsibilities:


Uncover great insights that inform our clients decision making through regular and bespoke reporting. The Data Analyst identifies the key brand and market trends through interrogation and the manipulation of complex data sets
Work independently and as part of a team to create blueprints for new methodologies and drive improvement to existing products delivering a first-class service to the broader business
Working closely with experienced Senior Analysts, you will rapidly develop your technical skills to ultimately play a crucial role in the delivery of outstanding market intelligence
Collaborate closely with different teams in a culture that celebrates the exchange of ideas and encourages innovation. You will work with internal stakeholders, consulting on analytical projects and presenting solutions to teams with varying degrees of technical knowledge
Keep up to date with industry news and understand the company’s goal to provide expert data and creative insight. You will play a pivotal role developing new services, helping to shape the next stage of growth for the company


Requirements:


Educated to degree level in a STEM subject (or equivalent)
Ideally some experience in SQL and/or Python coding languages
Comfortable with basic statistical methods such as Measures of Central Tendency, Correlation, Logistic Regression, Non-linear Regression and Hypothesis Testing
Confident mining data from various data sources, interpreting it and communicating findings numerically and in written form in layman’s terms
Interest in data visualisation and storytelling with data, knowledge and experience in Excel and Power BI is desirable but not essential
Passionate about building strong relationships with internal stakeholders
Has a love of the out of home industry and is curious about the products sold in bars and restaurants as well as the people who visit them
Intelligent, ambitious, and highly motivated individual
Enjoys working autonomously and is a strong team player
Confident and articulate. Will be required to speak, present, and contribute to groups within the company. May occasionally be required to discuss projects with clients


Must have an analytical and investigative mind, with a strong ability and desire to learn.

We Offer:


Generous holiday entitlement and holiday buy-back scheme
Enhanced maternity, adoption, and shared parental leave policy
Bravo! Peer to peer recognition platform
AXA Private medical healthcare
Fidelity Pension scheme
We operate a hybrid approach with the opportunity to work from home


Additional Information

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide. Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Business Data & Reporting Analyst
Description:
Our client, a leading independent academic and professional publisher, is seeking a Business Data and Reporting Analyst to support their Hybrid and Open Access journals’ editorial function. This role involves developing and delivering analytics and reporting solutions that transform data into actionable insights.




Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Key responsibilities




Implement, manage, maintain, and develop existing reports and dashboards across the Journals Editorial function
Quickly acquire a good understanding of the critical data sources regarding availability, integrity, complexity and ownership to ensure reports and analyses are complete, consistent and understood
Troubleshoot, resolve and drive improvement to existing reporting and data visualisations, with a keen interest in automation
Effectively prioritise and manage multiple data-focused requests through delivery with a high degree of accuracy and on time completion
Help evaluate acquisitions of new third-party data sources and assist in implementing and using these sources to achieve business benefits for Editorial







Business Data & Reporting Analyst: Skills/experience




A proven record of collaborative work with other highly skilled data analysts and data coordinators to produce and present clear reports and data visualisations that are user-friendly and accessible to stakeholders
Data analyst experience and applied critical thinking and analytical skills to solve real-world business problems
Knowledge of the journal publishing industry and an understanding of Open Access business models
Advanced experience with Microsoft Office 365 apps (including advanced skills in Excel and proficiency in Power BI, along with DAX, Power Query, and Excel Power Pivot), SQL, and API integrations
Good relationship management skills and confidence in dealing with people at all levels of the business




A competitive salary, bonus, and benefits package is offered.




Referral Scheme - Telfer Partners offer a referral reward if we fill this vacancy with someone you recommend. You can send us contact details of anyone you would like to recommend to enquiries@telferpartners.com.




Equality Policy - Telfer Partners is committed to upholding a professional and impartial recruitment process. Our Equal Opportunities policy ensures that all job applicants and employees are treated fairly and equally, regardless of their gender, sexual orientation, marital status, race, nationality, religion, age, disability, or union membership status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Durham | Utilities | £35,000 - £43,000




Peaple Talent have partnered exclusively with a leading Utilities provider, who are at the forefront of providing innovative and sustainable utility solutions. They are committed to optimizing resource management, ensuring high-quality service, and driving impactful data-driven decisions. Join the dynamic team and contribute to their mission of making utilities smarter and more efficient.




Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join the team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, with specific experience using Power BI to drive business insights and decision-making. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing complex data sets, creating visually compelling reports, and providing actionable insights to support our strategic goals.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Gather requirements, design solutions and work with stakeholders on their delivery.
Act as business partner for Data Analytics to other teams as required.
Provide regular project/progress reports and resource plans.




Experience needed:

SQL, Advanced Excel.
Advanced skills using Power BI,
Knowledge of SSRS or other BI/Reporting tools.
Organised and reliable with attention to detail.
Bonus points for experience in Development of data models and warehouses.




What We Offer:

💰Salary: £35,000-£43,000

📈Opportunities for professional growth and development.

🤝A collaborative and innovative work environment.

♻️The chance to make a meaningful impact in the utilities industry.

🪙10% matched Pension

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Entity:

Customers & Products

Job Family Group:

HSSE Group

Job Description:

We are looking for a highly skilled and detail-orientated Health and Safety Data Analyst to join our Mobility and Convenience, Health, Safety, Environment and Carbon team. Responsible for analysing and interpreting health and safety data to identify trends, patterns, and potential risks in our UK Retail business. The HSE&C Data Analyst will work closely with the UK HSE&C team to review data in order to improve workplace and contractor safety and reduce incidents.

Key Accountabilities

Collect, organise and analyse health and safety data from various sources.
Identify trends, patterns, and potential risks in the data and communicate findings to the HSE&C team.
Develop and maintain databases to track and monitor health and safety performance metrics
Provide visible safety leadership in accordance with bp safety leadership principles, lifesaving rules and process safety fundamentals to model desired safety behaviours
Support with recording relevant learning in shared learning systems, incorporate into local activities, specifications/ practices/ procedures and raise high priority lessons
Support performance management through implementation, measurement, and analysis of relevant KPI’s to drive continuous improvement
Prepare reports and presentations on health and safety data analysis for management and regulatory requirements.
Opportunity to expand your role from supporting UK business to include Europe, starting in 2025
Influence and shape our safety reporting processes to enhance overall effectiveness.


Essential Experience and Job Requirements:


Demonstrable experience in data analysis, preferably in a health and safety or related field.
Self-motivated and performance driven
Good communication skills with experience, and a proven ability, to converse and influence across multiple levels
Proficiency with Power Bi or other business intelligence / analysis tools and software such as Excel, Tableau and SQL.
Ability to analyse raw data/input, strong analytical skills & developing recommendations.


Desirable Criteria:


Knowledge of working with Agile principles and tools.
Knowledge of health and safety regulations advantageous


Why join our team?

At bp, we offer a great workplace with inclusive culture, work-life balance, learning opportunities, and benefits like insurance and medical care. We value diversity and strive for an inclusive environment where everyone is respected. We provide flexible work options and modern office spaces to support our employees' needs.

Reinvent your career as you help our business meet the challenges of the future.

Apply now!

Travel Requirement

Up to 10% travel should be expected with this role

Relocation Assistance:

This role is not eligible for relocation

Remote Type:

This position is a hybrid of office/remote working

Skills:

HSSE auditing and self-verification, Industry knowledge and advocacy, OMS and bp requirements, Process safety culture, Process Safety Management, Risk Management, Safety Leadership

Legal Disclaimer:

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, socioeconomic status, neurodiversity/neurocognitive functioning, veteran status or disability status. Individuals with disabilities may request a reasonable accommodation related to bp’s recruiting process (e.g., accessing the job application, completing required assessments, participating in telephone screenings or interviews, etc.). If you would like to request an accommodation related to the recruitment process, please contact us to request accommodations.

If you are selected for a position and depending upon your role, your employment may be contingent upon adherence to local policy. This may include pre-placement drug screening, medical review of physical fitness for the role, and background checks.

Data Product Analyst

£60,000

London (1 or 2 days p/w)




I've partnered with a business intelligence business that work in the Legal sector. They are looking for a Data Analyst, who will sit within the Product function, to help drive their digital and web analytics capability.




The business are working on multiple projects to build out new Data products, this person will play a critical role in the build of these products and the efficiency of the overall Data capability.




This role has a Google suite focus (BigQuery, GA and Google Tag Manager). GTM and tagging experience is vital to succeed in this role.

Be the SME for Digital Analytics in the Product and Data team

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Description:
Data Governance Analyst – SQL / Purview / ETL




* Sponsorship is not available with this position *




Role – Data Governance Analyst

Salary – £35k - £40k

Location – Warrington (Hybrid)




An award winning energy firm are looking to add a Data Governance Analyst to join their innovative and expanding data team. There goal is to support homes and businesses across the UK transition to net zero.




In this position, you will be supporting the Head of Data Governance with the creation and implementation of the data governance strategy. You’ll be working closely with a range of key stakeholders across the business to implement the best data practice and strategy.




The position is offering a basic salary up to £40,000 depending on experience as well as, 25-day annual leave, a generous pension and much more;

Management Bonus
Ride to work scheme
Brand discounts
Buy and sell holiday scheme




The Successful Data Governance Analyst will have:

3 years experience in Data governance or data management
Strong skills with SQL and databases
Excellent stakeholder management skills
Project Management skills and experience
Knowledge and understanding of business analysis, principles, processes, and techniques.
The ability to work in a fast paced environment




Desirable

Knowledge or understanding of Microsoft Purview
A Bachelors or Master’s Degree in Computer Science or a relevant field




Again, with a salary on offer of between £35,000 - £40,000 depending on experience, this position would be ideal for a Data Governance or Data Management specialist. If this is you, please apply to join this exciting energy company and play a key part in their data journey.




To find out more, please email alex.richardson@talentinternational.co.uk for review.

Title: Data Analyst - SQL and Python
Description:
At Radius, we provide best in class fleet and connectivity solutions to businesses of all sizes.




Our mission is to help businesses adapt to the future by building solutions for a more sustainable, connected future.




Our comprehensive portfolio of solutions includes fuel cards, telematics, telecoms, insurance, vehicle leasing, EV charging, business energy, and expense management.




We are proud to have over 400,000 customers worldwide, over 50 offices across 5 continents, and over 2,800 talented Radius colleagues.




Technology and data underpin everything we do and have a big part to play in our ongoing growth plans.




This is where you come in…




The role…




We’re looking for a Data Analyst with SQL and Python experience to join our Group Data Science team.




The Data Science team’s main goal is to provide valuable insights to positively impact key business challenges like improving sales conversion, customer churn, etc. These insights are delivered by developing predictive models and analytical solutions while collaborating with business stakeholders.




The role will report to the Head of Group Data Science and will be primarily located at the group’s head office in Crewe.




Your responsibilities will include…




Work with the data scientists and other data analysts to provide insights that aid strategic decision-making for sales, marketing, and account management functions.
Analyse customer and prospect touchpoints on Salesforce CRM and 1st party tools to identify trends that could help tackle key business challenges.
Help deliver targeted Sales and Marketing campaign data on Salesforce CRM through CRUD operations via API.
Work on a diverse range of initiatives for all of Radius’ business units - Fuel, Telematics, Telecoms, Insurance, Vehicle solutions, EV, and Energy.




What do we expect of you?




Minimum 1 year commercial experience working with Python and SQL for Data Analysis.
Passion for driving business impact through data and insights.
Good knowledge of Statistics and Applied Mathematics
Ability to communicate findings through presentations and dashboards.
Good organisation and time-management skills




What can you expect of us?




Your impact on Radius will be rewarded with the opportunity to develop and progress your career in many directions.




You’ll also have access to our competitive reward and benefits package, which includes:




Performance-related bonus scheme
Pension
Life assurance
Employee fuel card scheme
Electric Vehicle scheme
Employee assistance programme
Wellness and healthcare assistance via ‘Help@Hand’ by Unum
‘Cycle to work’ scheme
Free breakfast daily in the office




And of course, you will be part of a modern purpose-built space in Crewe that will provide you with an outstanding working environment complete with onsite gym, café, games areas, and more!




Still curious?




If you feel we are a good match for each other, you can apply online now!




If you’d like to understand more about the role or life at Radius before applying, then please contact our talent team via talent@radius.com.




Radius is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to welcome people regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation or socioeconomic background.







Note to Recruitment Agencies

We do not accept unsolicited agency CVs or candidate profiles. Any unsolicited CV or profile received by Radius will be treated as a gift and not eligible for an agency fee. PSL agencies should only send CVs if authorised to do so by the Radius talent team.

Show more
HTML:
At Radius, we provide best in class fleet and connectivity solutions to businesses of all sizes.


Our mission is to help businesses adapt to the future by building solutions for a more sustainable, connected future.


Our comprehensive portfolio of solutions includes fuel cards, telematics, telecoms, insurance, vehicle leasing, EV charging, business energy, and expense management.


We are proud to have over 400,000 customers worldwide, over 50 offices across 5 continents, and over 2,800 talented Radius colleagues.


Technology and data underpin everything we do and have a big part to play in our ongoing growth plans.


This is where you come in…


The role…


We’re looking for a Data Analyst with SQL and Python experience to join our Group Data Science team.


The Data Science team’s main goal is to provide valuable insights to positively impact key business challenges like improving sales conversion, customer churn, etc. These insights are delivered by developing predictive models and analytical solutions while collaborating with business stakeholders.


The role will report to the Head of Group Data Science and will be primarily located at the group’s head office in Crewe.


Your responsibilities will include…


  • Work with the data scientists and other data analysts to provide insights that aid strategic decision-making for sales, marketing, and account management functions.
  • Analyse customer and prospect touchpoints on Salesforce CRM and 1st party tools to identify trends that could help tackle key business challenges.
  • Help deliver targeted Sales and Marketing campaign data on Salesforce CRM through CRUD operations via API.
  • Work on a diverse range of initiatives for all of Radius’ business units - Fuel, Telematics, Telecoms, Insurance, Vehicle solutions, EV, and Energy.


What do we expect of you?


  • Minimum 1 year commercial experience working with Python and SQL for Data Analysis.
  • Passion for driving business impact through data and insights.
  • Good knowledge of Statistics and Applied Mathematics
  • Ability to communicate findings through presentations and dashboards.
  • Good organisation and time-management skills


What can you expect of us?


Your impact on Radius will be rewarded with the opportunity to develop and progress your career in many directions.


You’ll also have access to our competitive reward and benefits package, which includes:


  • Performance-related bonus scheme
  • Pension
  • Life assurance
  • Employee fuel card scheme
  • Electric Vehicle scheme
  • Employee assistance programme
  • Wellness and healthcare assistance via ‘Help@Hand’ by Unum
  • ‘Cycle to work’ scheme
  • Free breakfast daily in the office


And of course, you will be part of a modern purpose-built space in Crewe that will provide you with an outstanding working environment complete with onsite gym, café, games areas, and more!


Still curious?


If you feel we are a good match for each other, you can apply online now!


If you’d like to understand more about the role or life at Radius before applying, then please contact our talent team via talent@radius.com.


Radius is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to welcome people regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation or socioeconomic background.



Note to Recruitment Agencies

We do not accept unsolicited agency CVs or candidate profiles. Any unsolicited CV or profile received by Radius will be treated as a gift and not eligible for an agency fee. PSL agencies should only send CVs if authorised to do so by the Radius talent team.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

CENTRAL LONDON - HYBRID

£40,000 - £50,000




THE COMPANY

A subscription-based international provider of business information within the legal market, allowing law firms to make business-transforming decisions through data and analytics findings.




THE ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Data Analyst, your day to day will involve:

Data Mining - extract insights, organize information effectively, and apply statistical analysis to identify actionable trends in market and law firm performance.
Predictive Data Models - Develop predictive data models and collaborate with teams to address key business questions using data.
Dashboarding in Power BI - maintain and develop reports in Power BI for internal stakeholder use, which will be used to provide actionable insights to customers.
Data Pipelining - work with the central data team to ensure data is smoothly and effectively being collected, stored and processed throughout.




YOUR EXPERIENCE

To be successful in this Data Analyst role, you will require:

Strong dashboarding experience in Power BI, with an understanding of DAX measures and data modelling.
A strong understanding of data mining, ETL pipelines and processes.
Experience working as a sole contributor is preferred.




THE BENEFITS

A salary of up to £50,000 in your first year.
Flexible working.
Other benefits.




HOW TO APPLY

If interested in this role, please submit your CV via the Apply link on this page.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The ideal candidate will use their passion for analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics, enabling the to improve the product. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.

Responsibilities

Compile and analyze data related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion




Qualifications




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience
3+ years' Data Analysis experience
Proficient in SQL, BI tools (any flavour), Python nice to have

Title: Data Business Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Data Business Analyst

Remote working

6-month contract (view to extending)

£550-600/day Outside IR35

About the Role:

We are working with a global education business who is seeking a highly motivated Data Business Analyst during a significant period of change. You will play a pivotal role in validating the proposed data architecture to ensure it fits in with current business and data processes in NetSuite and BigCommerce platforms.

Responsibilities:

Analyse and document existing data pipelines, data merging processes, and configurations.
Champion the creation of golden data sources to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Review and make recommendations on data architecture to allow seamless integration with NetSuite and BigCommerce.
Collaborate with stakeholders across departments to understand data needs and requirements.
Help the business understand how to operationalise the new data programme by integrating it with existing data processes without disruption.
Clearly communicate the if/where the limitations are but able to provide objective validation to senior management

Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Data Business Analyst/Engineer with a strong understanding of data pipelines and data management is required.
Experience on data programmes involving ERP and E-commerce platforms is a must have
Knowledge of NetSuite functionalities and data structures is highly favourable.
Experience building and implementing data models for complex systems.
Strong communication and collaboration abilities are crucial.
The ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment with a focus on continuous improvement is preferred.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Senior Data Analyst

Location: Fully Remote

IR35: Outside

Duration: 3 – 6 Months with a possibility to extend

Clearance: BPSS

Overview: We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team and work with a prominent government client. The successful candidate will have a robust background in data ETL tools, SQL Server tools, and Business Intelligence (BI) reporting tools. They will play a crucial role in analysing data, creating reports, and supporting data-driven decision-making processes.

It would be highly beneficial if you have experience of working with a central government organisation and taking them through the journey from Alpha to Beta

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and manage data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes using tools such as Matillion, Snowflake, Apache NiFi, AWS Glue, and Azure Data Box.
Utilise legacy SQL Server tools including SSRS, SSMS, and SSIS to support ongoing data management and reporting needs.
Develop, maintain, and enhance PowerBI reports and dashboards for Management Information (MI) reporting.
Extract and manipulate data from ServiceNow backend systems for analysis and reporting purposes.
Generate and maintain billing reports using Crystal Reports.
Work with custom tools such as eFin, built on JBoss and SQL database tables, to support financial reporting and analysis.
Support file transfer and automated document management processes using Omnidocs.
Ensure proper data handling and integration when introducing plug-ins in M365.




If this role is of interest to yourself and you would like to learn more about the position, please submit your CV for further review.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are...

Verra Mobility is a global leader in smart mobility. We develop technology-enabled solutions that help the world move safely and easily. We are fostering the development of safe cities, working with police departments and municipalities to install over 4,000 red-light, speed, and school bus stop arm safety cameras across North America. We are also creating smart roadways, serving the world's largest commercial fleets and rental car companies to manage tolling transactions and violations for over 8.5 million vehicles. And we are a leading provider of connected systems, processing nearly 165 million transactions each year across 50+ individual tolling authorities.

Position Overview

The Associate Data Analyst role is to design and develop reporting both basic and advanced, data visualizations including dashboards, graphs/charts, etc . This role will be involved in all aspects of the development life-cycle, including data collection, data processing and transformation, testing and product delivery and support. Working closely with the software engineering team for both cameras and back-office processing, this role will be critical to future product offerings aligned not only to photo-enforcement but also intelligent motorway management.

Essential Responsibilities


Define the technology vision and strategy for big data analysis for traffic management solutions.
Work with a multi-disciplinary team of engineers, and designers to deliver an end-to-end product: from the idea phase, through collecting and assessing the data, exploring algorithmic approaches, developing, testing, validating and integrating the algorithm in the production environment.
Develop machine learning models encompassing data from traffic management sensors and other data sources
Experience working with large data sets, experience working with distributed computing a plus (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Apache Spark, etc.)
Develop advanced data reporting capabilities and data visualizations; combining multiple disparate data sources to gain detailed insights into photo enforcement programs.
Provide architectural expertise, direction, and assistance to Business Analysts and software development teams.
Conduct research on emerging technologies in support of systems development efforts and recommend technologies that will increase cost effectiveness and systems flexibility.
Interface and coordinate tasks with internal and external technical resources. Collaborate with Project Managers, vendors and IT stakeholders to provision estimates and develop overall implementation plan for delivery of analytics initiatives.


Qualifications 


Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Science
Proficiency in scripting/programming languages a bonus (Python, R, Java, JavaScript, Scala, etc.)
SQL skills essential (MSSQL, Postgres, BigQuery, Redshift)


Verra Mobility Values

An ideal candidate for this role naturally works in alignment with the Verra Mobility Core Values:


Own It. We focus on high performance and drive toward breakthrough outcomes. Our employees ensure accountability, optimize and align work, focus on the customer, and cultivate innovation.
Do What’s Right. We champion integrity and good character. Our team members model ethical behavior, demonstrate good judgment and are courageous.
Lead with Grace. We express humility and compassion, and we are authentic and candid. Our employees demonstrate self-awareness, care for others, instill trust, and communicate effectively.
Win Together. We believe in growing and inspiring people together. We seek people who collaborate, value differences, think and act globally, foster an engaging work environment, and recognize and develop others.


With your explicit consent which you provided as part of the application process, we will retain candidate personal data solely for the business purpose for which it was collected. In no event will we retain such data more than two (2) years following the closure of the recruitment process relating to the role for which you applied or in the event other related job opportunities arise within the company. Verra Mobility Applicant Privacy Notice

Verra Mobility is an Equal Opportunity Employer, qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.
