Title: People Insights Analyst
Description:
If you read a job ad and it speaks about ‘great culture’, ‘growth’ and being ‘innovative’ then it would be the same as 99% of other roles being advertised. Well, the role we’re talking about in this ad genuinely has all of the aforementioned, with the addition of being for a company that has a mature working environment and being a role with clear growth potential.




Cogito was formed in 2014 with the single vision to help hiring organisations to take greater control of people strategies. We help businesses, from some of best known employers to start ups, to discover and engage with external talent which will transform their business as well as enhancing their HR practices, reward programmes and improve their employee experience. As we’ve grown, an opportunity has appeared for someone with an interest in how data and evidence can be used to shape business strategies.




The role….




As a People Insights Analyst, you will operate within an agile and fast-paced team, contributing to a variety of projects that span multiple sectors. Your role will involve the detailed analysis of people-related data, the creation of comprehensive reports, and the development of insightful dashboards in PowerBi and Qualtrics. You will have a significant degree of autonomy, allowing you to influence project direction and outcomes directly.




What your time at work will look like…




Routine Reporting and Insights:
Generate and distribute monthly Labour Market reports.
Maintain & develop RPO Programme reporting
Compile and analyse Talent Map reports
Ensure adherence to process reporting and manage the candidate experience feedback cycle.
Prepare and present comprehensive insights packs.




Project-Based Tasks:
Design and deliver surveys tailored to client needs.
Create and maintain dashboards that effectively visualise insights.
Conduct both qualitative and quantitative analyses to inform strategic decisions for clients.
Perform remuneration benchmarking and detailed labour market analysis.
Produce insightful and detailed reports, acting as the subject matter expert in data analysis for client interactions.
Ad-Hoc Research and Analysis
Provide desk-based research as required.
Support client-facing discussions with expert data analysis and insights.




Essential Skills and Qualifications:




Proficiency in Power BI: Demonstrated experience in utilising Power BI for data visualisation and analysis.
Advanced Excel Skills: Expertise in Excel, including pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, and macros.
Experience in People Data Analysis: Proven ability to analyse and interpret people-related data effectively.
Survey Design and Analysis: Experience in designing, administering, and analysing surveys to extract valuable insights.




Preferred Experience:




SQL Knowledge: Ability to write and execute SQL queries for data extraction and analysis.
Educational Background: A degree in a numerate discipline such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Psychology or other social sciences with a statistical element.
Advanced Degrees: An MSc or higher in a people-related field, such as HR Management, Occupational Psychology, or Business.
HR Experience: Previous experience in a Human Resources related role.




What we offer….




Competitive Salary
Hybrid Working, approx 2 days in office per week on average from our Bristol office
Company Pension
25 days annual leave plus bank holiday + your birthday off
Training & Professional Development
Clear pathways for career progression




You will be able to work independently but also love being with your colleagues, this means you will thrive in our hybrid working model as you split your time each week between home and working alongside our amazing team in Central Bristol.




The Recruitment Process…




We try to be as transparent as possible about the selection process for this role. Applications will be reviewed by the 5th August, with a view to conducting face-to-face interviews in the week beginning 12th August or before. If you’re un-successful, we’ll let you know.

Title: Data Insight Analyst
Description:
Data Insight Analyst

Up to £45,000 depending on experience, plus benefits

Hybrid working: Onsite near Portsmouth 2 days per week




We are looking a passionate and innovative Data Insight Analyst to join the Data & Analytics Team for a well-established business on the South Coast.




This well-regarded team are growing, so we are looking for a driven and analytically minded Data Analyst who has good experience working with a variety of data analytics products, techniques, and tooling.




In this role you will maintain a range of existing data analytics products as well as work on a variety of small and large projects to develop new products, taking responsibility for delivery of work packages across the full project lifecycle. You will work with the team and wider business to expand the self-serve products on offer, and champion existing products to drive adoption.




This is a great opportunity to grow your career with a forward-thinking business who put data at the heart of what they do.




As such we are looking for someone who is analytically minded and who loves researching and troubleshooting problems to come up with new solutions.




Essential Skills & Expertise




Degree level education in a relevant subject (e.g. data analytics, mathematics, statistics, computer science) or demonstrable and credible work experience in data and analytics to that level. Strong SQL programming skills and some experience of programming in Python
Expert level Excel skills. Using a range of tools and techniques for report building, ad-hoc queries and data mining.
Data analysis, profiling, cleaning, transforming, enrichment, and modelling.
Working with diverse and complex data sets and a range of different data types
Data transformation and data preparation using tooling such as Tableau Prep, Alteryx, or Python.
Developing interactive dashboards that are simple and intuitive using modern data visualisation tools – strong Tableau experience would be a plus
Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) practises relevant to Data Analytics products




Nice to have:

Working with cloud-based data warehouse, data lake architectures and cloud technologies relevant to Data Analytics
Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies such as Machine Learning (ML)




If this is you, apply today! We look forward to talking to you about this great new role.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Benefits

Data Analyst - Hybrid£40,000 plus up to 20% bonus and excellent benefitsThis award-winning and growing software company are looking for Data Analyst with experience working in a data team. This Data role will work with large and complex datasets associated with their products.The Data Analyst will deal with analysis, interpretation and prediction of the data associated with their products. Must work autonomously to manage workload and meet agreed deadlines.
Must be able to resolve complex issues and shape solutions.

Description:
BI Analyst

Southampton - Hybrid working – office 3 days per week

£35,000 - £50,000




A fantastic opportunity for a BI Analyst to join a successful business in a time of change.

The successful BI Analyst will join a skilled multi-disciplined team in the evolution and enhancement of the company services.




At present, a wealth of the data / analytics is outsourced; however my client is looking to bring some of this back in house.

PowerBI
SQL – complex queries
Advanced Excel




Desirables:

ERP Support




Applicants must live within a commutable distance of the Southampton office and have the right to work in the UK.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:




We have an exciting new opportunity for someone to join CFC’s Platform Division - a new and growing global business unit. They are a dynamic and hugely aspiring team focused on executing our digital distribution strategy, and are the cornerstone to us achieving our digital trading ambitions.




This role offers an exciting opportunity to leverage data analysis skills to drive improvements and optimisations within our digital distribution channels. If you are a motivated individual with a passion for data analysis and digital optimisation, we encourage you to apply and join our dynamic team.




About the Role:




As a Data Analyst focusing on digital distribution, your primary responsibility will be to examine data at both the partner and product levels, focusing on key performance metrics such as hit rates, conversion rates, decline rates, enquiry volumes, and other relevant KPIs.




Analyse digital distribution data, including partner and product performance metrics, to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Track key metrics regularly and provide insights into performance trends over time, enabling informed decision-making by the digital development manager and other stakeholders.
Surface data trends and patterns to the digital relationship managers and the wider business to leverage and optimise partner and product performance.
Develop visually appealing dashboards and reports to effectively communicate key findings and performance metrics to stakeholders across the organisation.




About you:




You will have prior experience in data analysis or a related field within insurance, with a focus on digital distribution data being a plus. You will be proficient in data analysis tools and software, such as SQL or Qlik with very strong analytical and numeracy skills. Meticulous attention to detail is critical to this role, with a focus on accuracy and precision in data analysis and reporting.




You will have experience working with all levels of stakeholders and be comfortable talking through data. We are looking for someone with a collaborative attitude with the ability to work effectively in a team environment, collaborating with colleagues from various departments.




Core Values:




Love what you do:

We show up each day ready to take on the world. Our passion and intensity set us apart and makes the difference to our colleagues, customers, brokers and carriers.




Challenge everything:

We’re never afraid to question the way that things are done and we constantly challenge ourselves and others to makes things better.




Have fun, be good:

Insurance is a serious business, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. We make it fun to work at CFC, we welcome all viewpoints, and we treat everyone how we would expect to be treated.

Title: Data Engineer/ Analyst
Description:
Our client is an award winning, specialist insurance solution provider who support businesses and individuals with their commercial insurance and employee benefit solutions. They are a leading organisation with a rich history of strategic acquisitions which has allowed them to grow from a small start-up to a large chartered independent broker now operating with 10 locations across the country and fast approaching 1000 employees. As part of their growth they are now looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join their London office.




The ideal candidate for this role will be experienced in migrating data from various sources into the Acturis Platform. You will help to seamlessly integrate newly acquired businesses into our clients operating model, ensuring efficiency throughout.




Skills & Experience:

Holds a bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related fields.
Proven experience with Insurance Broking Systems data migration (ideally Acturis).
Proficiency in SQL and data manipulation languages.
Experience with ETL tools.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with a focus on practical solutions.
Excellent communication and people skills for conveying data concepts to diverse audiences.
Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and build strong relationships.
Agile/ Scrum/ Kanban experience.




Benefits:

Competitive base salary (DOE). To be discussed on intro call.
Hybrid work place (2 days in office).
Up to 27 days annual leave (plus bank holidays) with the option to purchase additional holiday days.
Wellbeing support. Physical and mental health support + Medical Insurance, Life Assurance, Income Protection and Employee Assistance programme.
Employee referral scheme.




If you would like to learn more about this opportunity, please apply with your CV and I will be in touch to discuss with you further.

Title: Global Product Master Data Analyst
Description:
McDermott Laboratories Limited

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.

We do so via:

Access – Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;

Leadership – Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and

Partnership – Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.

Our global portfolio includes best-in-class, iconic brand-name products as well as global key brands; generics, including branded and complex generics; and other offerings across a wide range of therapeutic areas. We are committed to helping create healthier communities worldwide through education, outreach and better access to treatment.

For those driven to live their lives with purpose, Viatris helps employees realise their full potential by creating a collaborative culture that fosters courage and resilience. Viatris is more than just a place to work. This is a place to make a difference in the world.

The Role & What You Will Be Doing

The Global Product Master Data Analyst will be responsible for managing key aspects the company’s product master data on a global scale. This position is part of the Global Master Data Management Team which is responsible for creating, maintaining, and publishing standardized, high quality master data in order to support global operations, global processes and global reporting initiatives.

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here’s how the Global Product Master Data Analyst role will make an impact:


Creation and maintenance of product and material master data according to established standards.
Work collaboratively with other functions (e.g. Global Quality, Regulatory, Finance, Sourcing, affiliates & manufacturing sites) to ensure master data related issues are resolved and objectives are met.
Contribute to the definition of Viatris-wide data definitions, terminology, data quality and business rules.
Manage relationships with key stakeholders, ensuring requirements are identified and met in a timely fashion.
Serve as the “go-to” person for all matters related to product master data.
Write, revise, and verify standard operating procedures and other documentation for process design & evaluation, training, etc.
Analyze and solve master data problems and provide support for efficient daily operations.
Support various SAP implementation projects by representing the Global Product Master Data function to ensure continued alignment between global and local master data teams. Support project teams during data cleansing and migration activities.
Provide training to other business units on Global Product Master Data processes and concepts.
Support system development activities by assisting in requirements gathering, the drafting of test scripts, test execution, etc.
Lead data cleansing and harmonization activities and develop effective data cleansing rules and procedures in coordination with internal stakeholders.
Perform data quality audits of product and material master data to ensure it remains current and adheres to data quality standards.
Identify and manage the escalation and resolution of data quality issues, as needed.



About Your Skills & Experience

For this role, we’re looking for a candidate who has an effective combination of the following qualifications, skills and experiences:


3+ years of experience in a master data management related role, preferably managing product or material master data.
SAP experience preferred but experience with other ERP systems and/or master data systems is acceptable.
Highly detail oriented and the ability to consistently achieve high levels of accuracy.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, a must.
Strong analytical skills, in terms of both data and process management.
High level of proficiency with MS Office programs.
Experience with SQL is a plus, but not required.
Ability to cope with ambiguity and implement structure and clarity.
Proactive and able to follow through on tasks.
Strong organizational skills a must.
Ability to act in a complex and rapidly changing environment.
Ability to work well with people at various levels and with different cultural backgrounds.
Bachelor level degree in relevant discipline or equivalent experience.
Strong customer service skills and the ability to work collaboratively with others.



At Viatris, we are dedicated to building a truly diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t fully align with every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

Benefits At Viatris

At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others. Some of our benefits include the following on top of a competitive salary:


Excellent career progression opportunities
Work-life balance initiatives
Bonus scheme
Health insurance
Pension



Diversity & Inclusion at Viatris

At Viatris, diversity and inclusion are essential to our mission. The diversity we foster in all aspects of our business can be one of our greatest strengths in redefining healthcare not as it is, but as it should be. If you would like to know more about what diversity, equity and inclusion means to us, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/Careers/Diversity-and-Inclusion

Sustainability at Viatris

Corporate social responsibility is fundamental to the Viatris mission. We work to advance responsible and sustainable operations and leverage our collective expertise to empower people to live healthier at every stage of life, recognizing that our actions affect the stakeholders and communities we serve. To learn more about our efforts, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/about-us/corporate-responsibility

At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Zenith is an award winning, market leader in the fleet industry with an exciting and dynamic customer portfolio. We are the UK's leading independent vehicle leasing, outsourcing and fleet management provider and have been providing the UK with intelligent vehicle solutions for over 30 years. Our people are our greatest asset, and when it comes to them our main aim is for everyone to feel valued in the same way that we value our customers.

When it comes to technology, standing still isn't an option, it is at the heart of our strategy. Our latest investment cycle, a £25 million four-year transformation programme, will ensure we meet ever-evolving service delivery expectations by developing the best online experience for all customers.

Currently, we are seeking a self-motivated Data Engineer to join our Data & Analytics team. We are looking for someone who is a data-driven problem solver, enthusiastic about technology and teamwork. You excel in fast-paced settings and enjoy learning and developing alongside industry experts.

Data plays a crucial role in setting us apart in the market, offering significant potential for guiding business decisions and enhancing customer value. Our Technology team is constructing a new Data platform capability as part of a broader re-platforming of our leasing business. This presents an excellent opportunity to oversee the entire data process throughout the data life cycle. Collaborating with a Technology Stack, you will work with Visual studio, SSMS, SSIS, SSRS, PowerBI and other parts of the engineering stack, whilst collaborating with engineers, testers, and business professionals in an Agile environment.

What's The Role


Designing, developing, testing, and implementing robust data applications powered by cutting-edge technologies like Azure DataFactory, PowerBI, Qlikview, and SSRS.
Collaborating closely with product owners and stakeholders, translating business needs into impactful technical solutions.
Continuous learning and development: Gain invaluable mentorship from senior developers and participate in a dynamic, cross-functional team environment.
Ownership and accountability: Drive the design and implementation of clean, efficient, and effective data solutions that meet the highest standards.
Upskilling opportunities: We invest in your growth, providing ongoing learning and development initiatives to help you reach your full potential.
Real-world impact: Contribute directly to Zenith's mission of revolutionising the automotive industry through intelligent data solutions.


What Can You Offer


Data Visualization: Strong skills in Power BI and other visualization tools.
SQL Expertise: Proficient in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Data Modeling: Knowledge of data modeling and database design principles.
Report Building: Experience in creating data visualisations and reports.
Statistical Analysis: Familiarity with statistical analysis and data exploration techniques.
Data Integration: Experience in implementing data integration and ensuring data quality.
Communication: Excellent communication skills for working with diverse stakeholders.
Cloud Platforms: Familiarity with cloud platforms like Azure, AWS, or GCP.


Personal Traits

Salary & Benefits


Salary up to £60,000 per annum
Annual bonus
24 days annual leave & 1 day birthday leave plus the option to buy more
Private Medical Cover
Life Insurance
Breakdown cover
Dental and Health cash plans
Critical Illness cover
Tech Scheme
Car Sacrifice scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Season ticket loans
Perks at Work – save money on everyday essentials with access to a shopping discounts site
Support for your wellbeing – we provide a range of tools and resources to support you to look after your own health, whether this be mental, physical, financial or social and help you get back on track. This includes access to and onsite GP & Masseuse, Employee Assistance Programme, Pensions advice, Funded HRT Treatment, and Mental Health First Aiders
Sports and Social club - Company/Team activities
Agile working
Free parking
Onsite bistro
Equality, Diversity & Inclusion networks


SOUND LIKE THE RIGHT OPPORTUNITY FOR YOU? APPLY NOW!

We want to positively encourage differences in Zenith and believe it is critical to our success as a company. Zenith is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace that seeks to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We therefore encourage applications from all genders, races, religions, ages and sexual orientations, as well as parents, veterans, people living with disabilities, and any other groups that could bring diverse perspectives to our business

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About UK Infrastructure Bank

We are the new, government-owned policy bank - launched in June 2021 - providing £22bn of infrastructure finance and partnering with the private sector and local government to finance a green industrial revolution and drive growth across the United Kingdom.




We are looking for skilled and results oriented individuals who are motivated to help us build the UKIB into an industry-leading institution.




Job Purpose

A Subject Matter Expert (SME) responsible for designing and building Data Integration Services, Power Apps, Power Agent and Microsoft Dynamics 365 across the Bank.




Core Role Accountabilities

Provide Microsoft Dynamics 365, Power Apps, Power Agent, and Data Integration Services expertise to all UKIB business areas, so that the Bank optimises its investment in its chosen toolset and solutions are delivered in accordance with industry best practice.
Design and develop new solutions in line with the business requirements, integrating with or leveraging the surrounding Microsoft technologies including Fabric, Power Platform, Teams, Dataverse, Dynamics 365, SharePoint, and 3rd party SaaS applications.
Maintain and support the existing Microsoft Dynamics 365, Power Apps, Power Agent, integrations and information databases associated with them.
Share knowledge, experience and documentation across the development and wider IT teams.
Provide a Microsoft Dynamics 365, Power Apps, Power Agent, Fabric, and Integration escalation and decision point for Operational and Change delivery teams ensuring risks, issues and decisions are fully evaluated, captured, and addressed.
Ensure all applications and solutions have supporting process guides and technical documentation to a high standard.
Provide training and training material for Business users and user education.
Provide SME knowledge at design assurance and technical authority bodies to ensure design groups are considering all delivery options therefore avoiding unnecessary manual processes, duplication, and additional costs.
Research and evaluate emerging technologies and methodologies to identify potential solutions and prepare proposals for modified or replacement processes and systems to ensure the Bank utilising the most effective technologies available at the appropriate cost.
Develop effective working relationships with key internal stakeholders and external suppliers.




Knowledge, Skill and Experience Requirements

Technical

Essential

Expertise in Microsoft Fabric’s unified analytics platform, including familiarity with OneLake, Fabric Spark.
Expert level experience of full suite of Azure Integration Services products, including Logic Apps, Azure Data Factory, API Manager.
Demonstrable ability to translate operational requirements into robust process-oriented solutions.
Excellent problem problem-solving skills and ability to articulate solutions in a business context.
Ability to influence stakeholders and technical resources to assist them in delivering business outcomes.
Ability to analyse technical, operational and resource requirements and build out development plans accordingly.
Experience of structured change delivery skills and techniques.
Strong commitment to delivering excellent service with an attention to detail.
Ability to lead and guide developers and business users in automation techniques and technologies.
Ability to provide strategic, scalable solutions to meet business requirements.
A Commitment to staying informed on latest updates and features released by Microsoft Fabric.

Desirable

Analytics accreditations.
MS Azure accreditations.
Any knowledge of Workday configuration.
Experience of Mambu SaaS cloud banking platform.
Experience of using architecture and data modelling tools, such as Bizz Design, to capture business capabilities, processes, technology components and data structures.
Experience of developing and maintaining strong 3rd party, vendor, and partner relationships.
Knowledge and understanding of the business processes associated with financial services organisations.
Understanding of broader Change Management principles, practices, and methodologies.

Commercial

Awareness of the financial services industry, markets and competitors and the associated regulatory environment.

Interpersonal

Strong communication, engagement and influencing skills.
Ability to lead on technical solutions and motivate the team to deliver sustained high performance.




A career with us offers a unique opportunity to make a lasting impact and work on cutting-edge technologies that will drive the UK’s future. We value diversity in our people and inclusion is at the heart of what we do.




We offer competitive benefits and unique learning opportunities from combining both private and public sector skills and experience.

Show more

We are looking for skilled and results oriented individuals who are motivated to help us build the UKIB into an industry-leading institution.

Title: Associate Data Engineer
Description:
Job Title

Associate Data Engineer

Location

Asda House

Employment Type

Full time

Contract Type

Permanent

Hours Per Week

37.5

Salary

Competitive salary plus benefits.

Category

Data Science

Closing Date

4 July 2024

Asda's Data & Analytics team is at the cutting edge of driving transformative, data-driven decisions across the organisation. We cultivate a high-performance, innovative environment where team members are challenged to push the boundaries of technology and data science. We are developing an industry leading data platform as part of the largest retail data transformation in Europe, which we will use to address some of the most complex data challenges in the industry, developing sophisticated solutions that revolutionize our business operations and elevate customer experiences. We seek the best of the bestâ€”professionals who thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic setting and are driven to deliver groundbreaking insights that propel Asdaâ€™s strategic initiatives and create lasting impact for Colleagues & Customers.

Find your role

Are you a Data Engineer with a good understanding of working with Azure, ready to elevate your career to the next level?

As a vital member of our diverse data function, you'll not only contribute to team projects but also support initiatives across the broader organisation. This role is perfect for those with a collaborative spirit and a passion for building professional networks.

Joining Asda during our digital and data evolution means you're arriving at an exhilarating time. Data and analytics are the bedrock of our transformation strategy, and you'll be positioned at the epicentre of this exciting phase!

In This Role, You Will

Build new data pipelines and optimize data flows using the Azure cloud stack.
Support Business Analysts and Data Architects with discovery and best practices.
Collaborate with various business units to understand their data needs and deliver impactful solutions.
Engage in cross-functional teamwork, fostering strong relationships within the data team and beyond.
Play a pivotal role in Asda's digital and data transformation journey, leveraging analytics to shape our future.

Let's find out about you

Solid grasp of Azure Data Services such as Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Azure Data Factory for efficient data ingestion, processing, storage, and analytics workflows.
Previous experience of programming preferably using PySpark and SparkSQL.
Experience of building, deploying, sharing, and maintaining enterprise-grade data solutions with Databricks.
Any experience building real-time data pipelines using Event-hub, storage queues and Azure stream analysis is advantageous.
Good analytical skills related to working with structured, semi-structured and unstructured datasets.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment

Work Where it Works

Our hybrid way of working gives you the choice to work where it works. This enables you to chose where you’ll be the most effective. It offers a mix of working from home and in an office environment that works best for you and your team.

You will also get an excellent benefits package including;-

Discretionary company bonus
Company pension up to 7% matched
10% colleague discount, free parking and many additional rewards.

We want all colleagues to be able to bring their best and true selves to work, every day. Simply put, we want our colleagues to be Proud to be Asda and proud to be themselves

Title: Senior Finance Analyst
Description:
At Burberry, we believe creativity opens spaces. Our purpose is to unlock the power of imagination to push boundaries and open new possibilities for our people, our customers and our communities. This is the core belief that has guided Burberry since it was founded in 1856 and is central to how we operate as a company today.   

 

We aim to provide an environment for creative minds from different backgrounds to thrive, bringing a wide range of skills and experiences to everything we do. As a purposeful, values-driven brand, we are committed to being a force for good in the world as well, creating the next generation of sustainable luxury for customers, driving industry change and championing our communities. 

JOB PURPOSE

As a Senior Finance Analyst within the Reporting and Decision Support (RDS) team at Burberry, you will be responsible for delivering improved management reporting and insights to Finance and Business leaders throughout the organisation in an efficient and effective way.

This Senior Finance Analyst role is offered on a permanent, full time basis and will be based in our Queen Street, Leeds office 2 days per week.

RESPONSIBILITIES

 

Own, maintain, and control the standard suite of management reports, referencing non-financial metrics as appropriate
Produce standard management reports, including draft first line commentary and initial explanation of variances, and distribute in a timely manner (Regions, Functions, Group & Other)
Ensure accuracy in the numbers by performing validation checks prior to sharing reports
Build strong and trustworthy relationships with senior finance stakeholders and act as a first escalation point of contact for RDS issues and ad-hoc requests
Ensure consistent high quality of service delivery by the RDS team including reporting accuracy and integrity, acting on customer feedback; assigning and prioritising ad-hoc requests / issue resolution
Lead monthly calls on performance, take meeting minutes and share actions post meeting
Interact with data owners and other BBS teams (Finance and non-Finance) to enable management reporting and analysis activities
Provide standard information and simple ad-hoc analysis and insights
Work closely with the FS&MD team to develop a deep understanding of finance source data and data hierarchies
Consult with Finance Business Partners on reporting and data needs
Drive initiatives to rationalise, standardise, and automate management reports
Maintain process documentation / Standard desk top procedures for live reports and ensure reporting library, user access and stakeholder lists are kept up to date
PERSONAL PROFILE

 

Hold a professional finance qualification (CIMA, ACCA, ACA or equivalent)
Experience in a finance role in a fast paced, global organisation
Prior usage of an ERP system desirable and experience in handling large volume of data and presenting high level insights / recommendations
Comfortable in using and understanding SAP BPC
Experience of using BPC or similar consolidation software preferable, but not essential, to perform insightful management reporting
Excellent communicator with the ability to thrive under pressure and operate effectively in a cross functional team    
Highly analytical with an impeccable attention to detail with and ability to troubleshoot and identify data issues    
Proven track record of delivering process improvements (e.g. Reporting efficiencies) in a structured and timely way
Advanced/Expert MS Excel skills
Experience in producing insightful management reporting
Power platform and/or Tableau experience is desirable but not essential

Burberry is an Equal Opportunities Employer and as such, treats all applications equally and recruits purely on the basis of skills and experience.

Show more

Title: Statistician
Description:
Statistical Data Scientist

Location - Bristol, Darlington, Fareham, Leeds, London, Newport (Gwent), Salford, Warrington.

Salary: Starting salary can range between £32,188 to £36,244 and is determined by location and the organisation you join.

Working Patterns: All our vacancies are offered as a flexible option of Full-time, Part-time, Flexible working, Job Share

Closing date: Apply before Midday on Tuesday 6th August 2024







Do you have the drive and passion to use your ability in Data Science and Statistics to make a real difference to society?

The Government Statistical Service (GSS) collects, analyses and publishes official statistics to help government, business, and the public understand the current state of the UK economy and society.







Person specification:

Have experience using open-source tools, such as Python, R and Git.
Awareness of the limitations and ethics around using data from varying sources, including open data.
Ability to write good-quality code as part of a team, to work with data. Using appropriate tools for collaboration and version control. You should understand how to ensure quality control in your code, either through review or automated tools (e.g. unit testing).
Understanding of how to design analysis to support a decision. This should include statistical techniques for modelling, hypothesis testing or time series analysis. With an understanding of model assumptions and limitations.
Good communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate complex analysis to non-specialists and contribute effectively to stakeholders.
Ability to deliver outputs to tight deadlines and overcome challenges to ensure quality business outcomes.
Able to prioritise and manage your own work and others in line with organisational objectives.







The application process requires writing a Personal Statement. Your personal statement should be no longer than 1250 words. You should use this space fully to provide evidence for each part of the Person Specification. As the criteria are scored, we would recommend that you give clear examples for each including the impact of your actions using the STAR method.

• Situation - the situation you had to deal with

• Task - the task you were given to do

• Action - the action you took

• Result - what happened as a result of your action and what you learned from the experience.




Applicants may utilise AI resources in their submissions; ensuring all information provided is factually accurate, truthful, and original, avoiding any form of plagiarism to maintain the authenticity and credibility of the application process.







Important - Please make sure that you fully complete the qualifications section in the application form. Applications submitted without details of degree studied, grades and credits (including predicted) will be discounted.







For more information on the roles, for a full candidate pack, and to apply, follow the Apply link, or the links below for Higher post:




Higher Statistical Data Scientist - https://www.civilservicejobs.service.gov.uk/csr/jobs.cgi?jcode=1915716
